en: The rebels attacked Kautukari village in the Chibok area of Borno on Tuesday evening, said residents. The attack happened at the same time that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was in the state to meet with survivors of jihadi violence.
ny: Oukirawo anaukira mudzi wa Kautukari m'dera la Chibok ku Borno Lachiwiri madzulo, atero anthu okhala kumeneko. Kuukira kumeneku kunachitika panthaŵi imodzimodziyo pamene Mlembi Wamkulu wa UN Antonio Guterres anali m'boma kukakumana ndi opulumuka chiwawa cha jihadi.

en: The Chibok area is 115 kilometers (71 miles) away from Maiduguri, the state capital, where Guterres met with former militants being reintegrated into society and thousands of people displaced by the insurgency.
ny: Chigawo cha Chibok chili pa mtunda wa makilomita 115 kuchokera ku Maiduguri, likulu la boma, kumene Guterres anakumana ndi omenyera nkhondo akale omwe akubwezeretsedwanso m'chitaganya ndi anthu zikwizikwi omwe anathaŵa kwawo chifukwa cha kupanduka.

en: "They came in large number with superior firepower (and) took over the community," said Hassan Chibok, a community leader. Troops from a nearby military base were deployed to repel the attack but "the damage had been done," Chibok said, adding that "casualties are up to 10."
ny: "Iwo anabwera ambiri ndi mphamvu ya moto apamwamba (ndipo) analanda mudzi", anati Hassan Chibok, mtsogoleri mudzi. asilikali kuchokera pafupi asilikali m'munsi anasamutsidwa kuthana ndi kuukira koma "kuwonongeka anali atachita", Chibok anati, kuwonjezera kuti "kufa ndi mpaka 10. "

en: Another resident Yana Galang said at least seven people were killed in the latest violence before the Nigerian military intervened.
ny: Munthu wina wa m'mudzimo, dzina lake Yana Galang, ananena kuti anthu osachepera asanu ndi aŵiri anaphedwa pa chiwawa chatsopanocho asanafike asilikali a ku Nigeria.

en: Nigerian police did not immediately respond to a request for confirmation of the attack.
ny: Apolisi a ku Nigeria sanayankhepo pempho loti atsimikizire kuti ndi kuukira.

en: Nigeria, Africa's most populous country with 206 million people, continues to grapple with a 10-year-old insurgency in the northeast by Islamic extremist rebels of Boko Haram and its offshoot, the Islamic State West Africa Province. The extremists are fighting to establish Shariah law and to stop Western education.
ny: Nigeria, dziko la anthu ambiri kwambiri ku Africa lokhala ndi anthu 206 miliyoni, likupitirizabe kulimbana ndi kupanduka kwa zaka 10 kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa asilikali a Boko Haram ndi nthambi yake, Islamic State West Africa Province.

en: More than 35,000 people have died and millions have been displaced by the extremist violence, according to the U.N. Development Program.
ny: Malinga ndi kunena kwa United Nations Development Program, anthu oposa 35,000 afa ndipo mamiliyoni ambiri athawa kwawo chifukwa cha chiwawa cha anthu ouma khosi.

en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari said earlier this week that the war against the extremists is "approaching its conclusion," citing continued military airstrikes and the mass defection of thousands of the fighters, some of whom analysts say are laying down their arms because of infighting within the jihadi group.
ny: Pulezidenti wa Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari, ananena koyambirira kwa sabata ino kuti nkhondo yolimbana ndi zigawenga "yakuyandikira mapeto ake", potchula kupitiriza kwa nkhondo za mlengalenga ndi kuthawa kwa asilikali ambirimbiri, ena mwa iwo akatswiri amati akuika pansi zida zawo chifukwa cha nkhondo zapakati pa gulu la jihadi.

en: The violence, however, continues in border communities and areas closer to the Lake Chad region, the stronghold of the Islamic State-linked group, ISWAP.
ny: Komabe, chiwawa chikupitirizabe m'madera a m'malire ndi madera oyandikana ndi dera la Nyanja ya Chad, malo achitetezo a gulu la ISWAP, logwirizana ndi gulu la Islamic State.

en: "Things are getting worse" in Kautukari village in Chibok and adjourning areas closer to the forest, said community leader Chibok, saying the extremists' presence near the forest is a contributing factor.
ny: "Zinthu zikuipiraipira" m'mudzi wa Kautukari ku Chibok ndi malo oyandikana ndi nkhalango, anatero mtsogoleri wa anthu a m'deralo Chibok, ponena kuti kupezeka kwa zigawenga pafupi ndi nkhalango ndi chinthu chochititsa chidwi.

en: Reporting Under Attack in South Sudan, Sudan
ny: Kufalitsa Nkhani Zokhudza Kuukiridwa ku South Sudan, Sudan

en: Journalists in both Sudan and South Sudan say threats, intimidation and arbitrary arrests are part of everyday life, limiting their ability to inform the public.
ny: Atolankhani a ku Sudan ndi South Sudan akuti kuopsezedwa, kuopsezedwa ndi kumangidwa mosalingalira ndi mbali ya moyo wa tsiku ndi tsiku, zomwe zimachepetsa kuthekera kwawo kudziwitsa anthu.

en: South Sudan ranks 128th and Sudan ranks 151st out of 180 countries in Reporters Without Borders annual World Press Freedom Index, released Tuesday to coincide with the United Nations annual recognition of World Press Freedom Day. The bigger the number, the worse the environment for news media.
ny: South Sudan ili pa nambala 128 ndipo Sudan ili pa nambala 151 pa mayiko 180 mu World Press Freedom Index ya bungwe la Reporters Without Borders, yomwe idatulutsidwa Lachiwiri kuti igwirizane ndi tsiku la United Nations la World Press Freedom Day.

en: Irene Ayaa of the Association for Media Development in South Sudan says government censorship in her country is widespread.
ny: Irene Ayaa wa Association for Media Development ku South Sudan akuti boma likuletsa anthu m'dziko lawo.

en: "Last month, we registered four articles removed from newspapers," she said.
ny: Iye anati: "Mwezi watha, tinalemba nkhani zinayi zimene zinachotsedwa m'manyuzipepala".

en: Between January and March alone, security personnel removed dozens of articles from the Juba Monitor, Anna Namiriano, editor-in-chief of an English-language daily, told South Sudan in Focus. "They removed stories and we left the space blank. They say why we are not listening to them, so on 17th of March, they suspended the newspaper."
ny: Pakati pa January ndi March okha, ogwira ntchito zachitetezo anachotsa nkhani zambiri mu nyuzipepala ya Juba Monitor, Anna Namiriano, mkonzi wamkulu wa nyuzipepala ya Chingelezi, anauza South Sudan mu Focus. "Iwo anachotsa nkhanizo ndipo tinasiya malo opanda kanthu. Iwo amati chifukwa chake sitimvetsera kwa iwo, kotero pa 17th March, iwo anaimitsa nyuzipepalayo".

en: In February, a handful of journalists were briefly detained for covering a press conference by opposition lawmakers in parliament. A Juba Monitor newspaper article about the incident was removed by security agents at the printing plant.
ny: Mu February, atolankhani ochepa amangidwa kwa kanthawi chifukwa cholemba nkhani za msonkhano wa atolankhani wa aphungu otsutsa m'parliament. Nkhani ya nyuzipepala ya Juba Monitor yokhudza nkhaniyi idachotsedwa ndi ogwira ntchito zachitetezo ku fakitale yosindikiza.

en: "We dont have freedom of the press in the country," Namiriano said. "The solution is let us do our work as media houses. We have the code of conduct, we have the media law to guide us, and removal of stories is really very bad."
ny: "Tilibe ufulu wa atolankhani m'dziko muno", anatero Namiriano. "Chithandizo ndi kuti tichite ntchito yathu monga nyumba zofalitsa nkhani. Tili ndi malamulo a khalidwe, tili ndi malamulo a atolankhani oti atitsogolere, ndipo kuchotsa nkhani ndi koipa kwambiri".

en: South Sudans information minister, Michael Makuei, insists press freedom is alive and well in his country.
ny: Nduna ya za chidziwitso ya South Sudan, Michael Makuei, akutsimikiza kuti ufulu wa atolankhani uli ndi moyo ndi wabwino m'dziko lake.

en: "South Sudan is the only place where journalists are free, where they enjoy absolute freedom according to the law. I say, 'according to the law,' because there is nothing absolute in this world," Makuei told South Sudan in Focus.
ny: "South Sudan ndi malo okhawo kumene atolankhani ali omasuka, kumene amasangalala ndi ufulu wonse malinga ndi lamulo. Ndikunena,'malinga ndi lamulo,' chifukwa palibe chinthu chenicheni m'dziko lino", Makuei anauza South Sudan mu Focus.

en: The United Nations Commission on Human Rights refutes that assertion. In a report issued last October, it said the government is harassing activists, journalists and their families, limiting their activities and targeting their work and finances. South Sudan is one of the most dangerous places in the world to be a journalist, according to the commission.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations Commission on Human Rights likukana zimenezi. Mu lipoti lomwe linatulutsidwa mu October, linati boma likuzunza anthu okonda zachiwawa, atolankhani ndi mabanja awo, kuchepetsa ntchito zawo ndi kuika ntchito zawo ndi ndalama zawo pachiswe. South Sudan ndi imodzi mwa malo oopsa kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi kuti munthu akhale mtolankhani, malinga ndi komitiyo.

en: "South Sudan has a lot of work to do to establish and solidify the institutions that are critical to a well-functioning democratic state," David Renz, charge daffaires for the U.S. Embassy in South Sudan, said in a statement Tuesday, adding that the U.S. remains deeply concerned about the state of press freedom in South Sudan.
ny: "South Sudan ili ndi ntchito yambiri yoti ichite kuti ikhazikitse ndi kulimbikitsa mabungwe omwe ndi ofunikira kuti boma la demokalase liziyenda bwino", anatero David Renz, woyang'anira ntchito za ofesi ya kazembe wa US ku South Sudan, m'mawu ake a Lachiwiri, powonjezera kuti US ikadali ndi nkhawa kwambiri ndi ufulu wa atolankhani ku South Sudan.

en: "We have seen some of the local radio stations shut down over very trivial matters," Renz said. "And we also are aware that journalists of radio and television and even social media are self-censored" and wary of local and national governments actions "to penalize journalists who say things the government would prefer that they not say."
ny: "Tawona mawailesi ena a m'deralo atsekedwa chifukwa cha nkhani zosafunika kwenikweni", anatero Renz. "Ndipo tikudziŵanso kuti atolankhani a wailesi ndi wailesi yakanema ngakhalenso a pa TV amadziletsa" ndipo amapewa zochita za maboma a m'deralo ndi a dziko "kudzilanga atolankhani amene amanena zinthu zimene boma lingakonde kuti asazinene".

en: Further complications from coup
ny: Mavuto ena chifukwa cha kuphulika kwa boma

en: In Sudan, journalists in the capital city of Khartoum say harassment and threats have increased since the October 25 military takeover.
ny: Ku Sudan, atolankhani mumzinda wa Khartoum, likulu la dzikolo, akunena kuti kuzunzidwa ndi kuwopseza kwawonjezeka chiyambire kulanda kwa asilikali pa October 25.

en: Shoggi Abdulazeem, an investigative journalist in Sudan, said he received a death threat in November and was warned not to speak to international media.
ny: Shoggi Abdulazeem, mtolankhani wofufuza nkhani ku Sudan, ananena kuti analandira chiopsezo cha imfa mu November ndipo anachenjezedwa kuti asayankhule ndi atolankhani apadziko lonse.

en: "I was hosting live on Al Jazeera and after leaving their office, eight armed security men followed me in a pickup. They surrounded my car," Abdulazeem said. He told South Sudan in Focus he was blindfolded and moved around "for more than two hours" and was ordered "not to criticize the military again."
ny: "Ndinali kutsogolera moyo pa Al Jazeera ndipo nditatuluka mu ofesi yawo, amuna asanu ndi atatu otetezeka ananditsatira mu galimoto. Iwo anazungulira galimoto yanga", Abdulazeem anati. Iye anauza South Sudan mu Focus kuti anali ndi maso omangidwa ndipo anasamuka "kwa maola oposa awiri" ndipo analamulidwa "kusatsutsa asilikali kachiwiri".

en: Covering pro-democracy protests in Sudan continues to be a dangerous endeavor, Abdulazeem said.
ny: Abdulazeem anati, kufotokoza za zionetsero za demokalase ku Sudan kukupitirizabe kukhala ntchito yoopsa.

en: "Many newspapers, TV channels and radio stations received directives not to host or conduct interviews with some named individuals" who criticize military leaders, Abdulazeem said. He added, "There are intelligence officers who are assigned to monitor this situation."
ny: "Manyuzipepala ambiri, ma TV ndi ma wailesi alandira malangizo kuti asatenge kapena kuchita zokambirana ndi anthu ena omwe amatchulidwa" omwe amatsutsa atsogoleri ankhondo, Abdulazeem adati. "Pali akuluakulu azamauthenga omwe apatsidwa ntchito yoyang'anira izi".

en: Aisha Assamani, an executive member of the independent Sudanese Media Network, told South Sudan in Focus he has recorded more than 10 attacks on journalists and media houses since last year's coup.
ny: Aisha Assamani, membala wamkulu wa Independent Sudanese Media Network, anauza South Sudan mu Focus kuti walembapo za kuukira kwa 10 kwa atolankhani ndi nyumba zofalitsa nkhani kuyambira pamene boma linagonjetsedwa chaka chatha.

en: "They are targeting freedom of speech with so much excessive force," Assamani said. "The majority of our journalists now are fearful and their lives are in danger. Most of them remain anonymous due to the danger of the situation."
ny: "Iwo akulimbana ndi ufulu wa kulankhula ndi mphamvu zambiri", Assamani anati. "Ambiri a atolankhani athu tsopano ali ndi mantha ndipo miyoyo yawo ili pangozi. Ambiri a iwo amakhalabe osadziwika chifukwa cha ngozi ya mkhalidwewo".

en: On December 30, Sudanese security forces stormed the offices of three television stations — al-Arabiya, al-Hadath and al-Sharq — firing tear gas, assaulting staff and destroying broadcast equipment, according to local news media. That same day, security forces detained al-Sharq correspondents Maha Al-Talb and Sally Othman for hours before releasing them.
ny: Pa December 30, chitetezo Sudanese asilikali anaukira maofesi a atatu TV siteshoni  al-Arabiya, al-Hadath ndi al-Sharq  kuwombera lacrimation mpweya, kuukira ndodo ndi kuwononga wailesi zipangizo, malinga ndi atolankhani m'deralo.

en: On January 16, Sudanese authorities withdrew the broadcast license of Al Jazeera Live and closed its office in Khartoum. A letter from the Information Ministry to the director of Al Jazeera television in Sudan attributed the closing to an "unprofessional approach" and media content that "harmed the countrys higher interests and national security." The Doha-based network condemned the closure.
ny: Pa January 16, akuluakulu a ku Sudan anachotsa chilolezo chofalitsa Al Jazeera Live ndi kutseka ofesi yake ku Khartoum. Kalata yochokera ku Unduna wa Zamalonda yopita kwa mkulu wa wailesi yakanema ya Al Jazeera ku Sudan inati kutsekedwa kwa "njira yosagwira ntchito" ndi zomwe zili m'ma TV zomwe "zinavulaza zofuna zapamwamba za dziko ndi chitetezo cha dziko".

en: In February, Sudanese authorities arrested a group of BBC reporters in Khartoum and questioned them for several hours before releasing them.
ny: Mu February, akuluakulu a boma la Sudan anamanga gulu la atolankhani a BBC ku Khartoum ndi kuwafunsa mafunso kwa maola angapo asanawamasule.

en: VOA repeatedly called Sudans government for comment, but those calls — to Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, press advisor to military leader Abdul Fattah al-Burhan — went unanswered.
ny: VOA inachitira maulendo angapo ku boma la Sudan kuti afotokozepo, koma maitanidwe amenewo  kwa Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, mlangizi wa atolankhani wa mtsogoleri wa asilikali Abdul Fattah al-Burhan  sanayankhidwe.

en: Michael Atit reported from Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng and Manyang David Mayar reported from Juba, South Sudan.
ny: Michael Atit anafotokoza kuchokera ku Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng ndi Manyang David Mayar anafotokoza kuchokera ku Juba, South Sudan.

en: At Least 30 Burundian AU Soldiers Killed in Al-Shabab Attack, Official Says
ny: Asilikali a ku Burundi a 30 a AU aphedwa pa kuukira kwa Al-Shabab, atero akuluakulu a boma

en: At least 30 Burundian soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in Tuesday's attack by al-Shabab militants on an African Union base in southern Somalia, according to a Burundian official.
ny: Asilikali osachepera 30 a ku Burundi anaphedwa ndipo ena 20 anavulala pa kuukira kwa Lachiwiri kwa omenyera nkhondo a al-Shabab pa msasa wa African Union kumwera kwa Somalia, malinga ndi mkulu wa ku Burundi.

en: The official, who requested anonymity because he is not allowed to speak to media, told VOA Somali that 10 soldiers died on the spot, and the rest of the soldiers succumbed to their wounds. He confirmed that other soldiers are still missing.
ny: Mkuluyo, yemwe anapempha kuti asatchulidwe dzina lake chifukwa sanaloledwe kulankhula ndi atolankhani, anauza VOA Somali kuti asilikali 10 anafa pomwepo, ndipo asilikali ena onse anafa ndi mabala awo.

en: Al-Shabab said it killed 173 soldiers in the attack on the AU base in the village of El-Baraf, about 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu. The casualty figure has not been independently verified. A separate source told VOA Somali that 161 soldiers were at the camp at the time of attack. The Burundian official confirmed that number.
ny: Al-Shabab adati adapha asitikali 173 pakuukira kwa AU m'mudzi wa El-Baraf, pafupifupi makilomita 150 kumpoto kwa Mogadishu. Chiwerengero cha omwe adaphedwa sichinawonetsedwe ndi boma. Gwero losiyana lidauza VOA Somali kuti asitikali 161 anali mumsasa panthawi yomwe adaukira. Woyang'anira ku Burundi adatsimikizira chiwerengerochi.

en: The Burundian official told VOA Somali that the soldiers had intelligence al-Shabab was gathering in a nearby village about 48 hours prior to the attack. He said the soldiers prepared to defend themselves and dug trenches.
ny: Mkulu wa ku Burundi anauza VOA Somali kuti asilikali anali ndi zidziwitso kuti al-Shabab anali kusonkhana m'mudzi wapafupi maola 48 asanachitike kuukira.

en: He said what caught the soldiers by surprise was the enormity of al-Shabab explosives detonated at the camp. He said the militants used three truck bombs, one of which fell into a ditch. He estimated the militants detonated about 20 kilograms of explosives, and that 450 militants overran the camp.
ny: Iye anati chimene chinatenga asilikali ndi kudabwa chinali kuchuluka kwa zinthu zophulika za al-Shabab zomwe zinaphulika kumsasa. Iye anati zigawengazo zinagwiritsa ntchito mabomba atatu a galimoto, imodzi mwa iyo inagwera m'dzenje. Iye akuti zigawengazo zinaphulitsa zinthu zophulika zokwana makilogalamu 20 ndipo zigawenga 450 zinagunda msasawo.

en: The official said the suicide truck bombs caused most of the casualties.
ny: Mkuluyo anati mabomba a galimoto yodzipha ndiwo anachititsa ambiri kuvulala.

en: Earlier, the government of Burundi reported 10 of their soldiers were killed, with five others missing and 25 injured. Burundi also said 20 al-Shabab militants were killed in the attack.
ny: Poyamba, boma la Burundi linati asilikali awo 10 anaphedwa, ndi ena asanu akusowa ndipo 25 anavulala. Burundi inatinso omenyera nkhondo a al-Shabab 20 anaphedwa mu kuukira.

en: On Twitter, Burundi President Evariste Ndayishimiye said there are no words strong enough to condemn the terrorist attack against the Burundian contingent. He wrote, "I join with all of Africa which has just lost sons and daughters … to console the hard-hit families."
ny: Pa Twitter, Pulezidenti wa Burundi Evariste Ndayishimiye anati palibe mawu okwanira kutsutsa chigawenga choukira gulu la Burundian. Iye analemba kuti, "Ndimagwirizana ndi Africa yonse yomwe yangotaya ana ake... kuti atonthoze mabanja omwe akhudzidwa kwambiri".

en: The African Union, the Somali government and the embassy of the United States in Mogadishu have all strongly condemned the al-Shabab attack.
ny: African Union, boma la Somalia ndi ofesi ya kazembe wa United States ku Mogadishu onsewo anatsutsa mwamphamvu chigaŵenga cha al-Shabab.

en: AU chief Moussa Faki Mahamat paid tribute to the Burundian soldiers killed, and said the "heinous" attack will not lessen support of AU forces to Somalia.
ny: Mkulu wa AU Moussa Faki Mahamat anapereka ulemu kwa asilikali a ku Burundi omwe anaphedwa, ndipo anati kuukira "koipitsitsa" sikudzachepetsa thandizo la magulu a AU ku Somalia.

en: The Somali ministry of foreign affairs called on the international community to increase and provide higher-end capability to Somali security forces and AU forces so they can effectively combat terrorism in Somalia.
ny: Unduna wa zamayiko akunja wa Somalia wapempha mayiko kuti awonjezere mphamvu za asilikali a chitetezo cha Somalia ndi a AU kuti athe kulimbana ndi uchigawenga ku Somalia.

en: The U.S. embassy in Mogadishu said the U.S. extends condolences to the families of the troops killed and wished a quick recovery to those injured.
ny: Kazembe wa United States ku Mogadishu ananena kuti United States ikupereka chisoni kwa mabanja a asilikali omwe anaphedwa ndipo ikufuna kuti anthu ovulala achire msanga.

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, told VOA that Tuesday's fighting at the camp was the heaviest the area has seen.
ny: Meya wa El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, anauza VOA kuti nkhondo ya Lachiwiri kumsasawo inali yoopsa kwambiri imene dera limenelo lakhala likuona.

en: "Fighting like this never happened in this area," he said, explaining that the violence also killed two civilians and injured 10 others. "It was heavy fighting."
ny: "Kuthana kotereku sikunachitikepo m'dera lino", iye anatero, akumalongosola kuti chiwawacho chinaphanso anthu wamba aŵiri ndi kuvulaza ena 10. "Kunali kukangana kwakukulu".

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
ny: Chochitikacho chinali choyamba chachikulu cha al-Shabab kuukira mphamvu za AU kuyambira pamene ntchitoyo inasintha dzina ndi machitidwe ake mwezi watha.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia, gave it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to the Somali government. The mission's mandate runs through the end of 2024.
ny: Bungwe la UN Security Council, lomwe linapereka chilolezo ku ntchito yatsopano yotchedwa African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia, linapatsa ntchitoyi kuti ichepetse chiopsezo chochokera ku al-Shabab, kuthandizira kulimbikitsa mphamvu za chitetezo cha Somalia ndi kuchita gawo la magawo a chitetezo ku boma la Somalia. Ntchito ya ntchitoyi ikupita kumapeto kwa 2024.

en: This story comes from VOA's Somali and Central African services.
ny: Nkhaniyi ikuchokera ku mautumiki a VOA a ku Somalia ndi Central Africa.

en: Kenya Trains Domestic Workers in Middle East About Rights
ny: Dziko la Kenya Likuphunzitsa Antchito a M'nyumba a ku Middle East za Ufulu Wawo

en: Kenyan authorities are training domestic workers who accept jobs in the Middle East about their rights after years of reported abuses there, including beatings, rapes and deaths.
ny: Akuluakulu a dziko la Kenya akuphunzitsa antchito apanyumba amene amalandira ntchito ku Middle East za ufulu wawo pambuyo pa zaka zambiri za nkhanza zomwe zanenedwa kumeneko, kuphatikizapo kumenyedwa, kugwiriridwa ndi imfa.

en: It's been a year since Bernard Njenga learned his wife, Esther Thuku, had died in Saudi Arabia, where she had been a domestic worker for three years.
ny: Patha chaka kuchokera pamene Bernard Njenga anadziŵa kuti mkazi wake, Esther Thuku, anamwalira ku Saudi Arabia, kumene anali wantchito wa m'nyumba kwa zaka zitatu.

en: Saudi authorities reported that his wife had committed suicide at her employer's home, Njenga said, but he believes the mother of four was murdered.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku Saudi ananenanso kuti mkazi wake anadzipha kunyumba kwa abwana ake, Njenga anati, koma amakhulupirira kuti mayi wa ana anayi anaphedwa.

en: Njenga said his wife's body did not have any marks that would show that she had hanged herself. It appeared the body had been buried because it was very dirty and looked like she had been stabbed on the left side, he added.
ny: Njenga adati thupi la mkazi wake silinali ndi zizindikiro zomwe zikanasonyeza kuti adadzipachika. Zikuwoneka kuti thupi lidayikidwa chifukwa linali lonyansa kwambiri ndipo limawoneka ngati kuti adabedwa kumanzere, adaonjeza.

en: Kenyan authorities say that since November, at least 23 domestic workers have died while working in the Middle East. Most of those deaths occurred in Saudi Arabia, according to labor officials.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma la Kenya akuti kuyambira mu November, anthu osachepera 23 amene amagwira ntchito zapakhomo afa pamene anali kugwira ntchito ku Middle East.

en: Saudi authorities have reported that all 23 of those deaths resulted from cardiac arrest.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku Saudi anena kuti onse 23 a anthu amene anafawo anafa chifukwa cha kuima kwa mtima.

en: In April of 2020, rights advocacy group Amnesty International reported that Kenyans who have jobs as domestic workers in the Middle East often complain of lack of payment, forced labor, physical abuse, rape and dangerous working conditions.
ny: Mu April 2020, bungwe loona za ufulu wa anthu la Amnesty International linati anthu a ku Kenya omwe amagwira ntchito ngati antchito apakhomo ku Middle East nthawi zambiri amadandaula kuti salipidwa, amagwira ntchito yokakamiza, amazunzidwa, kugwiriridwa komanso amagwira ntchito moopsa.

en: Now, Kenya is offering safety training for domestic workers who take jobs abroad.
ny: Tsopano, Kenya ikupereka maphunziro a chitetezo kwa antchito apanyumba amene amapita kukagwira ntchito kunja.

en: "When you don't train them, basically, you are exposing them to a lot of exploitation and abuse," said Edith Murogo, director at East Africa Institute of Homecare Management in Nairobi. "Part of the training also includes labor rights awareness. They have to know how to bargain and talk to employees about decent terms and conditions of employment."
ny: "Ngati simuphunzitsa ana, ndiye kuti mukuwachititsa kuti azizunzidwa kwambiri", anatero Edith Murogo, mkulu wa bungwe la East Africa Institute of Home Care Management ku Nairobi. "Mbali ina ya maphunzirowo imaphatikizapo kudziŵa za ufulu wa antchito.

en: An estimated 30,000 Kenyans migrate to the Middle East to find work each year.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 30,000 a ku Kenya amapita ku Middle East chaka chilichonse kuti akapeze ntchito.

en: Kenya's cabinet secretary for labor, Simon Chelugui, said his department is working with Saudi officials on labor law reforms.
ny: Mlembi wa nduna ya boma la Kenya pa ntchito, Simon Chelugui, anati dipatimenti yake ikugwira ntchito ndi akuluakulu a ku Saudi pa kusintha malamulo a ntchito.

en: "We would want them also to upscale their law to protect workers and employers equally, not to discriminate and have the attitude of the employer is right always," Chelugui said. "Number two is the pay is reasonable and commensurate to the work."
ny: "Tikufuna kuti iwo ayambenso kukweza malamulo awo kuti ateteze antchito ndi abwana mofanana, kuti asamachite tsankho ndipo kuti abwana azikhala ndi maganizo oyenera nthawi zonse", anatero Chelugui. "Nambala yachiwiri ndi malipiro oyenera komanso oyenera ntchito".

en: VOA reached out to the Saudi embassy in Nairobi for comment on alleged mistreatment and deaths of Kenyan workers. In an email response, the embassy said the kingdom does not condone illegal and ill treatment of anyone and said Riyadh is working with Nairobi to protect citizens from any offense.
ny: VOA inalumikizana ndi ofesi ya kazembe wa Saudi ku Nairobi kuti afotokoze za nkhanza ndi imfa za antchito a ku Kenya. Mu yankho la imelo, ofesi ya kazembeyo inati ufumuwo sulekerera nkhanza ndi nkhanza za aliyense ndipo inati Riyadh ikugwira ntchito ndi Nairobi kuteteza nzika ku nkhanza zilizonse.

en: Meanwhile, officials say with an estimated 2 million young people graduating each year, according to national figures, and only about 800,000 new jobs, many Kenyans will continue to go abroad to find work.
ny: Panthaŵi imodzimodziyo, akuluakulu a boma akunena kuti ndi achinyamata pafupifupi 2 miliyoni omwe amaliza maphunziro awo chaka chilichonse, malinga ndi ziŵerengero za dziko, ndipo ndi ntchito zatsopano pafupifupi 800,000 zokha, anthu ambiri a ku Kenya adzapitiriza kupita kunja kukafuna ntchito.

en: South Africa Urges Africa’s First COVID-19 Vaccine Plant to Keep Its Doors Open
ny: South Africa Ilimbikitsa Africa's First COVID-19 Vaccine Plant kuti Isunge zitseko zake zotseguka

en: South African health officials are urging COVID-19 vaccine manufacturer Aspen to keep its plant in the Eastern Cape province open. This follows a Reuters article quoting Aspens senior director saying they may have to shut down as there have been no orders for their rebranded COVID vaccine.
ny: Akuluakulu azaumoyo ku South Africa akulimbikitsa kampani yopanga katemera wa COVID-19 Aspen kuti isunge fakitale yake m'chigawo cha Eastern Cape. Izi zikutsatira nkhani ya Reuters yomwe ikufotokoza za mkulu wa Aspens akunena kuti atha kutseka chifukwa palibe malamulo a katemera wawo wa COVID.

en: A South African-owned subsidiary of pharmaceutical giant Aspen struck a deal with American company Johnson & Johnson in March to package, price, sell and distribute its vaccine in Africa.
ny: Kampani ina ya ku South Africa ya Aspen, yomwe ndi kampani yaikulu kwambiri yopanga mankhwala, inagwirizana ndi kampani ya ku America yotchedwa Johnson & Johnson mu March kuti ipange katemera wake, kumugulitsa, kugulitsa, ndi kumugawira ku Africa.

en: This vaccine was rebranded as Aspenovax.
ny: Katemera ameneyu anasinthidwa dzina kukhala Aspenovax.

en: The move was hailed by many as there had been much concern about Africas reliance on imported vaccines which were often costly and at times in short supply.
ny: Anthu ambiri anayamikira kwambiri zimenezi chifukwa chakuti anthu a ku Africa ankada nkhawa kwambiri kuti anthu a m'mayikowo azidalira katemera wochokera kunja, amene nthawi zambiri amakhala okwera mtengo ndipo nthawi zina amakhala ochepa.

en: But there have been no orders for Aspenovax. South Africas National Health Department Spokesperson Foster Mohale said the lack of orders is due to low vaccination rates not only at home, but globally.
ny: Koma palibe amene wapereka lamulo la katemera wa Aspenovax. Mneneri wa Dipatimenti ya Zaumoyo ku South Africa, Foster Mohale, anati kusowa kwa lamuloli n'chifukwa cha kuchepa kwa katemera osati m'dziko lathu lokha, komanso padziko lonse.

en: "Vaccine hesitancy is one of the factors which contribute to these low vaccination rates or demand for more vaccines which also affect the production. Because obviously we understand that they are in a business, they cant keep on producing vaccines when they know that the demand for vaccines is very low. So, we understand the situation where they are, and we sympathize with them," he said.
ny: "Kukayikira katemera ndi chimodzi mwazinthu zomwe zimapangitsa kuti anthu azilandira katemera wochepa kapena kufuna katemera wochulukirapo, zomwe zimakhudzanso kupanga. Chifukwa mwachidziwikire timamvetsetsa kuti ali mu bizinesi, sangathe kupitiliza kupanga katemera pomwe akudziwa kuti kufunika kwa katemera ndi kochepa kwambiri. Chifukwa chake, timamvetsetsa momwe alili, ndipo timawamvera chisoni", adatero.

en: Mohale said for now, South Africa has enough vaccines. He adds that in March, 100,000 vaccines expired. And more are due to expire in June and July.
ny: Mohale adati pakadali pano, South Africa ili ndi katemera wokwanira. Iye akuwonjezera kuti mu March, katemera 100,000 adatha. Ndipo ena ambiri akuyenera kutha mu June ndi July.

en: However, he said that Aspens vaccine plant is important because no one knows what the future holds.
ny: Komabe, iye anati chomera cha katemera cha Aspens nchofunika chifukwa palibe amene akudziwa zimene zidzachitike m'tsogolo.

en: "We will try to engage them not to rush their decision precisely because we anticipate especially our scientists, our epidemiologists, we anticipate that the fifth wave might hit the country, South Africa, during the winter season which is a few weeks away from now. As you can see the number of daily COVID-19 patients has been rising for the past seven days," he said.
ny: "Tiyesa kuwalimbikitsa kuti asamafulumire kusankha kwawo chifukwa makamaka asayansi athu, akatswiri athu a matenda, tikuganiza kuti funde lachisanu lingagwere dziko la South Africa, nthawi yachisanu yomwe yatsala milungu ingapo kuchokera pano. Monga mukuwonera kuchuluka kwa odwala tsiku ndi tsiku a COVID-19 kwakhala kukukwera masiku asanu ndi awiri apitawa, "adatero.

en: Professor Petro Terblanche, who is the managing director of South African company, Afrigen, which in a continent-first made an mRNA COVID vaccine using Modernas data — said the situation at Aspen is a tragedy for the industry.
ny: Pulofesa Petro Terblanche, yemwe ndi mkulu wa kampani ya ku South Africa, Afrigen, yomwe idapanga katemera wa mRNA COVID koyamba m'dzikoli pogwiritsa ntchito deta ya Modernas  adati zomwe zachitika ku Aspen ndi tsoka kwa makampani.

en: "This is just indicating again how important it is that this continent looks at policy reform. This is about how are we going to make sure that we give preferential procurement to local companies. How are we going to make sure that we create a marketplace and eco-system that will absorb local capacity? Otherwise, we will not have capacity locally in a sustainable manner and were going to get the next pandemic and we will be unprepared, and we will not have health security," said Terblanche.
ny: "Izi zikungosonyeza kuti ndikofunikira kuti dziko lino liyang'ane kusintha kwa mfundo. Izi zikukhudzana ndi momwe tingaonetsere kuti tikupatsa mwayi wopeza makampani am'deralo. Kodi tionetsetsa bwanji kuti tapanga msika ndi eco-system yomwe ingatenge mphamvu zakomweko? Apo ayi sitikhala ndi mphamvu kwanuko m'njira yodalirika ndipo tikadakhala ndi mliri wotsatira ndipo sitikhala okonzeka, ndipo sitikhala ndi chitetezo chamankhwala", adatero Terblanche.

en: She believes money should also be put into educating people on the importance of vaccines.
ny: Iye amakhulupirira kuti ndalama ziyenera kugwiritsidwanso ntchito pophunzitsa anthu za kufunika kwa katemera.

en: "We need to ensure that we also put effort into advocacy for vaccination. Because we now have 17% of the continent that is vaccinated. We need to get them to at least 40% to ensure that we fully arrest this pandemic," she said.
ny: "Tiyenera kuonetsetsa kuti tikuyesetsanso kulimbikitsa katemera. Chifukwa tsopano tili ndi 17% ya kontinenti yomwe yatemera. Tiyenera kuwafikitsa ku 40% kuti tiwonetsetse kuti taletsa mliriwu", adatero.

en: Mohale was unable to say when the Health Department would be meeting with Aspens executives.
ny: Mohale sanathe kunena kuti Dipatimenti ya Zaumoyo idzakumana liti ndi akuluakulu a Aspens.

en: Journalists in Ethiopia Say Press Freedom is at 'Crossroads'
ny: Atolankhani ku Ethiopia Anati Ufulu wa Mtolankhani Uli pa 'Mphambano'

en: When Ethiopia's Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed took office four years ago, Reporters Without Borders, a Paris-based group that promotes press freedom, raised Ethiopia's ranking in its international press freedom index by 40 places.
ny: Pamene Nduna Yaikulu ya Ethiopia Abiy Ahmed anayamba ntchito zaka zinayi zapitazo, bungwe la Reporters Without Borders, lomwe lili ku Paris ndipo limalimbikitsa ufulu wa atolankhani, linakweza malo a dziko la Ethiopia m'ndandanda wa mayiko onse wa ufulu wa atolankhani ndi malo 40.

en: It was a giant leap forward after decades of media repression by the state. But since the war between federal government forces and rebels in the Tigray region began in late 2020, Ethiopia has dropped in the rankings.
ny: Chinali chinthu chachikulu kwambiri pambuyo pa zaka makumi angapo za kuponderezedwa kwa atolankhani ndi boma. Koma kuyambira pomwe nkhondo pakati pa magulu aboma ndi zigawenga mdera la Tigray idayamba kumapeto kwa 2020, Ethiopia idatsika pamndandanda.

en: To mark World Press Freedom Day 2022, VOA spoke to Ethiopian journalists about how free they feel to carry out their work.
ny: Pofuna kukondwerera Tsiku la Ufulu wa Ofalitsa Nkhani Padziko Lonse la 2022, VOA inalankhula ndi atolankhani a ku Ethiopia za mmene amamvera kuti ali ndi ufulu wochita ntchito yawo.

en: Elias Meseret, who worked with the Associated Press, told VOA that press freedom in Ethiopia is at a crossroads.
ny: Elias Meseret, yemwe anagwira ntchito ndi Associated Press, anauza VOA kuti ufulu wa atolankhani ku Ethiopia uli pa mphambano.

en: "Overall, I can say that lack of professionalism and also extreme views have become the hallmarks of the state of the media in Ethiopia, at this point in time," Elias said. "For this to change, I think the government has a responsibility to let media professionals do their job freely. This means without any harassment and intimidation."
ny: "Kukakhala kuti nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za anthu a m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi nkhani za m'mabuku, anthu a m'mabuku ndi a m'mabuku ndi a nkhani za m'mabuku".

en: Assegid Mulugeta, a radio presenter for the government-owned broadcaster, the Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, or EBC, thinks press freedom has improved in recent years. In 2018, the prime minister released all journalists from prison, However, that progress has since been reversed according to Ethiopian journalists, who documented that 46 journalists were detained in the country in 2021, making Ethiopia one of the worst jailers of journalists in Africa.
ny: Assegid Mulugeta, woulutsa wailesi wa boma, Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, kapena EBC, akuganiza kuti ufulu wa atolankhani wasintha mzaka zaposachedwa. Mu 2018, nduna yayikulu idatulutsa atolankhani onse kundende, Komabe, kupita patsogolo kumeneku kwasinthidwa malinga ndi atolankhani aku Ethiopia, omwe adalemba kuti atolankhani 46 adasungidwa mdzikolo mu 2021, ndikupangitsa Ethiopia kukhala m'modzi mwa omwe amasunga atolankhani kwambiri ku Africa.

en: The state-backed Ethiopian Human Rights Commission released a statement Tuesday expressing concern for journalist Gobeze Sisay, whose whereabouts are unknown since plainclothes officers arrested him on Sunday.
ny: Boma lothandizidwa ndi bungwe la Ethiopian Human Rights Commission linatulutsa chikalata Lachiwiri posonyeza nkhawa ndi mtolankhani Gobeze Sisay, yemwe malo ake sakudziwika kuyambira pamene apolisi ovala ngati asilikali anamugwira Lamlungu.

en: Another journalist, Amir Aman Kiyaro, and his colleague Thomas Engida were arrested in November and released in March. But they still may face years in prison if convicted of violating the country's wartime state of emergency law and anti-terrorism law.
ny: Mtolankhani wina, Amir Aman Kiyaro, ndi mnzake Thomas Engida anamangidwa mu November ndipo anamasulidwa mu March. Koma iwo angakumane ndi zaka zambiri m'ndende ngati atapezeka olakwa chifukwa chophwanya lamulo la dziko la nkhondo ndi lamulo loletsa uchigawenga.

en: Still, radio presenter Assegid said he sees improvement.
ny: Komabe, mlangizi wa wailesi Assegid anati akuona kusintha.

en: Under the pre-2018 government where the Tigray People's Liberation Front political party dominated, he said, there were "lots of stifling systems, there was lots of censorship, there was beating of journalists, there was lots of pressures and censorship against journalists and now we are seeing the booming of YouTube and online media … this is a good thing to hear."
ny: Pansi pa boma lisanafike 2018 pomwe chipani cha ndale cha Tigray People's Liberation Front chinali cholamulira, adati, panali "machitidwe ambiri opondereza, panali kuwunika kwambiri, panali kumenya atolankhani, panali kukakamizidwa ndi kuwunika kwambiri atolankhani ndipo tsopano tikuwona kukula kwa YouTube ndi media pa intaneti... ndi chinthu chabwino kumva. "

en: Sisay Sahlu, editor at The Reporter, a private newspaper based in Addis Ababa, said independent media often get stonewalled by the government.
ny: Sisay Sahlu, mkonzi wa nyuzipepala ya The Reporter, yomwe ili ku Addis Ababa, anati boma kaŵirikaŵiri limaletsa atolankhani odziimira okha.

en: "My experience and the experience of my friends from public media is totally different," he said. "As a private newspaper employee, it's tough to get information for me."
ny: Iye anati: "Zimene ndakumana nazo ndi zimene anzanga a m'magazini a boma akumana nazo n'zosiyana kwambiri.

en: Sisay said that for a simple story, he might call 10 officials, who all may be unwilling to answer his questions.
ny: Sisay anati kuti nkhani yosavuta, iye angaitane akuluakulu 10, amene onse angakhale osafuna kuyankha mafunso ake.

en: "When you call them, they don't give us any clue," he said. "We write a letter to them, they are not talking. Finally, when we publish [the story], they are coming to our office. Sometimes they are on the phone and start a verbal fight. Either they are giving us information or not."
ny: "Mukamawaimbira foni, samatipatsa chidziŵitso chilichonse", iye anatero. "Timawalembera kalata, samalankhula. Pomalizira pake, pamene timafalitsa [nkhaniyo], amabwera ku ofesi yathu. Nthaŵi zina amakhala pafoni ndi kuyamba kukangana.

en: A government spokesman was not immediately available for comment.
ny: Mneneri wa boma sanapezeke kuti afotokoze.

en: In the latest World Press Freedom Index, Ethiopia is ranked 114th, down 13 places from its ranking in 2021.
ny: M'ndandanda waposachedwapa wa World Press Freedom Index, dziko la Ethiopia lili pa nambala 114, kutsika ndi malo 13 poyerekeza ndi m'chaka cha 2021.

en: Editor's note: The story has been updated with additional information about the arrests of journalists.
ny: Chidziwitso cha mkonzi: Nkhaniyi yasinthidwa ndi mfundo zina zokhudza kumangidwa kwa atolankhani.

en: As Tigray Aid Blockade Continues, Nearby Areas Also in Desperate Need of Food, Medicine
ny: Pamene Chiletso cha Tigray Aid Chikupitiriza, Madera Apafupi Nawo Akufunikiradi Chakudya, Mankhwala

en: Despite Ethiopias declared humanitarian cease-fire with Tigrayan rebels, aid groups said they are struggling to get food and medicine to those in need. Even outside the worst affected areas in Tigray, which are off limits to reporters, providing aid is fraught with risks and challenges.
ny: Ngakhale kuti dziko la Ethiopia linalengeza kuti likhala ndi mphamvu zothandiza anthu kuti asiye kumenya nkhondo ndi zigawenga za ku Tigray, mabungwe othandiza anthu akuti akuvutika kuti apeze chakudya ndi mankhwala kwa anthu osowa.

en: In Ethiopias northern Amhara region, burned tanks and other ruined military equipment lie at the roadside four months after occupying forces of the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, or TPLF, left the area. As the region recovers from a brutal civil war, the U.N. said some 9.4 million people in the Amhara region and neighboring Afar and Tigray regions need humanitarian assistance. But aid has been slow to arrive.
ny: M'chigawo cha Amhara chakumpoto kwa Ethiopia, akasinja oyaka ndi zida zina zankhondo zowonongeka zili m'mbali mwa msewu miyezi inayi pambuyo poti magulu ogonjetsa a Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, kapena TPLF, achoka m'derali. Pamene derali likuchira ku nkhondo yankhondo yankhondo, UN yati anthu pafupifupi 9.4 miliyoni m'chigawo cha Amhara ndi madera oyandikana nawo a Afar ndi Tigray amafunikira thandizo la anthu. Koma thandizo lafika pang'onopang'ono.

en: Seventeen-year-old Ahmed Nuru was living in the Oromia region, but said he had to flee after facing persecution for his Amhara ethnicity. He lost his mother when he was young. Last year, his father died after being unable to get lifesaving treatment due to the wars impact on the local health care system.
ny: Ahmed Nuru wazaka 17 ankakhala m'chigawo cha Oromia, koma adati adathawa chifukwa chozunzidwa chifukwa cha mtundu wake wa Amhara. Adataya amayi ake ali wamng'ono. Chaka chatha, abambo ake adamwalira atalephera kulandira chithandizo chothandiza chifukwa cha nkhondo zomwe zidakhudza njira zamankhwala zakomweko.

en: Now, Nuru is left to take care of his sisters, ages 10 and 8. He said life is very difficult and doesnt know how he will be able to raise his sisters.
ny: Tsopano, Nuru watsala kuti asamalire alongo ake, azaka 10 ndi 8. Iye anati moyo ndi wovuta kwambiri ndipo sakudziwa mmene angalerere alongo ake.

en: Daniel Tigabu, a public health officer based in the camp for the displaced where Ahmed lives, said there is not enough medical equipment or medicine. The center is running out of basic medical kits, as well as a shortage of kits for malaria, hepatitis and HIV testing.
ny: Daniel Tigabu, mkulu wa zaumoyo wa anthu amene ali m'misasa ya anthu othaŵa kwawo kumene Ahmed amakhala, anati palibe zipangizo zokwanira kapena mankhwala.

en: Tens of thousands live in camps for the displaced in the Amhara region. Others live in host communities, like Tsgenet Tibebu, who lost her husband during the conflict with the TPLF.
ny: Anthu zikwizikwi amakhala m'misasa ya anthu othaŵa kwawo m'chigawo cha Amhara. Ena amakhala m'madera amene anthuwo akukhala, monga Tsgenet Tibebu, amene mwamuna wake anamwalira pa nkhondo ndi TPLF.

en: Tibebu said she and her son rely on what her husbands friends provide as charity, which includes a room to stay in. As tears begin to flow, she said she is a housewife who has nothing and is waiting for support to help her raise her two children. She believes she should pay rent even though the owners have given her a place to stay. She wonders how she can plan for the future when she has nothing.
ny: Tibebu adati iye ndi mwana wake amadalira zomwe abwenzi a amuna ake amapereka ngati zachifundo, zomwe zimaphatikizapo chipinda chokhalamo. Pamene misozi ikuyamba kutuluka, adati iye ndi mayi wapanyumba yemwe alibe chilichonse ndipo akuyembekezera thandizo kuti amuthandize kulera ana ake awiri. Amakhulupirira kuti ayenera kulipira lendi ngakhale eni ake amupatsa malo okhala. Amadzifunsa momwe angakonzekerere mtsogolo pomwe alibe chilichonse.

en: Mulugeta Kebede, an aid worker who works in the Hayk camp, spoke to VOA and said stories like Nurus and Tibebus are not uncommon across Amhara.
ny: Mulugeta Kebede, wantchito wothandiza anthu amene amagwira ntchito m'ndende ya Hayk, analankhula ndi VOA ndipo anati nkhani ngati za Nurus ndi Tibebus si zachilendo ku Amhara konse.

en: He said the situation makes aid workers cry day and night. He said if someone is hungry, they cant sleep because they think about their empty stomach. He said he has seen displaced people sell pans or mattresses to surved and added that the situation is at a critical stage.
ny: Iye adati mkhalidwewo umapangitsa ogwira ntchito zothandiza kulira usana ndi usiku. Iye adati ngati wina ali ndi njala, sangathe kugona chifukwa amaganiza za m'mimba mwake. Iye adati adawona anthu omwe adasamutsidwa kugulitsa mbale kapena matiresi kuti apulumuke ndipo adati mkhalidwewo uli pachiwopsezo.

en: About 30,000 people displaced by conflict live just north of Hayk, in Weldiya. A local government representative, Habtemariam Assefa, North Wollo Zone spokesperson, said there was a little support shortly after TPLF left, after the area had been a conflict zone for months. But, he said, aid has been distributed only twice since and the aid provided by the U.N. or the federal government is not enough.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 30,000 omwe anathawa kwawo chifukwa cha nkhondo amakhala kumpoto kwa Hayk, ku Weldiya. Woimira boma laderalo, Habtemariam Assefa, mneneri wa North Wollo Zone, adati panali thandizo pang'ono TPLF itangochoka, pambuyo poti derali lakhala mdera lankhondo kwa miyezi ingapo. Koma, adati, thandizo lidagawidwa kawiri kokha kuyambira pamenepo ndipo thandizo lomwe UN kapena boma la feduro limapereka silokwanira.

en: North of the Amhara region, in Tigray where journalists are banned from entering, the U.N. said the situation is worse, with famine-like conditions. Tigray is under a de facto humanitarian blockade, according to the U.N.
ny: Kumpoto kwa dera la Amhara, ku Tigray komwe atolankhani saloledwa kulowa, UN yati zinthu zikuipiraipira, ndi zinthu zofanana ndi njala. Tigray ili pansi pa kutsekedwa kwaumunthu, malinga ndi UN.

en: For now, all Ahmed Nuru and his sisters can do is try to scrape by and hope more assistance arrives soon.
ny: Pakadali pano, zonse zimene Ahmed Nuru ndi alongo ake angachite ndi kuyesa kupulumuka ndi kuyembekezera kuti thandizo lina lidzafika posachedwa.

en: State Group Investigates Video Allegedly Showing Abuse by Ethiopian Army
ny: Gulu la Boma Likufufuza Vidiyo Imene Akuti Ndi Yoonetsa Nkhanza za Asilikali a ku Ethiopia

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission is investigating a video shared online that appears to show government troops abusing and shooting an ethnic Tigrayan boy.
ny: Komiti ya Ufulu Wachibadwidwe ya ku Ethiopia ikufufuza za vidiyo imene inafalitsidwa pa Intaneti imene ikuoneka kuti ikusonyeza asilikali a boma akuzunza ndi kuwombera mnyamata wa mtundu wa Tigrayan.

en: The four-minute video shows an alleged ethnic Tigray teenager being surrounded by men in Ethiopian army uniforms. The forces are seen abusing the boy, who they refer to as being from Abbi Adi, a location in the northern Tigray region of Ethiopia.
ny: Vidiyo ya mphindi zinayi ikuwonetsa wachinyamata wa mtundu wa Tigray atazunguliridwa ndi amuna ovala yunifolomu ya asilikali a Ethiopia.

en: In response to a query from VOA, the state-run Human Rights Commission said it was "gathering information regarding the incident."
ny: Poyankha funso la VOA, bungwe la boma loona za ufulu wa anthu linanena kuti linali "kusonkhanitsa chidziwitso chokhudza chochitikacho".

en: In the video, the boy, with blood on his face, is seen sitting while the men in uniform surround him and threaten him with death. One of the men in uniforms calls for the boy to suffer rather than being killed immediately.
ny: Mu vidiyoyo, mnyamatayo, ali ndi magazi pankhope pake, akuoneka atakhala pamene amuna ovala yunifolomu akum'zinga ndi kumuwopseza ndi imfa.

en: They tell a teenage girl to forcefully feed the boy. Finally, one man steps forward and shoots the boy, and the video ends.
ny: Kenako, munthu wina akubwera ndi kuwombera mnyamatayo, ndipo vidiyoyo yatha.

en: VOA cannot independently verify the location of the incident or the identities of the individuals in the footage. Asked about the video, both the Ethiopian government communication minister and Ethiopian ministry of defense spokesperson declined to comment.
ny: VOA silingathe kutsimikizira malo omwe zinthu zinachitikira kapena kuti anthu omwe ali m'vidiyoyi ndi ndani. Atafunsidwa za vidiyoyi, nduna yoona za kulankhulana ya boma la Ethiopia ndi mneneri wa unduna wa zachitetezo wa dziko la Ethiopia anakana kupereka ndemanga.

en: A similar incident was reported by rights groups in January 2021 in which Ethiopian army members were seen executing a number of civilians in Mahibere Dego, in central Tigray.
ny: Nkhani yofanana ndi imeneyi inanenedwa ndi magulu omenyera ufulu wa anthu mu January 2021 pamene asilikali a ku Ethiopia anaonedwa akupha anthu wamba ku Mahibere Dego, m'chigawo chapakati cha Tigray.

en: Rights group Amnesty International has verified the killing of 11 civilians in that incident.
ny: Gulu la ufulu wa anthu la Amnesty International latsimikizira kuti anthu 11 anaphedwa pa ngozi imeneyo.

en: Forces from the rebel Tigray People's Liberation Front also have been accused of committing human rights violations. In February 2022, Amnesty International reported that TPLF forces and their affiliates have killed more than a dozen people and gang raped women in towns of the Amhara region they occupied.
ny: Mu February 2022, bungwe la Amnesty International linati gulu la TPLF ndi mabungwe ake apha anthu oposa khumi ndi awiri ndipo agwiririra akazi m'matauni a m'chigawo cha Amhara chomwe iwowo anali atagwira.

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission recently reported that more than 740 civilians were killed in the Tigray war between July 2021 and March 2022.
ny: Bungwe loona za ufulu wachibadwidwe la Ethiopia posachedwapa linanena kuti anthu wamba oposa 740 anaphedwa pankhondo ya ku Tigray pakati pa July 2021 ndi March 2022.

en: Both the government and the TPLF deny accusations of rights violations, saying their operations do not target civilians.
ny: Boma ndi TPLF onsewa akukana milandu yozunza ufulu, ponena kuti ntchito zawo sizikukhudza anthu wamba.

en: Disinformation, Censorship, Trigger Global Retreat of Press Freedom
ny: Kupotoza Chidziwitso, Kuletsa, Kuyambitsa Kutha kwa Ufulu wa Nkhani Padziko Lonse

en: Led by the Kremlin's example, a global rise in disinformation and propaganda is having a disastrous effect on independent news around the world, a new report finds.
ny: Lipoti latsopano linafotokoza kuti, kuwonjezeka kwa chidziŵitso chonyenga ndi chinyengo padziko lonse, motsatira chitsanzo cha Kremlin, kukuchititsa kuti nkhani zodziimira paokha padziko lonse zisokonezeke.

en: In its 2022 World Press Freedom Index released Tuesday, the Paris-based Reporters Without Borders (RSF) said Russia's invasion of Ukraine has contributed vastly to the spread of fake news and propaganda.
ny: Mu lipoti lake la World Press Freedom Index la mu 2022 limene linatulutsidwa Lachiwiri, bungwe la Reporters Without Borders (RSF) lomwe lili ku Paris linati kugonjetsa kwa Russia ku Ukraine kwathandiza kwambiri kufalitsa nkhani zabodza ndi chinyengo.

en: The journalism watchdog group said its findings are worrying, as they show deep divisions among media within countries and between countries at the international level.
ny: Gulu loyang'anira ntchito ya utolankhani linanena kuti zomwe linapeza n'zochititsa mantha, chifukwa zimasonyeza kusiyana kwakukulu pakati pa atolankhani m'mayiko ndi pakati pa mayiko padziko lonse.

en: "In 2022, it's really undeniable that media polarization and information chaos are really fueling social divisions in ways that are pretty new," said Clayton Weimers, deputy director of RSF for the United States, told VOA. He said the prevalence of partisan news around the world has come at the expense of authentic journalism.
ny: "Mu 2022, n'zosatsutsika kuti kusankhana kwa atolankhani ndi chisokonezo cha chidziwitso zikukulitsa kugawanika kwa anthu m'njira zatsopano", anatero Clayton Weimers, wachiwiri kwa mkulu wa bungwe la RSF ku United States, ku VOA. Iye anati kufalikira kwa nkhani zopanda tsankho padziko lonse lapansi kwafika pa mtengo wa ntchito yolemba yoona.

en: The group's annual report ranks 180 countries based on the environment for independent journalism. This year, however, RSF said it used a new method that blends each country's political, legal, economic, sociocultural and security conditions.
ny: Lipoti la chaka ndi chaka la gululi limaika mayiko 180 m'malo ake potengera mmene ntchito ya utolankhani waumwini ilili.

en: Now, the index classifies a record 28 countries as "having very bad media freedom." That group includes China, which is exporting censorship beyond its borders while also amplifying the Kremlin's propaganda on Russia's devastating war against Ukraine.
ny: Tsopano, cholozeracho chikuika maiko 28 monga "okhala ndi ufulu wa atolankhani woipa kwambiri". Gulu limenelo limaphatikizapo China, yomwe ikugulitsa kuletsa kunja kwa malire ake pamene ikuwonjezera chinyengo cha Kremlin pa nkhondo yowononga ya Russia motsutsana ndi Ukraine.

en: Russia, China among worst
ny: Russia, China pakati pa zoipa kwambiri

en: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15-year prison terms for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."
ny: Chiyambire pamene Russia inalowa m'dziko la Ukraine pa February 24, yakhala ikufuna kulamulira kwathunthu nkhani, mwa kukhazikitsa lamulo latsopano limene limaika anthu amene amafalitsa "nkhani zonama" zokhudza asilikali m'ndende kwa zaka 15, ndipo limaletsa ngakhale kuitana nkhondoyo kuti "nkhondo".

en: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.
ny: Zimenezi zachititsa kuti manyuzipepala ambiri odziimira okha, kuphatikizapo nyuzipepala yotchuka ya Novaya Gazeta, wailesi ya Ekho Moskvy ndi wailesi ya Dozhd TV, atseke kapena kusamukira kunja kwa Russia kuti apitirize kugwira ntchito.

en: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.
ny: Akatswiri amati, popanda mawu a anthu odziimira okha, boma la Russia lakwanitsa kudzaza mawailesi a boma ndi nkhani zoneneza nkhondo ndi kufalitsa zifukwa zonama kapena zosokoneza za kuukira kwa Kremlin.

en: Russia's media repression stands at 155 out of 180 countries included in RSF's index, where one is the most free and 180 the least.
ny: Kuzunzidwa kwa atolankhani ku Russia kuli pa 155 mwa mayiko 180 omwe ali m'gulu la RSF, kumene dziko limodzi ndilo lokhala ndi ufulu wambiri ndipo dziko lina ndi limene lili ndi ufulu wochepa kwambiri.

en: "It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia," Clayton said.
ny: "Ndi bwino kunena kuti pa nthaŵi ino kuti ufulu wa atolankhani uli chinthu cha m'mbuyomu ku Russia", anatero Clayton.

en: Throughout Russian President Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.
ny: Iye anati, kwa zaka 22 zimene Pulezidenti wa Russia Vladimir Putin wakhala akulamulira, Moscow yakhala ikufuna anthu olemba nkhani ndi ofalitsa nkhani osadalira boma.

en: "But since the invasion of Ukraine, it seems that Putin has really finished off the independent media once and for all in Russia," Clayton said. "At this point, it is impossible to accurately report on the war in Ukraine."
ny: "Koma chiyambire pamene dziko la Ukraine linagonjetsedwa, zikuoneka kuti Putin wathetsa kwenikweni nkhani za m'ma TV mosadalira, kamodzi kokha m'dziko la Russia", anatero Clayton. "Panthaŵi ino, n'zosatheka kupereka lipoti lolondola la nkhondo ku Ukraine".

en: China ranked 175th in the new report. And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a lengthy series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.
ny: China ili pa nambala 175 mu lipoti latsopanoli. Ndipo tsopano popeza ili pansi pa mphamvu ya Beijing, Hong Kong nayonso yalemba kuchepa kwakukulu, ikumakhala pa nambala 148 pa 180 pambuyo pa kufufuza kwautali ndi kumangidwa kumene kunatseka malo a nkhani za demokalase.

en: RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention. The regime uses coercion, harassment, intimidation and surveillance to keep independent and foreign journalists from reporting on issues deemed "sensitive."
ny: Nkhani ya dziko la China ya bungwe la RSF imati dzikoli ndilo likumangitsa atolankhani ambiri padziko lonse lapansi, ndipo lili ndi atolankhani okwana 120. boma limagwiritsa ntchito kukakamiza, kuzunza, kuopseza ndi kuonerera kuti atolankhani odziimira okha ndi akunja asafotokoze nkhani zimene zimaonedwa kuti ndi "zofunika".

en: "President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which freely accessing information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime," RSF's country file states.
ny: "Purezidenti Xi Jinping, yemwe wakhala akulamulira kuyambira mu 2013, wabwezeretsa chikhalidwe cha atolankhani choyenera nyengo ya Maoist, momwe kupeza ufulu wa chidziwitso kwakhala mlandu ndipo kupereka chidziwitso ndi mlandu waukulu kwambiri", limatero lipoti la dziko la RSF.

en: Rising authoritarianism
ny: Kukula kwa ulamuliro wa anthu

en: North Korea remains the worst country in the rankings at 180th. Elsewhere in the Asia-Pacific region, political turmoil, conflict and rising authoritarianism have wiped out years of progress.
ny: Dziko la North Korea ndilo lili pa malo a 180 m'gululi, ndipo m'madera ena a ku Asia ndi Pacific, mavuto a ndale, mikangano, ndi ulamuliro woipa wa anthu ambiri zachititsa kuti anthu asamachite bwino m'zaka zambiri.

en: The 2021 coup in Myanmar marked a 10-year setback for media rights, with journalists detained, media licenses revoked, and many news outlets returning to exile. Under the military junta, Myanmar, ranking 176th, is one of the world's biggest jailers of journalists.
ny: Kuukira kwa boma ku Myanmar mu 2021 kunayambitsa zaka 10 za ufulu wa atolankhani, ndi atolankhani omwe amangidwa, ziphaso zofalitsa nkhani zidathetsedwa, ndipo malo ambiri atolankhani abwerera ku ukapolo.

en: In Afghanistan, the Taliban insurgents pledged to uphold press freedom when they took power in August 2021. Instead, RSF said the "Taliban's seizure of power has further worsened conditions for reporters and news organizations, who are the targets of all forms of intimidation and violence." Afghanistan ranked 154th.
ny: Ku Afghanistan, zigawenga za Taliban zinalonjeza kuti zidzasunga ufulu wa atolankhani pamene zinalowa m'malo mwa boma mu August 2021. M'malo mwake, RSF inati "kutenga ulamuliro kwa a Taliban kwaipitsa kwambiri zinthu kwa atolankhani ndi mabungwe azankhani, omwe ndi omwe amawopsezedwa ndi ziwawa zamtundu uliwonse". Afghanistan ili pa nambala 154.

en: Across Africa, laws criminalizing online journalism have dealt a new blow to the right to information, RSF said, while the spread of rumors, propaganda, and disinformation has contributed to undermine access to quality information.
ny: Ku Africa konse, malamulo ophera ntchito ya utolankhani pa intaneti apweteka kwambiri ufulu wa anthu kupeza chidziwitso, malinga ndi kunena kwa bungwe la RSF, pamene kufalikira kwa mphekesera, chinyengo, ndi chidziwitso cholakwika kwachititsa kuti anthu asapeze chidziwitso chabwino.

en: In Ethiopia, the war in the Tigray region, with its communication blackouts and restricted access, were the main factors that placed the country 114 on the index. Neighboring Eritrea and Djibouti are far worse, ranking near the bottom at 179 and 164, respectively.
ny: Ku Ethiopia, nkhondo m'dera la Tigray, ndi kusowa kwa mauthenga ndi kuloŵerera kwake koletsedwa, zinali zinthu zazikulu zomwe zinayika dziko 114 pa index.

en: African media continue to struggle economically, RSF said it its accompanying analysis.
ny: RSF inati, atolankhani a ku Africa akupitirizabe kuvutika ndi mavuto a zachuma.

en: "Despite a wave of liberalization in the 1990s, there are still, too often, cases of arbitrary censorship, especially on the internet, with occasional network shutdowns in some countries, arrests of journalists and violent attacks," the group said.
ny: "Ngakhale kuti anthu anasiya kugwiritsa ntchito ufulu wawo m'zaka za m'ma 1990, pali milandu yambiri ya kuletsa zinthu mwachisawawa, makamaka pa intaneti, ndipo nthawi zina m'mayiko ena anthu amaletsa kugwiritsa ntchito Intaneti, kumanga atolankhani ndiponso kuukira anthu mwankhanza", inatero gululi.

en: Clayton said the rising authoritarianism feeds on itself.
ny: Clayton anati ulamuliro wowonjezereka umadzidyetsa wokha.

en: "When we allow a culture of impunity to exist where authoritarians are allowed to go after journalists, harass them, arrest them, beat them in the streets and kill them, it has a knock-on effect," he said. "It emboldens that same authoritarian to do it again next time, and it emboldens other authoritarians who are watching to do the same."
ny: Iye anati: "Tikalekerera kuti anthu a ulamuliro wankhanza asalangidwe, anthu oterewa akaloledwa kumanga, kumenya, kumenya ndi kupha atolankhani, zimakhudza kwambiri anthu amene amachita zimenezi.

en: US not perfect
ny: US si wangwiro

en: After a period of seeing its media attacked as "fake news" by former President Donald Trump, the United States retained a relatively high ranking of 42 in RSF's index. That is largely thanks to the return of regular White House and federal agency press briefings.
ny: Pambuyo pa nthaŵi imene atolankhani ake anaukiridwa ndi pulezidenti wakale Donald Trump kuti ndi "nkhani zonama", dziko la United States linasunga malo apamwamba kwambiri a 42 m'ndandanda wa RSF. Izi zimachitika makamaka chifukwa cha kubwereranso kwa nkhani zofalitsa nkhani za nthaŵi zonse za ku White House ndi mabungwe a boma.

en: But RSF said problems persist, including "the disappearance of local newspapers, the systematic polarization of the media, and the erosion of journalism by digital platforms amid a climate of animosity and aggression toward journalists, among others."
ny: Koma RSF inati mavuto akupitirizabe, kuphatikizapo "kuzimiririka kwa manyuzipepala a m'deralo, kusokonezeka kwa mauthenga, ndi kufooka kwa ntchito ya utolankhani ndi ma pulatifomu a digito pakati pa nyengo ya udani ndi chiwawa kwa atolankhani, pakati pa ena".

en: Barriers exist, for instance, when it comes to covering state governments and protests.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, pali zopinga pamene nkhani za maboma a zigawo ndi zionetsero zikufotokozedwa.

en: "We typically find that this is either due to just a blatant disregard for the laws governing open records or meetings, or they're simply misinterpreting them. An individual is misinterpreting whether a journalist can be present at a particular event," said Beth Francesco, senior director of the National Press Club Journalism Institute.
ny: "Timaona kuti zimenezi zimachitika chifukwa chakuti anthuwo akunyalanyaza malamulo okhudza nkhani kapena misonkhano, kapena akungofotokoza molakwika. Munthuyo akumasulira molakwika ngati mtolankhani angapezeke pa mwambo winawake", anatero Beth Francesco, mkulu wa bungwe loona za utolankhani la National Press Club Journalism Institute.

en: A few bright spots
ny: Pali zinthu zina zimene zikuoneka bwino.

en: Despite an overall trend of decline, Clayton said there are positives.
ny: Ngakhale kuti anthu akuchepa, Clayton anati pali zinthu zina zabwino.

en: Some governments provide funding for news media without interfering in their operations, to ensure independence from political influence.
ny: Maboma ena amapereka ndalama kwa atolankhani popanda kuloŵerera m'ntchito zawo, pofuna kuonetsetsa kuti sakhudzidwa ndi ndale.

en: "If you look at the top of our list, some of the things that stand out are these are countries that have robust public funding for media," he said, noting that "it's always important to separate state funding for media and state-controlled media."
ny: "Ngati muyang'ana pamwamba pa mndandanda wathu, zina mwa zinthu zomwe zimawonekera ndi mayiko omwe ali ndi ndalama zambiri zothandizira anthu", iye anati, ponena kuti "nthawi zonse ndikofunika kupatula ndalama za boma kwa atolankhani ndi boma lolamulira".

en: Three Scandinavian countries — Norway, Denmark and Sweden — respectively come at the top of RSF's index. Estonia, a former Soviet Union republic, ranked 4th.
ny: Mayiko atatu a ku Scandinavia, Norway, Denmark ndi Sweden, ali pamwamba pa ma index a RSF. Estonia, dziko lomwe kale linali m'gulu la Soviet Union, lili pa nambala 4.

en: RSF said the free exercise of journalism plays a major role in emerging democracies such as East Timor, ranked 17, Bhutan, ranked 33, and Mongolia, ranked 90.
ny: RSF inati ufulu wochita nyuzipepala umachita mbali yaikulu m'maiko amene akuyamba kumene kukhala ndi demokalase monga East Timor, yomwe ili pa nambala 17, Bhutan, yomwe ili pa nambala 33, ndi Mongolia, yomwe ili pa nambala 90.

en: East Timor was one country whose ranking skyrocketed, rising 54 places. But RSF cautioned that because of its change in methodology this year, "care should be taken when comparing the 2022 rankings and scores with those from 2021."
ny: Dziko la East Timor ndi limodzi mwa mayiko omwe ali ndi malo apamwamba kwambiri, ndipo linakwera malo 54. Koma bungwe la RSF lachenjeza kuti chifukwa cha kusintha kwa njira zomwe limagwiritsa ntchito chaka chino, "kuyenera kusamala poyerekeza masanjidwe a 2022 ndi masanjidwe a 2021. "

en: UN’s Guterres Meets with Nigerian Leaders After Visiting Volatile Borno State
ny: UN Guterres Akumana ndi Atsogoleri a Nigeria Pambuyo pa Ulendo Wake ku Boma la Borno

en: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders Wednesday at the end of a two-day visit to Nigeria and three-nation trip to Africa. On Tuesday, he visited internally displaced people (IDPs) in northeast Nigeria and called for them to be safely returned to their homes. Nigerian authorities plan to close all IDP camps in the next few years despite security concerns.  Antonio Guterres arrived the United Nations house in Abuja around 9 a.m. Wednesday and met with U.N. local coordinators before holding talks with Nigerian womens representatives.
ny: Mlembi wamkulu wa UN Antonio Guterres adakumana ndi atsogoleri aku Nigeria Lachitatu kumapeto kwa ulendo wamasiku awiri ku Nigeria komanso ulendo wamayiko atatu ku Africa. Lachiwiri, adachezera anthu othawa kwawo (IDPs) kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Nigeria ndipo adawapempha kuti abwerere kwawo. Akuluakulu aku Nigeria akukonzekera kutseka misasa yonse ya IDP mzaka zingapo zikubwerazi ngakhale pali nkhawa zachitetezo. Antonio Guterres adafika kunyumba ya United Nations ku Abuja pafupifupi 9 m'mawa Lachitatu ndipo adakumana ndi okonza a UN am'deralo asanakambirane ndi oimira azimayi aku Nigeria.

en: The delegates, led by Nigeria's minister for womens affairs, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed gender equality and the inclusion of women in politics with the U.N. secretary-general.
ny: A nthumwi, otsogozedwa ndi nduna ya Nigeria yoona za akazi, Pauline Kedem Tallen, anakambirana ndi mlembi wamkulu wa UN za kufanana kwa amuna ndi akazi ndi kuloŵetsamo akazi m'ndale.

en: "His coming to Nigeria today has given us hope, because we know that he will lend his voice to all the issues affecting women, gender-based violence, early marriage, lack of implementation of some of our laws," said Tallen.
ny: "Kufika kwake ku Nigeria lero kwatipatsa chiyembekezo, chifukwa tikudziwa kuti adzapereka mawu ake ku nkhani zonse zomwe zimakhudza akazi, nkhanza zogonana, ukwati wachinyamata, kusatsata malamulo athu ena", anatero Tallen.

en: Guterres afterwards met with Nigeria's religious leaders and later attended a wreath-laying ceremony at the U.N. house to remember the 23 people killed during the 2011 bombing of the building.
ny: Pambuyo pake Guterres anakumana ndi atsogoleri achipembedzo a ku Nigeria ndipo pambuyo pake anapita ku mwambo wa kuika maluŵa a maluŵa ku nyumba ya UN kukumbukira anthu 23 omwe anaphedwa mu 2011 pamene nyumbayo inaphulitsidwa ndi bomba.

en: He began his three-nation Africa visit Sunday in Senegal as part of his Ramadan solidarity tour, and later went to Niger.
ny: Anayamba ulendo wake wa mayiko atatu a ku Africa Lamlungu ku Senegal monga mbali ya ulendo wake wa Ramadan, ndipo kenako anapita ku Niger.

en: On Tuesday, he visited northeastern Borno state and met with the state governor as well as IDPs and families impacted by the Boko Haram conflict.
ny: Lachiwiri, anapita kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa boma la Borno ndipo anakumana ndi kazembe wa boma komanso anthu othawa kwawo ndi mabanja amene anakhudzidwa ndi nkhondo ya Boko Haram.

en: Guterres also visited repentant Boko Haram fighters and praised authorities' reintegration program for more than 1,000 former fighters.
ny: Guterres anapitanso kukaona omenyera nkhondo a Boko Haram omwe analapa ndipo anayamikira pulogalamu ya boma yobwezeretsa anthu oposa 1,000 omwe anali omenyera nkhondo.

en: He also commended authorities efforts to resettle displaced people back to their communities and called for more support to rebuild the region.  "The Borno that I found today is the Borno of hope, the Borno with future and I was very impressed to see the policy that is being deployed here, recognizing that you don't fight terrorism just by military means, you fight terrorism addressing the root causes of terrorism," he said. "The people that I met today in the IDP camps want to go back home in safety and dignity. The way to address terrorism effectively is to provide not only hope but a future of reality."
ny: Iye anayamikiranso zoyesayesa za akuluakulu aboma kuti akhazikitse anthu omwe anasamutsidwa m'madera awo ndipo adapempha kuti athandizidwe kwambiri kuti amange derali. "Borno yomwe ndapeza lero ndi Borno ya chiyembekezo, Borno ndi tsogolo ndipo ndidachita chidwi kwambiri kuwona mfundo zomwe zikugwiritsidwa ntchito pano, pozindikira kuti simumenya nkhondo ndi uchigawenga kokha, mumamenya nkhondo ndi uchigawenga pothana ndi zomwe zimayambitsa uchigawenga", adatero. "Anthu omwe ndidakumana nawo lero m'misasa ya IDP akufuna kubwerera kwawo motetezeka komanso moyenera. Njira yothetsera uchigawenga moyenera ndi kupereka osati chiyembekezo chokha komanso tsogolo lenileni".

en: Nigerian authorities have been closing IDP camps since late last year and want to close all camps by 2026. More than 2 million people have been displaced from their homes since the start of the Boko Haram insurgency in 2009.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku Nigeria akhala akutseka misasa ya anthu othawa kwawo kuyambira kumapeto kwa chaka chatha ndipo akufuna kutseka misasa yonse pofika chaka cha 2026. Anthu opitirira 2 miliyoni asamukitsidwa m'nyumba zawo kuyambira pomwe gulu la Boko Haram lidayamba mu 2009.

en: But aid groups have been warning some communities may still be attacked.
ny: Koma magulu othandiza akhala akuchenjeza kuti madera ena angapitirizebe kuukiridwa.

en: "There are multiple solutions when it comes to resettlement. We need to get people stabilized," said Adenike Oladosu, a climate justice activist, met with the U.N. secretary-general. "Climate change is leading to the rise of armed conflicts affecting people in the region and around and the need for us to see that we have more climate action and not always military action."
ny: "Pali njira zambiri zothetsera vutoli pankhani ya kusamutsidwanso kwa anthu. Tiyenera kulimbikitsa anthu kuti asinthe", anatero Adenike Oladosu, yemwe amagwira ntchito yofuna kuti anthu azisintha nyengo, pokumana ndi Mlembi Wamkulu wa bungwe la United Nations. "Kusintha kwa nyengo kukuchititsa kuti nkhondo ziwonjezeke m'madera a m'deralo komanso m'madera ozungulira derali ndipo tikufunika kuona kuti tiyenera kuchita zambiri poteteza nyengo osati kuchita zinthu zankhondo nthawi zonse".

en: The U.N. secretary-general ended his visit at the Abuja presidential village, where he met with President Muhammadu Buhari and his top Cabinet members.
ny: Mlembi wamkulu wa UN anamaliza ulendo wake ku mudzi wa pulezidenti wa Abuja, kumene anakumana ndi Pulezidenti Muhammadu Buhari ndi mamembala a nduna zake zapamwamba.

en: Al-Shabab Raids African Union Military Base
ny: Al-Shabab Akuukira Malo a Asilikali a African Union

en: Al-Shabab fighters stormed an African Union military base in the village of El-Baraf in Somalias Middle Shabelle region early Tuesday, local officials and security sources say.
ny: Asilikali a Al-Shabab anaukira likulu la asilikali a African Union m'mudzi wa El-Baraf m'chigawo cha Middle Shabelle ku Somalia, Lolemba m'mawa, atero akuluakulu a m'deralo ndi anthu ena a m'mabungwe a zachitetezo.

en: Officials told VOA Somali that the militants briefly seized the base before withdrawing from it. State media said Burundian solders at the base repulsed the attack.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma anauza VOA Somali kuti zigawengazo zinalanda msasawo kwa kanthawi kochepa asanachoke.

en: "The Federal Government of Somalia condemns in the strongest possible terms the heinous attack targeting the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia forward operating base in Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle," the Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted on its official Facebook page.
ny: "Boma la Federal la Somalia likudzudzula mwamphamvu kwambiri chigawenga choopsa chomwe chatsata ntchito ya African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia yomwe ili ku Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle", anatero Unduna wa Zakunja wa Somalia pa tsamba lake la Facebook.

en: "We extend our deepest condolences to the victims of this terrorist attack and their families."
ny: "Tikupereka chisoni chathu chachikulu kwa anthu amene anavulazidwa ndi zigawengazi ndi mabanja awo".

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, said the militants started their attack with two suicide truck bombs. He said the militants then fought their way onto the base.
ny: Meya wa El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, adati zigawengazo zidayamba kuukira kwawo ndi mabomba awiri amoto.

en: Al-Shabab claimed the killing of 173 African Union forces. The group also claimed responsibility for capturing AU forces as prisoners-of-war. Both claims could not be independently verified. AU force headquarters and Somali military officials could not be immediately reached for comment.
ny: Al-Shabab adati adapha anthu 173 a African Union. Gululi lidatinso ndi lomwe lidalanda asitikali a AU ngati akaidi ankhondo. Zilengezo zonsezi sizingatsimikizidwe ndi anthu odziyimira pawokha.

en: In an interview with VOA, Muhumed, who was not at the village at the time of the attack, said he was told there were "many deaths" among Burundian forces but could not give an exact figure.
ny: M'mawu ake kwa VOA, Muhumed, yemwe sanali m'mudziwo panthawi ya kuukira, anati anauzidwa kuti panali "anthu ambiri omwe anafa" pakati pa asilikali a ku Burundi koma sanathe kupereka chiŵerengero cholongosoka.

en: "Fighting like this never happened in this area," he said. "It was heavy fighting."
ny: Iye anati: "Kuthana kotereku sikunachitikepo m'dera lino.

en: He said two civilians were also killed and more than 10 others injured.
ny: Iye anati anthu awiri anaphedwanso ndipo ena oposa 10 anavulala.

en: Muhumed confirmed to VOA that al-Shabab militants withdrew from the base. He also reported airstrikes targeting the militants as they left the base but did not say who was responsible for the strikes.
ny: Muhumed anatsimikizira kwa VOA kuti omenyera nkhondo a al-Shabab achoka pa msasawo.

en: El-Baraf, approximately 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu, is one of the forward operating bases of African Union forces from Burundi.
ny: El-Baraf, pafupifupi makilomita 150 kumpoto kwa Mogadishu, ndi imodzi mwa malo oyendetsera ntchito za asilikali a African Union ochokera ku Burundi.

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
ny: Chochitikacho chinali choyamba chachikulu cha al-Shabab kuukira mphamvu za AU kuyambira pamene ntchitoyo inasintha dzina ndi machitidwe ake mwezi watha.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), gives it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity-building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to Somalia. The mission has until the end of 2024 to operate in the country.
