ny: UN Security Council, yomwe idavomereza ntchito yatsopano yotchedwa African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia (ATMIS), imapatsa ntchito yochepetsera chiwopsezo chochokera ku al-Shabab, kuthandizira kukhazikitsa mphamvu za chitetezo cha Somalia, ndikuchita gawo limodzi lachitetezo ku Somalia. Ntchitoyi ili ndi mpaka kumapeto kwa 2024 kuti igwire ntchito mdzikolo.

en: India’s Muslims Mark Eid al-Fitr Amid Community Violence
ny: Asilamu a ku India Akukondwerera Eid al-Fitr Pakati pa Chiwawa cha M'dera Lawo

en: Muslims across India marked Eid al-Fitr on Tuesday by offering prayers outside mosques, even as the celebrations this year came in the backdrop of a series of recent attacks against the community during the month of Ramadan.
ny: Asilamu ku India konse anadziŵitsa Eid al-Fitr Lachiwiri mwa kupereka mapemphero kunja kwa mzikiti, ngakhale kuti zikondwerero za chaka chino zinachitika m'mbuyo mwa ziwembu zingapo zomwe zinachitika posachedwapa motsutsana ndi anthu a m'derali m'mwezi wa Ramadan.

en: "We will not have the same kind of festivity" this time, said Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, a civil engineer in Indias financial capital, Mumbai. "This is the most painful Eid with worst memories for Indian Muslims."
ny: "Sitili kudzakhala ndi chikondwerero chofanana" nthaŵi ino, anatero Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, injiniya wa zomangamanga ku likulu la zachuma la India, Mumbai. "Ili ndilo Eid lopweteka kwambiri ndi lokhala ndi zikumbukiro zoipa koposa kwa Asilamu a ku India".

en: Anti-Muslim sentiment and attacks have surged across the country in the last month, including stone throwing between Hindu and Muslim groups during religious processions and subsequent demolitions of a number of properties mostly belonging to Muslims by authorities.
ny: Maganizo ndi ziwawa zotsutsana ndi Asilamu zawonjezeka m'dziko lonse m'mwezi watha, kuphatikizapo kuponya miyala pakati pa magulu a Ahindu ndi Asilamu panthawi ya miyambo ya chipembedzo ndi kuwonongedwa kwa malo ambiri omwe ambiri ndi Asilamu ndi akuluakulu a boma.

en: The community, which makes up 14% of Indias 1.4 billion population, is reeling from vilification by hard-line Hindu nationalists who have long espoused an anti-Muslim stance. Some leaders of Indias ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party have tacitly supported the violence, while Prime Minister Narendra Modi has so far been silent about it. Eid al-Fitr is typically marked with communal prayers, celebratory gatherings around festive meals and new clothes, but celebrations in India for the past two years have been marred by COVID-19 restrictions.
ny: Anthu a m'derali, omwe amapanga 14% ya anthu 1.4 biliyoni a ku India, akuvutika ndi nkhanza za anthu ouma khosi a Chihindu omwe akhala akulimbana ndi Asilamu kwa nthawi yaitali. Atsogoleri ena a chipani cha Bharatiya Janata Party, chomwe chili m'manja mwa dziko la India, achita zinthu zosonyeza kuti akuchirikiza zachiwawazo, pomwe nduna yaikulu Narendra Modi mpaka pano sananene chilichonse.

en: In Indian-controlled Kashmir, the Muslim festival has been subdued for the past three years because of an unprecedented military lockdown after India stripped the regions semi-autonomy in 2019, followed by the pandemic. The region also saw a rise in violence during Ramadan, with at least 20 militants, two civilians and five police and soldiers killed.
ny: Ku Kashmir komwe kumayendetsedwa ndi India, chikondwerero cha Asilamu chakhala chikuchitika kwa zaka zitatu zapitazi chifukwa cha kutsekedwa kwa asilikali komwe sikunachitikepopo ndi kale lonse, pambuyo poti India idachotsa maderawo ku semi-autonomy mu 2019, ndikutsatiridwa ndi mliriwu. Derali lidawonanso kuwonjezeka kwa ziwawa mu Ramadan, pomwe omenyera nkhondo osachepera 20, anthu awiri wamba komanso apolisi ndi asitikali asanu adaphedwa.

en: "As we prepare to celebrate Eid, a strong sense of collective loss jars at us," said Bashir Ahmed, a businessman in Srinagar.
ny: "Pamene tikukonzekera kukondwerera Eid, timamva chisoni chachikulu", anatero Bashir Ahmed, wazamalonda ku Srinagar.

en: Kashmir is the Muslim-majority disputed region where a violent insurgency against Indian rule and New Delhis brutal crackdown has raged for over three decades. Tens of thousands of people have died in the conflict.
ny: Kashmir ndi dera lokangana la Asilamu ambiri kumene chipolowe chankhanza chotsutsana ndi ulamuliro wa India ndi kuponderezedwa kwa nkhanza kwa New Delhi kwachitika kwa zaka zoposa makumi atatu.

en: Meanwhile in the capital, New Delhi, hundreds assembled in the Jama Masjid, one of Indias largest mosques, while offering Eid prayers there for the first time in over two years due to pandemic restrictions. Families came together early on Tuesday morning while many people shared hugs and wishes.
ny: Panthawiyi, likulu la dziko la New Delhi, mazana ambiri anasonkhana ku Jama Masjid, umodzi wa mzikiti waukulu kwambiri ku India, pamene ankapereka mapemphero a Eid kumeneko kwa nthawi yoyamba mzaka zoposa ziwiri chifukwa cha zoletsa za mliriwu. Mabanja anasonkhana m'mawa wa Lachiwiri pomwe anthu ambiri adagawana zibwenzi ndi zokhumba.

en: Beijing Residents Brace for COVID-19 Lockdown
ny: Anthu a ku Beijing Akukonzekera Kutsekedwa kwa COVID-19

en: Unlike Shanghai, Beijing has yet to require that all its residents remain at home to contain the spread of COVID-19. Nevertheless, many people in its Chaoyang district and elsewhere are preparing for that possibility.
ny: Mosiyana ndi Shanghai, Beijing sanafunebe kuti anthu onse azikhala m'nyumba zawo kuti athetse kufalikira kwa COVID-19. Komabe, anthu ambiri m'chigawo cha Chaoyang ndi m'madera ena akukonzekera kuti zimenezi zitheke.

en: On Wednesday, city officials closed 60 subway stations, more than 10% of Beijing's vast system. They did not say when service would be resumed, according to ABC News.
ny: Lachitatu, akuluakulu a mzindawu anatseka masiteshoni 60 a sitima zapamtunda, oposa 10% a dongosolo lalikulu la Beijing.

en: Beijing, a city of 21 million people, has been on high alert for the spread of COVID-19, as restaurants and bars pivot to takeout, gyms close and schools suspend classes indefinitely, according to CNBC.
ny: Beijing, mzinda wa anthu 21 miliyoni, wakhala akudzipereka kwambiri kuti athetse kufalikira kwa COVID-19, pamene malo odyera ndi malo omwera amalowerera zakudya zopita, malo ochitira masewera olimbitsa thupi atseka ndipo masukulu amaimitsa maphunziro mpaka kalekale, malinga ndi CNBC.

en: People who live in "controlled" areas, neighborhoods where cases have been discovered, have been told to stay in the city, and all residents must test for the virus three times throughout the week, according to ABC.
ny: Anthu amene amakhala m'madera "olamulidwa", madera amene anthu ena ali ndi matendawa, anauzidwa kuti azikhala mumzinda, ndipo anthu onse ayenera kupimidwa katatu pa mlungu kuti aone ngati ali ndi kachilomboka, malinga ndi zimene ABC inanena.

en: Chinese authorities reported 5,489 cases nationwide on Wednesday, of which 4,982 were in Shanghai, which has been under a draconian lockdown for weeks.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku China ananenapo za anthu 5,489 amene anadwala matendawa m'dziko lonselo Lachitatu, ndipo 4,982 mwa anthuwa anali ku Shanghai, komwe kwakhala kukuletsedwa kwa milungu ingapo.

en: Beijing reported 46 symptomatic cases and five asymptomatic on Wednesday. The city's total since April 22, what it considers the start of its omicron outbreak, is 544.
ny: Beijing inalengeza za anthu 46 omwe ali ndi zizindikiro ndipo asanu analibe zizindikiro Lachitatu. Chiwerengero cha anthu onse omwe akhalapo mumzindawu kuyambira pa April 22, pamene anthuwo akuona kuti mliri wa omicron wayamba, ndi 544.

en: Mr. Zhang, a Beijing resident, said he had bought extra food and water, even though he doesn't think Beijing will be locked down like Shanghai. He asked that VOA not use his full name because he was afraid of attracting official attention.
ny: A Zhang, omwe amakhala ku Beijing, anati anagula chakudya ndi madzi owonjezera, ngakhale kuti sakuganiza kuti Beijing idzatsekedwa ngati Shanghai.

en: "I have six bags of rice, two bags of noodles, and several boxes of water, instant noodles and (nutritionally dense) biscuits, and I haven't stocked up too much," Zhang told VOA Mandarin in a phone interview last week. He said he bought his groceries online because the supermarket was crowded.
ny: "Ndili ndi matumba asanu ndi limodzi a mpunga, matumba awiri a mphodza, ndi mabokosi angapo a madzi, mphodza zofulumira ndi (zakudya zolemera) ma biscuit, ndipo sindinapeze zambiri", Zhang adauza VOA Mandarin pa kuyankhulana kwa foni sabata yatha.

en: Ms. Yao, who lives in the Chaoyang district, told VOA Mandarin that she had been stocking up on necessities since the beginning of this year, after the Ministry of Commerce recommended that everyone do so. She asked that VOA Mandarin not use her full name because she wanted to avoid official retribution.
ny: Mayi Yao, amene amakhala m'chigawo cha Chaoyang, anauza VOA Mandarin kuti wakhala akupeza zinthu zofunika kuyambira kumayambiriro kwa chaka chino, pambuyo poti Unduna wa Zamalonda wapempha kuti aliyense achite zimenezo.

en: "I have always maintained a good habit of reserving food. So I have a lot of rice, noodles and oil at home," she said, adding that she figured her family would be fine even if Beijing locked down for a month.
ny: "Nthawi zonse ndimakonda kusunga chakudya. Choncho ndili ndi mpunga wambiri, makeke ndi mafuta kunyumba", adatero, ndikuwonjezera kuti akuganiza kuti banja lake lidzakhala bwino ngakhale Beijing itatsekedwa kwa mwezi umodzi.

en: And while Beijing has not yet closed the city, citizens' lives have been disrupted.
ny: Ndipo ngakhale kuti Beijing sanatsekebe mzindawo, moyo wa nzika zasokonezeka.

en: On April 28, the Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital issued a notice that the outpatient and emergency departments of the hospital would suspend the admission of patients.
ny: Pa April 28, chipatala cha Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital chinapereka chidziwitso chakuti zipatala za anthu odwala kunja ndi za anthu odwala mwadzidzidzi za chipatalacho zidzaimitsa kuloledwa kwa odwala.

en: On the same day, Chaoyang Hospital, one of the largest hospitals in Beijing, announced on its official Weibo account that its emergency department would also suspend the admission of patients. Weibo is China's equivalent of Twitter.
ny: Tsiku lomwelo, chipatala cha Chaoyang, chimodzi mwa zipatala zazikulu kwambiri ku Beijing, chinalengeza pa akaunti yake ya Weibo kuti dipatimenti yake ya chithandizo chadzidzidzi idzaimitsanso kuloledwa kwa odwala.

en: Angry Chinese netizens left more than 800 messages under the official WeChat account "Beijing Headline."
ny: Anthu okwiya a ku China anasiya mauthenga oposa 800 pa akaunti ya boma ya WeChat yakuti "Beijing Headline".

en: "Why do you stop the emergency room as soon as there is a new COVID case, and how many people will be killed due to the secondary disaster caused by the COVID?" a netizen asked in a Weibo post.
ny: "N'chifukwa chiyani mumasiya kuchipatala mwamsanga pakakhala munthu wina amene ali ndi matenda a COVID, ndipo ndi anthu angati amene adzaphedwa chifukwa cha masoka ena amene amayamba chifukwa cha matenda a COVID?" anafunsa motero munthu wina pa tsamba lake la pa Weibo.

en: Some Beijing residents said they were not worried about a Shanghai-like lockdown.
ny: Anthu ena a ku Beijing ananena kuti sakudandaula ndi kutsekedwa kwa mzinda ngati wa Shanghai.

en: "Basically, I'm not afraid," said Mr. Wang, who asked VOA Mandarin to not use his full name so he could avoid attracting authorities' attention. "The party, government and military are here, and the people are here."
ny: "Mwachibadwa, sindikuopa", anatero Mr. Wang, amene anapempha VOA Mandarin kuti asagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lonse kuti apewe kukopa chidwi cha akuluakulu. "Phwando, boma ndi asilikali ali pano, ndipo anthu ali pano".

en: However, Wang told VOA Mandarin, in mid-October last year, after one person in his apartment building was diagnosed as positive, about 600 people from more than 200 families were forced into isolation at several hotels in the Changping district for 21 days.
ny: Komabe, Wang anauza VOA Mandarin, pakati pa mwezi wa October chaka chatha, munthu mmodzi m'nyumba yake atapezeka ndi matenda, anthu pafupifupi 600 ochokera m'mabanja oposa 200 anakakamizika kukhala okha m'mahotelo angapo m'chigawo cha Changping kwa masiku 21.

en: Wang and his wife were not allowed to share a room at their hotel.
ny: Wang ndi mkazi wake sanaloledwe kukhala m'chipinda chimodzi m'hotela yawo.

en: What particularly puzzled and annoyed Wang was that on the last day of the mandatory hotel quarantine, in addition to routine nasal and oral swabs during testing, authorities added anal swabs to the regimen.
ny: Chimene chinam'thetsa nzeru kwambiri Wang chinali chakuti tsiku lomaliza la kuikidwa kwa anthu m'mahotela, kuwonjezera pa kupima m'mphuno ndi pakamwa, akuluakulu a boma anawonjezera kupima m'mimba.

en: Kasim Abdurehim contributed to this report.
ny: Kasim Abdurehim anathandiza nawo pa lipoti limeneli.

en: At US Urging, Fiji Seizes Russian Oligarch’s Yacht
ny: At US Urging, Fiji Seizes Russian Oligarchs Yacht

en: Another Russian oligarchs yacht was seized Thursday as part of efforts to punish Russia over its war in Ukraine.
ny: Sitima ina ya amfumu a ku Russia inagwidwa Lachinayi monga mbali ya zoyesayesa zowalanga Russia chifukwa cha nkhondo yake ku Ukraine.

en: At the request of the United States, Fijian officials took a $300 million yacht belonging to Suleiman Kerimov, the Justice Department said. Officials say the yacht is in Lautoka, Fiji.
ny: Pa pempho la United States, akuluakulu a Fiji anatenga sitima ya $300 miliyoni ya Suleiman Kerimov, malinga ndi kunena kwa Dipatimenti ya Zachilungamo.

en: Kerimovs yacht, the Cayman Island-flagged Amadea, reportedly has been in Fiji since last month, arriving from Mexico. Defense lawyers claimed the vessel belonged to another oligarch.
ny: Sitima ya Kerimov, Amadea, yomwe ili ndi mbendera ya Cayman Islands, akuti yakhala ku Fiji kuyambira mwezi watha, ikafika kuchokera ku Mexico.

en: Kerimov had already been sanctioned by the U.S. in 2014 and 2018 for Russias activities in Syria and Ukraine. The European Union also sanctioned him.
ny: Kerimov anali atapatsidwa kale chilango ndi US mu 2014 ndi 2018 chifukwa cha zochitika za Russia ku Syria ndi Ukraine.

en: In March, the U.S. government announced a comprehensive effort to identify and seize the assets of wealthy Russians who have supported the government of Russian President Vladmir Putin, as part of the response to Moscows February 24 invasion of Ukraine.
ny: Mu March, boma la United States linalengeza kuti likuyesetsa kwambiri kuti lipeze ndi kulanda katundu wa anthu olemera a ku Russia amene anathandiza boma la Pulezidenti wa Russia Vladimir Putin, monga mbali ya zimene boma la Moscow linachita pa February 24 kuti liukire dziko la Ukraine.

en: The initiative, led by the Justice Department, is called Task Force KleptoCapture.
ny: Ntchitoyi, yomwe inatsogoleredwa ndi Dipatimenti ya Zachilungamo, imatchedwa kuti Task Force KleptoCapture.

en: U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland said Thursday in a statement there is "no hiding place for the assets of criminals who enable the Russian regime." He also said, "The Justice Department will be relentless in our efforts to hold accountable those who facilitate the death and destruction we are witnessing in Ukraine."
ny: Woweruza Wamkulu wa United States Merrick Garland ananena Lachinayi m'mawu ake kuti "palibe malo obisalira katundu wa zigawenga zomwe zimapangitsa boma la Russia". Ananenanso kuti, "Dipatimenti Yachilungamo idzakhala yopanda chifundo m'zoyesayesa zathu kuti tipereke mlandu kwa iwo amene amathandizira imfa ndi chiwonongeko chomwe tikuwona ku Ukraine".

en: In April, at the urging of the U.S., Spanish authorities seized a yacht belonging to Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg, the owner of the Russian conglomerate Renova Group.
ny: Mu April, motsogozedwa ndi United States, akuluakulu a boma la Spain analanda sitima yapamadzi ya munthu wina wa ku Russia dzina lake Viktor Vekselberg, mwini wa kampani ya Renova Group.

en: Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a measure that would allow the U.S. government to sell forfeited Russian properties worth more than $2 million for the benefit of Ukraine. The measures next step is the Senate.
ny: Mlungu watha, Nyumba ya Malamulo ya United States inakhazikitsa lamulo loti boma la United States ligulitse katundu wa ku Russia wowonongedwa wa ndalama zoposa $2 miliyoni kuti apindulitse Ukraine.

en: (Some information in this report comes from Reuters.)
ny: (Zambiri zimene zili m'nkhaniyi zinachokera ku bungwe la Reuters.)

en: WHO Report Says COVID Cases Decline, Except in Americas, Africa
ny: Lipoti la WHO Linanena Kuti Milandu ya COVID Ikuchepa, Kupatula ku America, Africa

en: The World Health Organization said Wednesday that the number of newly reported coronavirus cases and deaths globally continued to fall in the last week, continuing a decline that began in March.
ny: Bungwe Loona za Umoyo Padziko Lonse linanena Lachitatu kuti chiwerengero cha anthu omwe adangomva kumene za matenda a coronavirus komanso anthu omwe amwalira padziko lonse lapansi apitilizabe kuchepa sabata yatha, ndikupitilizabe kuchepa komwe kunayamba mu Marichi.

en: In its weekly report on the pandemic, the U.N. health agency said there were about 3.8 million new infections and more than 15,000 deaths last week, a 17% and 3% drop on the week respectively. But those figures are believed to be a significant underestimate of COVID-19's true toll as increasing numbers of countries abandon widespread testing and surveillance.
ny: Mu lipoti lake la mlungu ndi mlungu lokhudza mliriwu, bungwe la zaumoyo la UN linanena kuti panali anthu pafupifupi 3.8 miliyoni omwe adadwala matendawa ndipo anthu opitilira 15,000 adamwalira sabata yatha, kutsika kwa 17% ndi 3% pamlungu. Koma ziwerengerozi zikukhulupirira kuti ndizotsika kwambiri poyerekeza ndi kuchuluka kwa COVID-19 pomwe mayiko ambiri akusiya kuyesa ndi kuwunika.

en: Still, WHO noted that cases rose by about a third in Africa and 13% in the Americas. There was also a nearly 70% jump in deaths reported in India, although that was attributed to delayed reporting rather than a recent surge of disease.
ny: Komabe, bungwe la WHO linati anthu amene anafa ndi matendawa anawonjezeka ndi pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a anthu amene anafa ku Africa ndiponso 13% ku America.

en: Last week, authorities in South Africa said they had noted an uptick in COVID-19 cases attributable to the BA.4 mutant of omicron, although they said it was too early to tell if that would result in a significant new wave of disease. Although the BA.4 version of COVID-19's omicron variant appears more infectious than omicron, WHO said there was no evidence yet that it was leading to substantially higher rates of hospitalization or death.
ny: Mlungu watha, akuluakulu a boma ku South Africa adati awona kuwonjezeka kwa anthu omwe ali ndi matenda a COVID-19 chifukwa cha mtundu wa BA.4 wa mtundu wa omicron, ngakhale adati ndi nthawi isanakwane kuti adziwe ngati izi zingayambitse matenda atsopano. Ngakhale mtundu wa BA.4 wa mtundu wa omicron wa COVID-19 ukuwoneka kuti ndiwopatsirana kwambiri kuposa mtundu wa omicron, WHO idati palibe umboni womwe ukuwonetsa kuti ukupangitsa kuti anthu ambiri azilowa m'chipatala kapena kufa.

en: Salim Abdool Karim, a public health expert at the University of KwaZulu-Natal, said that while only a "modest" rise in cases had been noted, South Africa was also in the middle of a holiday period and testing had dropped significantly. He said the cases were slowing and were "not following a rocket-like upward trajectory we would expect" in another spike of disease.
ny: Salim Abdool Karim, katswiri wa zaumoyo wa anthu pa University of KwaZulu-Natal, adati ngakhale kuti "kuwonjezeka" kwa milandu kunawonedwa, South Africa inali pakati pa nthawi ya tchuthi ndipo kuyesa kudatsika kwambiri. Adati milandu ikuchepa ndipo "sikuti ikuyenda ngati rocket yomwe timayembekezera" pakukula kwina kwa matenda.

en: At a press briefing on Wednesday, WHO emergencies chief Dr. Michael Ryan said it was too soon to tell if COVID-19 was entering a seasonal pattern and warned against countries dropping all of their restrictions too quickly — as many in the West have done.
ny: Pamsonkhano wa atolankhani Lachitatu, mkulu wa zochitika zadzidzidzi wa WHO Dr. Michael Ryan anati ndi nthawi yochedwa kunena ngati COVID-19 ikulowa m'nyengo ndipo anachenjeza kuti mayiko asachotse zoletsa zawo zonse mwachangu  monga momwe ambiri ku West achitira.

en: "The jury is still out as to how seasonal this virus will become," he said, explaining that it wasn't proven yet that COVID-19 would naturally drop off in the summer and that the world could yet face more unsettling variants. "If people are crowded together in conditions where a new variant is spreading, you will see high levels of transmission," he said.
ny: "Akuluakulu a milandu sanadziwebe kuti kachilomboka kadzakhala ndi nyengo yotani", iye anati, pofotokoza kuti sikunakhazikitsidwebe kuti COVID-19 idzasiya m'chilimwe ndipo dziko lapansi likhoza kukumana ndi mitundu ina yochititsa mantha. "Ngati anthu asonkhana pamodzi m'mikhalidwe yomwe mitundu yatsopano ikufalikira, mudzaona kuchuluka kwa kufalikira", iye anati.

en: Meanwhile in China, authorities continued to crack down on cities, including Beijing, where more than 10% of the subway system was shut down in an effort to curb the virus' spread, after authorities in the capital already closed down indoor dining, gyms and school classes.
ny: Panthaŵi imodzimodziyo, akuluakulu a boma ku China anapitirizabe kuletsa mizinda, kuphatikizapo Beijing, kumene malo oposa 10% a sitima zapamtunda analetsedwa pofuna kuletsa kufalikira kwa kachilomboka, pambuyo poti akuluakulu a boma ku likulu la dzikolo atseka kale malo odyera, malo ochitira masewera olimbitsa thupi ndi makalasi a sukulu.

en: In Shanghai, rigid and widely derided restrictions have led to shortages of food and medical aid along with a wider — though likely temporary — impact on the national economy. Desperate, outraged citizens have confronted authorities at barricades and online, screamed out of their windows and banged pots and pans in a sign of frustration and anger.
ny: Ku Shanghai, malamulo okhwima ndi oseketsa kwambiri athetsa kusowa kwa chakudya ndi chithandizo chamankhwala pamodzi ndi kukhudzidwa kwakukulu kwa chuma cha dziko. Nzika zokhumudwa, zokwiya zakumana ndi akuluakulu a boma pamakomo ndi pa intaneti, zinakuwa kuchokera m'mawindo awo ndi kugogoda miphika ndi mapani monga chizindikiro cha kukhumudwa ndi mkwiyo.

en: Myanmar Supreme Court Rejects Aung San Suu Kyi Appeal on Corruption Charges
ny: Khoti Lalikulu la ku Myanmar Lakana Pempho la Aung San Suu Kyi la Kuphwanya Malamulo a Ziphuphu

en: An appeal of a five-year jail sentence against ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi was rejected Wednesday by the country's supreme court.
ny: Pempho la chilango cha zaka zisanu ku ndende motsutsana ndi mtsogoleri wochotsedwa wa Myanmar Aung San Suu Kyi linakanidwa Lachitatu ndi khoti lalikulu la dzikoli.

en: The decision reportedly came as soon as the claim for an appeal was lodged, and the court didn't entertain arguments from either side in the case.
ny: Chigamulocho chinaperekedwa mwamsanga pamene pempho la apilo linaperekedwa, ndipo khotilo silinamvetsere mfundo za mbali iliyonse pa mlanduwo.

en: Suu Kyi, 76, was sentenced last week after being found guilty of 11 counts of corruption, including taking a bribe of cash and gold bars worth $600,000.
ny: Suu Kyi, wazaka 76, anaweruzidwa sabata yatha atapezeka wolakwa pa milandu 11 ya ziphuphu, kuphatikizapo kulandira ziphuphu za ndalama ndi golide zokwana madola 600,000.

en: Her lawyer called the charge absurd.
ny: Woimira mlandu wake anati mlanduwo ndi wonyenga.

en: Suu Kyi had already been sentenced to six years for actions against the military, breaking COVID-19 rules and breaking a telecommunications law.
ny: Suu Kyi anali ataweruzidwa kale kuti akhale m'ndende zaka zisanu ndi chimodzi chifukwa chochita zinthu zotsutsana ndi asilikali, kuphwanya malamulo a COVID-19 komanso kuphwanya lamulo la telecommunications.

en: She faces many more charges, and if found guilty could be sentenced to more than 150 years in jail.
ny: Iye akuyang'anizana ndi milandu yambiri, ndipo ngati apezedwa wolakwa angalangidwe kukhala m'ndende zaka zoposa 150.

en: Suu Kyi has been under house arrest since a military coup took over the country last year.
ny: Suu Kyi wakhala akusungidwa m'nyumba kuyambira pamene asilikali anagonjetsa dzikoli chaka chatha.

en: Since the coup, on Feb. 1, 2021, there have been widespread protests against the military regime. The regime cracked down violently in many cases, leaving more than 1,800 civilians dead and more than 10,000 arrested, charged or sentenced, according to the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners (Burma).
ny: Chiyambireni kuphulika kwa boma, pa February 1, 2021, pakhala pali zionetsero zofala zotsutsana ndi boma la asilikali. Boma linapondereza mwachiwawa milandu yambiri, ndipo anthu oposa 1,800 anaphedwa ndipo oposa 10,000 anamangidwa, kuimbidwa mlandu kapena kuweruzidwa, malinga ndi Association for Assistance for Political Prisoners (Burma).

en: Some information in this report comes from Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
ny: Zina mwa mfundo za m'nkhaniyi zinachokera ku bungwe la Reuters ndi la Agence France-Presse.

en: Foreign Tourists Begin Arriving in New Zealand After COVID Restrictions Lifted.
ny: Alendo Achilendo Ayamba Kufika ku New Zealand Pambuyo pa Kuchotsedwa kwa Malamulo a COVID.

en: For the first time in over two years, overseas tourists have been allowed to enter New Zealand starting Monday.
ny: Kwa nthaŵi yoyamba m'zaka zoposa ziŵiri, alendo ochokera kumayiko ena aloledwa kuloŵa ku New Zealand kuyambira Lolemba.

en: The island nation known for its natural beauty enacted some of the strictest lockdown measures during the COVID-19 pandemic, including very restrictive travel limitations.
ny: Dziko lazilumbali lomwe limadziwika chifukwa cha kukongola kwake kwachilengedwe linakhazikitsa njira zoletsa kwambiri panthawi ya mliri wa COVID-19, kuphatikizapo zoletsa kwambiri kuyenda.

en: The country had reopened for tourists from Australia weeks ago, but the new relaxation of restrictions now allows tourists from over 60 countries to visit, including most European countries and the U.S.
ny: Dzikoli linatsegulidwanso kwa alendo ochokera ku Australia masabata apitawa, koma kuchepetsedwa kwatsopano kwa zoletsa tsopano kumalola alendo ochokera kumayiko oposa 60 kuti akacheze, kuphatikizapo mayiko ambiri a ku Ulaya ndi US.

en: "Today is a day to celebrate and is a big moment in our reconnection with the world," said Tourism Minister Stuart Nash.
ny: "Lero ndi tsiku losangalatsa ndipo ndi mphindi yaikulu pa kulumikizananso kwathu ndi dziko", anatero nduna ya zokopa alendo Stuart Nash.

en: Tourists must show they are fully vaccinated and test negative for the virus.
ny: Alendo ayenera kusonyeza kuti ali ndi katemera wathunthu ndipo mayeso ake ndi olakwika.

en: Citizens of China, India and other countries not given a waiver Monday are still not allowed to visit.
ny: Nzika za ku China, India ndi maiko ena omwe sanapatsidwe chilolezo Lolemba akadali osaloledwa kukacheza.

en: Before the pandemic, tourism accounted for 5% of the countrys economic activity and 20% of its foreign income.
ny: Mliriwu usanachitike, ntchito zokopa alendo zinali ndi 5% ya chuma cha dzikoli komanso 20% ya ndalama zake zakunja.

en: On Monday, 43 international flights carrying around 9,000 passengers were scheduled to leave or arrive at Auckland International Airport, Reuters reported.
ny: Lolemba, ndege 43 zapadziko lonse zonyamula anthu pafupifupi 9,000 zinakonzedwa kuti zinyamuke kapena kufika pa eyapoti yapadziko lonse ya Auckland, inatero Reuters.

en: Some information in this report comes from The Associated Press and Reuters.
ny: Zina mwa mfundo za m'nkhaniyi zinachokera ku Associated Press ndi Reuters.

en: Report: Iran to Execute Swedish-Iranian National by May 21.
ny: Lipoti: Iran ikapha nzika ya ku Sweden ndi ku Iran pofika pa May 21.

en: Iran will later this month execute a Swedish-Iranian national whom it has imprisoned since 2016 and convicted of spying for Israel, media reported.
ny: Mwezi uno, Iran idzalamula kuti munthu wina wa ku Sweden ndi wa ku Iran aphedwe, yemwe anali m'ndende kuyambira mu 2016 ndipo anaweruzidwa kuti anali kazitape wothandiza Israeli, malinga ndi zimene atolankhani ananena.

en: Irans semiofficial ISNA news agency on Wednesday released a report in which Iranian officials stated that Tehran will implement the death penalty against Ahmad Reza Jalali by May 21.
ny: Bungwe la Iran loimira boma la ISNA Lachitatu linatulutsa lipoti limene akuluakulu a boma la Iran ananena kuti Tehran idzakhazikitsa chilango cha imfa kwa Ahmad Reza Jalali pofika pa May 21.

en: Jalali, a researcher and physician who specializes in disaster relief, was arrested during a visit to Iran in April 2016. In 2017, Jalali was sentenced to death in Iran after he had been found guilty of passing information about two Iranian nuclear scientists to Israel to help it assassinate several nuclear scientists.
ny: Jalali, wofufuza ndi dokotala amene amagwira ntchito yothandiza anthu amene akhudzidwa ndi masoka, anamangidwa paulendo wake wopita ku Iran mu April 2016. mu 2017, Jalali anaweruzidwa kuti aphedwe ku Iran atapezeka wolakwa chifukwa chopereka chidziwitso cha asayansi awiri a nyukiliya ku Israel kuti athandize kupha asayansi angapo a nyukiliya.

en: Rights groups have condemned Jalalis detention, citing Irans pattern of detaining dual nationals and expatriates without due process.
ny: Mabungwe a ufulu wa anthu adadzudzula kumangidwa kwa Jalalis, potchula njira ya Iran yomanga anthu okhala ndi nzika ziwiri ndi anthu ochokera kunja popanda ndondomeko yoyenera.

en: Iran does not recognize dual nationals.
ny: Iran siidziŵa anthu okhala ndi nzika ziŵiri.

en: The announcement came as authorities in Stockholm wrapped up the trial of Hamid Nouri, a former Iranian prosecution official whom Swedish officials arrested in November 2019.
ny: Kulengeza kunabwera pamene akuluakulu a ku Stockholm anamaliza mlandu wa Hamid Nouri, mkulu wakale wa boma wa ku Iran yemwe akuluakulu a ku Sweden anamugwira mu November 2019.

en: Authorities say Nouri played a role in the deaths of political prisoners executed on Iranian government orders at Irans Gohardasht prison during the final phase of the Iran-Iraq war in 1988. Nouri has been held in custody in Sweden since his arrest.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma akuti Nouri anali ndi udindo pa imfa za akaidi andale omwe anaphedwa pa lamulo la boma la Iran ku ndende ya Gohardasht ku Iran mu gawo lomaliza la nkhondo ya Iran ndi Iraq mu 1988.

en: On Wednesday, the final day of Nouri's trial, a Stockholm district court judge set the date of the verdict for July 14.
ny: Lachitatu, tsiku lomaliza la mlandu wa Nouri, woweruza wa khoti la chigawo cha Stockholm anakonza tsiku la chigamulocho kuti likhale pa July 14.

en: Amnesty International put the number of those executed at the prison at 5,000 but said in a 2018 report that the number could be higher.
ny: Bungwe la Amnesty International linati anthu amene anaphedwa kundendeyi analipo 5,000 koma mu lipoti lake la mu 2018, linati chiwerengerocho chikhoza kukhala chachikulu.

en: Human Rights Watch, in a recent report, said, "Iran continues to be one of the worlds leading implementers of the death penalty."
ny: Mu lipoti laposachedwapa la bungwe la Human Rights Watch, linati: "Irani akupitirizabe kukhala mmodzi wa anthu amene amachititsa kwambiri kuti chilango cha imfa chiperekedwe".

en: If Nouri is convicted, he will face a maximum life sentence on charges of international war crimes and human rights abuses. Iran recently summoned the Swedish envoy in protest over Nouris case.
ny: Ngati Nouri apatsidwa chilango, adzapatsidwa chilango chokhala m'ndende moyo wake wonse chifukwa cha milandu ya nkhondo yapadziko lonse ndi kuphwanya ufulu wa anthu.

en: Maja Aberg, senior policy adviser with Amnesty International Sweden, says it is no coincidence that Iran announced Jalalis pending execution just after Swedish prosecutors moved on Nouris trial.
ny: Maja Aberg, mlangizi wamkulu wa mfundo za malamulo ku Amnesty International Sweden, akunena kuti si zachilendo kuti Iran inalengeza kuti Jalalis akuyembekezeredwa kuphedwa atangomaliza kumene oweruza milandu a ku Sweden kusamukira ku mlandu wa Nouris.

en: "It indicates that (Iran) sees him as a kind of piece in the jigsaw puzzle, which is very worrying," Aberg told Sweden's TT news agency.
ny: "Zikusonyeza kuti (Iran) amamuona ngati chidutswa cha puzzle, zomwe ndi zodetsa nkhaŵa kwambiri", Aberg anauza bungwe la Sweden la TT.

en: Swedish law allows for the prosecution of Swedish citizens and other nationals for crimes against international law committed abroad.
ny: Malamulo a ku Sweden amalola kuti nzika za ku Sweden ndi anthu ena a m'dzikolo aziimbidwa mlandu chifukwa cha milandu yolimbana ndi malamulo apadziko lonse yomwe yachitidwa kunja.

en: Some information for this report came from The Associated Press, Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
ny: Zina mwa nkhani za lipoti limeneli zinachokera ku Associated Press, Reuters ndi Agence France-Presse.

en: Erdogan Goes to Riyadh to Seal Rapprochement
ny: Erdogan Apita ku Riyadh Kuti Akhazikitse Mgwirizano

en: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan heads to Saudi Arabia Thursday for a two-day visit aimed at easing old tensions between Ankara and Riyadh.
ny: Pulezidenti wa Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan akupita ku Saudi Arabia Lachinayi paulendo wa masiku aŵiri wokonza kuchepetsa mikangano yakale pakati pa Ankara ndi Riyadh.

en: The Turkish leaders visit with the Saudi king comes after years of rivalry between their once-close countries.
ny: Ulendo wa atsogoleri a dziko la Turkey ndi mfumu ya ku Saudi umachitika pambuyo pa zaka zambiri za kulimbana pakati pa maiko awo omwe kale anali oyandikana.

en: Mehmet Ogutcu is the head of the London Energy Club, a grouping of government and energy sector leaders. Ogutcu says the visit is the culmination of intense international diplomacy.
ny: Mehmet Ogutcu ndi mtsogoleri wa London Energy Club, gulu la atsogoleri a boma ndi a zamagetsi. Ogutcu akuti ulendowu ndi mapeto a diplomasi yapadziko lonse.

en: "President Erdogan has good relations with the king; with the crown prince Muhammad Bin Salman, we had serious difficulties," said Ogutcu. "Now it looks that I believe the*(Britons), and Americans, and the Qataris of course played some role, even the Azeris might have done this. And things are changing and relaxing a bit more, and now at the presidential level, it's going to be sealed."
ny: "Purezidenti Erdogan ali ndi ubale wabwino ndi mfumu; ndi kalonga Muhammad Bin Salman, tinali ndi zovuta zazikulu", adatero Ogutcu. "Tsopano zikuwoneka kuti ndikukhulupirira kuti * (((British), ndi America, ndi Qatari ndithudi anachita mbali ina, ngakhale Azeri akanatha kuchita izi. Ndipo zinthu zikusintha ndikumasuka pang'ono, ndipo tsopano pamlingo wa pulezidenti, zidzatsekedwa. "

en: Erdogan and the crown prince have been bitter rivals. The Turkish president led international condemnation over the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, who was killed inside Saudi Arabias consulate in Istanbul.
ny: Erdogan ndi kalonga wa korona akhala akulimbana kwambiri. Pulezidenti wa Turkey anatsogolera kutsutsidwa kwa dziko lonse chifukwa cha kuphedwa kwa mtolankhani wa ku Saudi Jamal Khashoggi, yemwe anaphedwa m'kati mwa nyumba ya kazembe wa ku Saudi Arabia ku Istanbul.

en: The killing was linked to the crown prince, a charge he denied. But the decision earlier this month to move the Khashoggi murder trial from Istanbul to Riyadh is seen as a gesture by Ankara, opening the way for Erdogan's visit.
ny: Kupha kumeneku kunagwirizanitsidwa ndi kalonga wa korona, mlandu umene iye anakana. Koma chisankho choyambirira mwezi uno cha kusamutsa mlandu wa kuphedwa kwa Khashoggi kuchokera ku Istanbul kupita ku Riyadh chikuwoneka ngati chizindikiro cha Ankara, kutsegula njira ya ulendo wa Erdogan.

en: Ogutcu says with presidential elections due next year, Erdogan is looking for Saudi help to bail out the ailing Turkish economy.
ny: Ogutcu akuti ndi chisankho cha pulezidenti chomwe chiyenera kuchitika chaka chamawa, Erdogan akufuna thandizo la Saudi kuti athandize chuma cha Turkey chomwe chikudwala.

en: "Turkey has an interest in reviving relations with Riyadh because Turkey needs financial support," said Ogutcu. "The Turkish economy is not attracting any significant portfolio investments nor sovereign wealth funds coming to invest Turkey. But this will be a give-and-take package deal involving these countries. So, there are real economic and political security interests involved."
ny: "Turkey ili ndi chidwi chobwezeretsa ubale ndi Riyadh chifukwa Turkey ikufuna thandizo la ndalama", anatero Ogutcu. "Chuma cha Turkey sichikukopa ndalama zambiri kapena ndalama zandale zomwe zikubwera kudzagulitsa ku Turkey. Koma izi zidzakhala mgwirizano wopatsa-ndi-kutenga womwe umakhudza mayiko awa. Chifukwa chake pali zofuna zenizeni zachuma komanso zandale zokhudzana ndi chitetezo".

en: Shared concerns over Iran's growing influence in the region -- along with its nuclear energy program -- provide important common ground between Riyadh and Ankara, says international relations professor Soli Ozel of Istanbul's Kadir Has University, especially as American attention is expected to pivot away from the Middle East and toward China.
ny: Mphunzitsi wa za ubale wa mayiko a Soli Ozel wa pa yunivesite ya Kadir Has ku Istanbul, akunena kuti, nkhaŵa zofanana zokhudza mphamvu ya Iran m'derali - pamodzi ndi pulogalamu yake ya mphamvu za nyukiliya - zimapereka mfundo zofunika pakati pa Riyadh ndi Ankara, makamaka pamene chidwi cha America chikuyembekezeka kuchoka ku Middle East ndi kupita ku China.

en: "Turkey does propose itself as a counterweight to Iran. Both countries have an interest along with all the western countries for Iran not to be as influential throughout the region as it is today," said Ozel. "And the Iranians are also constantly sending signals that they are not going to let others draw them away from those countries - Iraq, Lebanon and Syria - where they have quite a lot of influence."
ny: "Turkey imadzipereka ngati choletsa Iran. Mayiko onsewa ali ndi chidwi pamodzi ndi mayiko onse a kumadzulo kuti Iran isakhale ndi mphamvu m'dera lonse monga momwe ilili lero", anatero Ozel. "Ndipo a Iran akutumiza mauthenga mosalekeza kuti sadzalola ena kuwachotsa m'mayiko - Iraq, Lebanon ndi Syria - kumene ali ndi mphamvu zambiri".

en: Erdogan's Saudi visit is part of a wider policy of seeking to repair relations across the region in a bid to end its isolation. The Turkish president has recently visited the United Arab Emirates and earlier this month hosted the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.
ny: Ulendo wa Erdogan ku Saudi ndi mbali ya ndondomeko yaikulu yofuna kukonza ubale m'dera lonse pofuna kuthetsa kudzipatula kwake. Pulezidenti wa Turkey posachedwapa anapita ku United Arab Emirates ndipo kumayambiriro kwa mwezi uno analandira pulezidenti wa Israeli, Isaac Herzog.

en: But analyst Ozel warns Ankara is in a vulnerable position.
ny: Koma katswiri wina wofufuza zinthu, dzina lake Ozel, akuchenjeza kuti dziko la Ankara lili pa vuto.

en: "Turkey alienated, insulted, offended a lot of countries with which it had at least decent relations. And they all recognize that this burst of diplomacy is coming out of weakness rather than strength," said Ozel.
ny: "Turkey inachotsa, inanyoza, inachitira chipongwe mayiko ambiri omwe anali ndi ubale wabwino ndi iwo. Ndipo onse amazindikira kuti kuphulika kwa ndale kumeneku kumachokera ku kufooka osati ku mphamvu", anatero Ozel.

en: But analysts say Ankara is banking on its importance as a potential bulwark to Iranian ambitions, a factor that may help overcome any remaining hostility among the neighbors it is trying to win back.
ny: Koma akatswiri amanena kuti Ankara akudalira kufunika kwake monga malo olimba mtima a zolinga za Iran, chinthu chimene chingathandize kuthetsa chidani chilichonse pakati pa anansi ake omwe akuyesera kuti abwezeretse.

en: Executions, Detentions Hang Over Saudi Legal Reforms
ny: Kuphedwa, Kumangidwa Kumatanganidwa ndi Kusintha Malamulo a ku Saudi Arabia

en: Saudi Arabia is pushing to revamp its harsh justice system but reforms are overshadowed by executions and tough treatment of dissidents, raising questions about how much will change.
ny: Saudi Arabia ikuyesetsa kusintha dongosolo lake lachiweruzo koma kusintha kwake kukuphimbidwa ndi kuphedwa ndi kuzunzidwa kwa otsutsa, zomwe zikufunsa mafunso okhudza momwe zinthu zidzasinthire.

en: The kingdom is known for its strict interpretation of Islamic sharia law, which forms the basis of its judicial system.
ny: Ufumuwu umadziwika ndi kumasulira kwake kolimba kwa malamulo a Chisilamu, omwe amapanga maziko a dongosolo lake lachiweruzo.

en: But in recent months it has moved ahead with reforms that analysts say could make its courts function more like others in the Middle East.
ny: Koma m'miyezi yaposachedwapa, dzikoli lakhala likupitirizabe kusintha zinthu zimene akatswiri ena amanena kuti zingachititse kuti makhoti ake azigwira ntchito ngati makhoti ena a ku Middle East.

en: That effort hinges on a series of new laws for sensitive issues like women's divorce rights and judges' power to determine criminal sentences.
ny: Khama limenelo limadalira malamulo atsopano okhudza nkhani zovuta monga ufulu wa akazi wosudzulana ndi mphamvu ya oweruza yolamula milandu.

en: Announced last year by de facto ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first written penal code, appear to align with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening up to the world and softening its extremist image.
ny: Malangizo amenewa, kuphatikizapo malamulo oyamba a milandu, analengezedwa ndi kalonga wa dziko la Saudi Arabia, Mohammed bin Salman, chaka chatha.

en: Even critics concede the changes could make Saudi courts more predictable, in some cases.
ny: Ngakhale otsutsa amavomereza kuti kusintha kumeneku kungapangitse makhoti a ku Saudi Arabia kukhala olingaliridwa bwino, m'zochitika zina.

en: But there is no expectation that restrictions on free speech will ease, or that the legal system will treat more favorably perceived opponents of the government.
ny: Koma palibe chiyembekezo chakuti malamulo a ufulu wa kulankhula adzatsika, kapena kuti malamulo adzachitira zinthu mokomera kwambiri anthu amene amawaona kuti ndi otsutsa boma.

en: And despite the reforms, authorities have simultaneously provided reminders of what gave Saudi Arabia its ruthless reputation in the first place, notably the mass execution of 81 men in a single day in March for offenses related to "terrorism."
ny: Ndipo mosasamala kanthu za kusintha, akuluakulu aboma nthaŵi yomweyo akhala akukumbutsa za chimene chinapatsa Saudi Arabia mbiri yake yopanda chifundo poyamba, makamaka kuphedwa kwa anthu 81 tsiku limodzi mu March chifukwa cha zolakwa zokhudzana ndi "uchigaŵenga".

en: 'Notorious' system
ny: 'Kudziwika' dongosolo

en: Two new laws have already been approved by the Saudi Cabinet. One governs the admissibility of evidence, previously at the judges' discretion.
ny: Malamulo aŵiri atsopano anavomerezedwa kale ndi nduna za boma la Saudi.

en: The second, a family law, is to take effect in June. In a traditionally male-dominated system, it expands the rights of divorced women to alimony and custody of their children.
ny: Lamulo lachiŵiri, lomwe ndi la malamulo a banja, lidzayamba kugwira ntchito mu June.

en: Announcing the new law in March, Prince Mohammed said it represented "a major qualitative leap" for women's rights and "family stability."
ny: Polengeza lamulo latsopanoli mu March, kalonga Mohammed anati limaimira "kupita patsogolo kwakukulu" kwa ufulu wa akazi ndi "kukhazikika kwa banja".

en: The reforms seem partly to cater to foreign firms whose investment the kingdom is courting, said Adel al-Saeed, vice president of the European Saudi Organization for Human Rights.
ny: Adel al-Saeed, wachiwiri kwa pulezidenti wa bungwe la European Saudi Organization for Human Rights, anati, kusintha kumeneku kukuoneka kuti kukugwira ntchito kwa makampani akunja amene ufumuwo ukufuna kuti agwire nawo ntchito.

en: "The owners of capital are afraid of investing in this country, which is notorious in the legal aspect, so these laws are intended to change the image," he said.
ny: "Omwe ali ndi ndalama amaopa kuyika ndalama m'dziko lino, lomwe ndi lodziwika bwino pa nkhani za malamulo, choncho malamulowa akufuna kusintha chithunzi cha dzikoli", iye anatero.

en: The new penal code, yet to be unveiled, could bring further dramatic changes.
ny: Lamulo latsopano la malamulo a milandu, lomwe silinaululidwebe, lingabweretse kusintha kwakukulu.

en: Under sharia, only apostasy, theft, revolt, armed robbery, adultery, drinking alcohol and slander carry prescribed sentences. Judges are left to determine punishment in other cases.
ny: Pansi pa malamulo a Chisilamu, amangolamula anthu ngati apanduka, kuba, kupanduka, kuba ndi zida, kuchita chigololo, kumwa mowa ndi kunyoza.

en: With a penal code in place, "the state will expect judges to rely not on their own training in sharia but instead on the legal rules (based on sharia) approved by the state," said Nathan Brown, an academic at George Washington University.
ny: Pokhala ndi malamulo a milandu, "boma lidzayembekezera oweruza kudalira osati maphunziro awo a sharia koma m'malo mwake malamulo a malamulo (ochokera pa sharia) ovomerezedwa ndi boma", anatero Nathan Brown, katswiri wa maphunziro pa George Washington University.

en: "As a result, Saudi Arabia will look much more like a civil law system, much like most states in the region," said Brown, who has studied the Saudi reforms.
ny: Brown, yemwe waphunzira za kusintha kwa zinthu ku Saudi, anati: "Zotsatira zake, dziko la Saudi Arabia lidzakhala ngati boma lokhala ndi malamulo a boma, mofanana ndi mayiko ambiri a m'derali".

en: The result should be more "predictability," said Abdullah Alaoudh, a U.S.-based legal expert and government critic, as new rules "take away from the leeway ... that the judges used to have."
ny: Zotsatira zake ziyenera kukhala "kudziŵikiratu", anatero Abdullah Alaoudh, katswiri wa zamalamulo wokhala ku United States ndi wotsutsa boma, popeza malamulo atsopano "akutenga ufulu... umene oweruza anali nawo".

en: But tighter regulation by the monarchy also "creates a larger problem: lack of independence," he added.
ny: Koma malamulo okhwima a ufumu wachifumu "amapanganso vuto lalikulu: kusowa kwa ufulu", anawonjezera motero.

en: The king is the head of the Saudi judiciary and acts as the final court of appeal.
ny: Mfumu ndi mtsogoleri wa oweruza a ku Saudi ndipo ndi amene amaweruza milandu.

en: Alaoudh's own father, prominent cleric Salman al-Awdah, has been held since 2017, seemingly in retaliation for a Twitter post that clashed with Saudi Arabia's policy at the time of isolating Qatar.
ny: Bambo ake a Alaoudh, yemwe ndi munthu wotchuka wa chipembedzo, dzina lake Salman al-Awdah, wakhala m'ndende kuyambira mu 2017, zikuoneka kuti anali kubwezera chifukwa cha nkhani imene analemba pa Twitter yomwe inatsutsana ndi mfundo za Saudi Arabia pa nthawi imene Qatar inali kuikidwa payokha.

en: He is one of many detained in an apparent crackdown on dissent and those who could challenge Prince Mohammed's power.
ny: Iye ndi mmodzi wa anthu ambiri amene anamangidwa chifukwa cha kupanikizika kwa anthu amene anali ndi maganizo osiyana ndi a mfumu komanso anthu amene akanatha kutsutsa ulamuliro wa kalonga Mohammed.

en: One of the most prominent examples is former crown prince Mohammed bin Nayef, the CIA ally respected in the West for his efforts to counter violent extremism, but who King Salman ousted from the line of succession.
ny: Chimodzi mwa zitsanzo zoonekera kwambiri ndi kalonga wakale wa korona Mohammed bin Nayef, mnzake wa CIA wolemekezedwa ku West chifukwa cha kuyesetsa kwake kulimbana ndi chiwawa choopsa, koma amene Mfumu Salman inamuchotsa pa mzere wa kulandirana ufumu.

en: Prince Nayef has not been seen in public since reports of his arrest in March 2020. His detention was never officially confirmed.
ny: Prince Nayef sanaonedwe poyera kuyambira pomwe panali malipoti onena za kumangidwa kwake mu March 2020.

en: Shadow of Khashoggi
ny: Mthunzi wa Khashoggi.

en: For government opponents, such cases reinforce questions about what difference the ongoing justice reforms will make.
ny: Kwa otsutsa boma, milandu yoteroyo imalimbitsa mafunso okhudza mmene kusintha kwa malamulo kumene kukuchitika kudzakhudzira zinthu.

en: "In my view, this is all window-dressing," said Madawi al-Rasheed, a U.K.-based academic and spokesperson for the opposition National Assembly Party founded by exiles.
ny: "M'malingaliro anga, zonsezi ndi zokongoletsa", anatero Madawi al-Rasheed, katswiri wa maphunziro a ku UK ndi mneneri wa National Assembly Party ya chipani chotsutsa chomwe chinakhazikitsidwa ndi othawa kwawo.

en: "It's very, very difficult to see what the meaning is of these reforms apart from the project of portraying (Prince Mohammed) as a reformer."
ny: "N'zovuta kwambiri kuona tanthauzo la kusintha kumeneku kupatulapo kujambula (Prince Mohammed) monga woyambitsa kusintha".

en: Hanging over any discussion of justice and legal reform in Saudi Arabia is the 2018 murder and dismemberment of critic and columnist Jamal Khashoggi in the kingdom's Istanbul consulate.
ny: Nkhani yokhudza chilungamo ndi kusintha malamulo ku Saudi Arabia ndi nkhani ya kuphedwa ndi kum'dula ziwalo kwa wolemba nkhani ndi wotsutsa Jamal Khashoggi mu 2018 ku ofesi ya kazembe wa ku Istanbul.

en: A U.S. intelligence assessment found Prince Mohammed himself "approved" an operation to capture or kill Khashoggi, though Saudi officials deny this and say it was a "rogue" operation.
ny: Kufufuza kwa zinsinsi za ku America kunasonyeza kuti kalonga Mohammed "anavomereza" ntchito yogwira kapena kupha Khashoggi, ngakhale kuti akuluakulu a ku Saudi Arabia amakana zimenezi ndipo amati inali ntchito "yopanda pake".

en: In April, before Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan visited Riyadh on Thursday and embraced Prince Mohammed, Turkey transferred the trial in absentia of 26 suspects in the Khashoggi case to Saudi Arabia.
ny: Mu April, pulezidenti wa Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan asanapite ku Riyadh Lachinayi ndi kukakumbatira kalonga Mohammed, Turkey inasamutsa mlandu wa anthu 26 omwe ankayesedwa pa mlandu wa Khashoggi kupita ku Saudi Arabia.

en: Turkey's decision drew anguished protest from lawyers and Khashoggi's fiancée, who insisted Saudi courts couldn't possibly hold a credible trial.
ny: Chigamulo cha Turkey chinadzutsa chitsutso cha apolisi ndi mkwatibwi wa Khashoggi, amene anaumirira kuti makhoti a ku Saudi sakanatha kuchita mlandu wodalirika.

en: For the loved ones of those locked away, Khashoggi's killing fuels a uniform fear of speaking out.
ny: Kwa okondedwa a anthu omwe atsekeredwa m'ndende, kuphedwa kwa Khashoggi kumachititsa mantha a kulankhula.

en: "I want to, many do, but we're scared," said a friend of Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz, who has been detained along with his father since 2018.
ny: "Ndikufuna, ambiri amafuna, koma tikuopa", anatero mnzake wa Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz, yemwe wakhala akusungidwa pamodzi ndi atate wake kuyambira 2018.

en: "Everyone knows what happened to Khashoggi."
ny: "Aliyense akudziwa zimene zinachitikira Khashoggi".

en: Moroccan Prison Program Sets Out to De-Radicalize IS Veterans
ny: Pulogalamu ya Ndende ya ku Morocco Yokonza Kuti Akatswiri a IS Asakhale Odzikuza

en: As a combatant for the Islamic State group who left his native Morocco to join what he felt was a holy fight in Syria, Mohsin says he saw all the horrors of war. "A terrifying experience," he says.
ny: Monga womenya nkhondo wa gulu la Islamic State amene anachoka kwawo ku Morocco kuti akaloŵe mu nkhondo yopatulika ku Syria, Mohsin akuti anaona zoopsa zonse za nkhondo.

en: Now a prisoner, the 38-year-old claims he is no longer the fanatic he was then, enraged with a murderous hatred for non-Muslims. Captured in Turkey and extradited to Morocco, he is serving a 10-year prison term on terrorism charges.
ny: Tsopano ali m'ndende, munthu wa zaka 38 uja akuti salinso munthu wokonda kwambiri zipembedzo ngati mmene analili kale, wokwiya ndi udani wake wakupha anthu omwe si Asilamu.

en: Now the former fighter has graduated with 14 other prisoners convicted of terror offenses from a Morocco de-radicalization program that might make them more eligible for an early release.
ny: Tsopano womenyera nkhondo wakaleyu anamaliza maphunziro ake pamodzi ndi akaidi ena 14 amene anaimbidwa mlandu wa uchigaŵenga kuchokera ku pulogalamu ya ku Morocco yochotsa tsankho imene ingawathandize kuti amasulidwe msanga.

en: The Associated Press and other media were invited to observe their graduation ceremony Thursday in a prison in Sale near the Moroccan capital, Rabat, and to interview some prisoners under monitored and controlled conditions. Prison administration officials picked out three men they said were willing to be interviewed.
ny: Associated Press ndi atolankhani ena anaitanidwa kukaona mwambo wawo womaliza maphunziro Lachinayi m'ndende ya ku Sale pafupi ndi likulu la Morocco, Rabat, ndi kufunsa akaidi ena m'mikhalidwe yoyang'aniridwa ndi yolamulidwa.

en: Officials stipulated that the inmates shouldn't be identified by their full names and that their faces mustn't be shown, citing privacy reasons.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma analamula kuti akaidiwo asafotokozedwe mayina awo onse ndiponso kuti nkhope zawo zisasonyezedwe, potchula zifukwa zosonyeza kuti anthuwo ndi achinsinsi.

en: But prison officials didn't listen to the interviews or intervene to shut down media lines of questioning or inmates' answers.
ny: Koma akuluakulu a ndende sanamvetsere kufunsa mafunso kapena kuloŵererapo kuti atseke njira zofunsira mafunso kapena mayankho a akaidi.

en: The 15 inmates in crisp shirts and trousers stood solemnly for Morocco's national anthem and were handed certificates. Prison officials said the de-radicalization program consisted of three months of classes in prison on religion, law and economics, and that inmates also received training on how to start a business. These most recent graduates were the ninth batch since the program started in 2017.
ny: M'ndendeyi, anthu 15 omwe anavala malaya ndi mathalauza owala anaimirira mokondwera poimba nyimbo ya fuko la Morocco ndipo anapatsidwa satifiketi. Akuluakulu a ndendeyi adati pulogalamu yoletsa kupanduka inali ndi maphunziro a miyezi itatu kundende pa nkhani zachipembedzo, malamulo ndi zachuma, komanso kuti andendewo adalandira maphunziro a momwe angayambitsire bizinesi. Omaliza maphunzirowa anali gulu lachisanu ndi chinayi kuyambira pomwe pulogalamuyi idayamba mu 2017.

en: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, the director of social-cultural action and prisoner reintegration at Morocco's prison administration, said the program is entirely voluntary and works with inmates "to change their behavior and improve their life path."
ny: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, mkulu wa ntchito za chikhalidwe cha anthu ndi kubwezeretsa akaidi m'ndende za ku Morocco, anati pulogalamuyi ndi yodzifunira ndipo imagwira ntchito ndi akaidi "kuti asinthe khalidwe lawo ndi kusintha moyo wawo".

en: "It enables prisoners to form an awareness of the gravity of their mistakes," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Zimathandiza akaidi kuzindikira kuti zimene achitazo n'zoopsa kwambiri".

en: Graduating from the program doesn't make inmates automatically eligible for early release, but does increase their chances of getting a royal pardon or a reduced sentence. That's been the case for just over half the program's 222 graduates so far, the prison administration says. Since 2019, the training has also been offered to women convicted under Morocco's Anti-Terrorism Act. Ten women have graduated so far — all of them since released, including eight with pardons.
ny: Maphunzirowa sakhala oyenerera kumasulidwa msanga, koma amawonjezera mwayi wawo wopeza chikhululukiro chachifumu kapena kuchepetsedwa kwa chilango. Izi zakhala zikuchitika kwa opitilira theka la omaliza maphunziro 222 a pulogalamuyi mpaka pano, akuti oyang'anira ndende. Kuyambira 2019, maphunzirowa aperekedwanso kwa azimayi omwe adaweruzidwa pansi pa Lamulo Lolimbana ndi Uchigawenga ku Morocco. Azimayi khumi amaliza maphunziro mpaka pano  onse atamasulidwa, kuphatikiza asanu ndi atatu omwe ali ndi chikhululukiro.

en: Called "Moussalaha," meaning "reconciliation" in Arabic, the program is offered to prisoners who have demonstrated a readiness to disavow extremism.
ny: Pulogalamuyi imatchedwa "Moussalaha", kutanthauza "kuyanjanitsa" m'Chiarabu, ndipo imaperekedwa kwa akaidi amene asonyeza kuti ndi okonzeka kukana zinthu zankhanza.

en: Mohsin said he left to fight in Syria in 2012. A school dropout as a teen, he said he "was virtually illiterate and couldn't discern good from bad." He said he was radicalized by people who showed him extremist videos "about the divine obligation to battle those who don't follow Islamic principles and to murder non-Muslims."
ny: Mohsin anati anapita kukamenyana ku Syria mu 2012. Anasiya sukulu ali wachinyamata, ndipo anati "anali wosaphunzira kwenikweni ndipo sankatha kusiyanitsa chabwino ndi choipa". Iye anati iye anali wolimbikitsidwa ndi anthu omwe anamuonetsa mavidiyo oopsa "a udindo waumulungu womenyana ndi anthu omwe samatsatira mfundo za Chisilamu ndi kupha anthu omwe si Asilamu".

en: In Syria, "I saw massacres, rapes, and thefts," he said. "I concluded after a time that the fight being conducted in the name of Islam had nothing to do with our religion."
ny: Iye anati: "Ndinaona anthu akuphedwa, kugwiriridwa, ndi kuba, ndipo patapita nthaŵi ndinapeza kuti nkhondo imene ikuchitika m'dzina la Chisilamu ilibe chochita ndi chipembedzo chathu".

en: He escaped to Turkey in 2018 and was detained for a year there before being extradited to Morocco.
ny: Anathawa ku Turkey mu 2018 ndipo anamangidwa kwa chaka chimodzi kumeneko asanaperekedwe ku Morocco.

en: He says he has now disavowed extremism.
ny: Iye akuti tsopano wakana chiwawa.

en: "That period of my life has passed," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Nthawi imeneyo ya moyo wanga yadutsa".

en: Numerous Moroccans have traveled to Syria, Iraq and elsewhere to join extremist groups. Morocco has also experienced multiple attacks itself. Five suicide attacks in Casablanca in 2003 killed 33 people. In 2011, an explosion destroyed a cafe in Marrakech, killing 17 people, most of them foreign tourists.
ny: Anthu ambiri a ku Morocco anapita ku Syria, Iraq ndi kwina kulikonse kuti akalowe m'magulu oopsa. Morocco yakumana ndi ziwopsezo zambiri. Kuwukira kwachisanu ku Casablanca mu 2003 kunapha anthu 33. Mu 2011, kuphulika kunawononga cafe ku Marrakech, kupha anthu 17, ambiri mwa iwo alendo akunja.

en: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, a clinical psychologist and member of the program's scientific committee, said among 156 people who have been released after attending the courses, just one has been caught committing a crime again.
ny: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, katswiri wa zamaganizo ndi membala wa komiti ya sayansi ya pulogalamuyo, anati pakati pa anthu 156 amene anamasulidwa pambuyo pa kupita ku maphunzirowo, mmodzi yekha ndiye wagwidwa akuchita mlandu kachiwiri.

en: That person was convicted of a non-terrorism-related offense, he said.
ny: Iye anati munthu ameneyo anaweruzidwa chifukwa cha mlandu wosagwirizana ndi uchigawenga.

en: Iran Gets Opportunity to Sell Auto Parts to Russian Carmaker
ny: Iran Imalandira Mwayi Wogulitsa Mbali za Magalimoto ku Russian Carmaker

en: A member of Iran's syndicate of car parts manufacturers says Iranian producers have an opportunity to export their wares to a Russian carmaker, state media reported.
ny: M'modzi mwa anthu a bungwe la Iran la opanga magalimoto akuti opanga magalimoto a ku Iran ali ndi mwayi wogulitsa katundu wawo ku kampani yopanga magalimoto ya ku Russia, malinga ndi zomwe atolankhani a boma anena.

en: The late Monday report quoted Hossein Bahrainian as saying "a prominent Russian car maker" requested parts from Iran. He did not name the manufacturer. He said it requested brake parts, airbags, air-conditioner parts and other components.
ny: Lipoti la Lolemba madzulo linatchula Hossein Bahrainian akunena kuti "wopanga magalimoto wotchuka wa ku Russia" anapempha zigawo kuchokera ku Iran.

en: Both Iran and Russia are under U.S. sanctions but the export of Iranian cars and car parts is not subject to sanctions.
ny: Iran ndi Russia onse ali pansi pa zilango za US koma katundu wa magalimoto a ku Iran ndi mbali za magalimoto sakhala pansi pa zilango.

en: The import of automobiles to Iran is also not subject to sanctions. However, Tehran has not imported cars since 2018, after the U.S. withdrew from a nuclear deal between Iran and world powers and imposed oil and banking sanctions on Iran.
ny: Komabe, Tehran sinatengepo magalimoto kuyambira 2018, pambuyo poti US idatuluka pamgwirizano wa nyukiliya pakati pa Iran ndi mayiko amphamvu padziko lonse lapansi ndikukhazikitsa mafuta ndi mabanki ku Iran.

en: Western nations stopped exporting to Russia after the invasion of Ukraine.
ny: Mayiko a Kumadzulo anasiya kutumiza katundu ku Russia pambuyo pa kuukira Ukraine.

en: Iran in recent years has exported car radiators and suspension systems to Russia. In the past it exported cars to Iraq, Syria and Venezuela.
ny: M'zaka zaposachedwapa, Iran yakhala ikugulitsa ku Russia makina otayirira magalimoto ndi ma suspension.

en: Tehran and Moscow have had close relations in recent years, especially after Iran's sole nuclear power plant went online in 2011 with help from Russia.
ny: Tehran ndi Moscow akhala ndi ubale wapamtima m'zaka zaposachedwapa, makamaka pambuyo poti malo opangira mphamvu za nyukiliya okhaokha a ku Iran ayamba kugwira ntchito mu 2011 mothandizidwa ndi Russia.

en: Separately on Tuesday, Iran said it has played a mediatory role in the war in Ukraine.
ny: Kumbali ina, Lachiwiri, Iran inati yakhala ndi udindo wothandizira nkhondo ku Ukraine.

en: "So far twice I have conveyed messages from the foreign minister of Ukraine to my Russian counterpart," said Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian in a phone conversation with his Irish counterpart. He said Iran supports diplomatic solutions for restoring peace and stability.
ny: "Komabe kawiri ndatumizira mauthenga kuchokera kwa nduna ya zamayiko akunja ya Ukraine kwa mnzake wa Russia", anatero nduna ya zamayiko akunja Hossein Amir Abdollahian pokambirana pafoni ndi mnzake wa ku Ireland. Iye anati Iran imathandizira njira zandale zobwezeretsa mtendere ndi bata.

en: Abdollahian did not elaborate but said Iran "opposes war and displacement of human beings in Ukraine," and other paces like Yemen, the Palestinian lands and Afghanistan.
ny: Abdollahian sananene zambiri koma anati Iran "imatsutsa nkhondo ndi kusamuka kwa anthu ku Ukraine", ndi njira zina monga Yemen, madera a Palestina ndi Afghanistan.

en: Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage
ny: Kusiyanasiyana, Maganizo Atsopano Amagwiritsidwa Ntchito pa Kufalitsa Nkhani za ku Middle East

en: Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism. When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.
ny: Natalia Sancha wakhala akugwiritsa ntchito njira yogwirizanitsa ndi ntchito ya utolankhani. Pamene ali pa ntchito, amalankhula ndi ena omwe amafotokoza nkhani yomweyi ponena za malingaliro awo.

en: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.
ny: Zimenezi zimachitika chifukwa cha chidwi chofuna kufotokoza nkhani zimene sizinafotokozedwe bwino, koma monga mtolankhani wamkazi m'dera limene amuna ambiri amakhala, iye akuti nthaŵi zonse ntchito yogwirizana ndi kuthandiza akazi amene amagwira nawo ntchito yakhala yofunika kwambiri.

en: "I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story," the 42-year-old journalist said.
ny: "Ndinkalankhula ndi atolankhani aamuna ndi aakazi, ndipo nthaŵi zonse ndinkazindikira kuti akazi anali ndi lingaliro lofanana, chifukwa tinali ndi zokumana nazo zofanana pamene tinali kufotokoza nkhaniyo", anatero mtolankhani wazaka 42.

en: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.
ny: Njira yogwirizanitsa imeneyi inayamba kugwira ntchito mu 2020 pamene wofalitsa anafunsa Sancha ngati anali wofunitsitsa kulemba buku lonena za Syria.

en: She countered with a better offer.
ny: Iye anayankha ndi kupereka chinthu chabwino.

en: "I told him that a collective narrative by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect," she said. "I could have written the book myself, but it would not have the same sense."
ny: "Ndinamuuza kuti nkhani imene akazi olemba nkhani adzalemba yokhudza dera lonseli idzakhala ndi zotsatira zosiyana", iye anatero. "Ndikanatha kulemba bukuli ndekha, koma sizikanakhala ndi tanthauzo lomwelo".

en: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.
ny: Sancha, yemwe anachokera ku Andalusia, kum'mwera kwa Spain, anakhala zaka 14 ku Middle East akufotokoza za nkhondo ku Iraq, Syria ndi Yemen, komanso akufotokoza za ku Egypt, Lebanon ndi Tunisia.

en: She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following a mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020.
ny: Posachedwapa wakhala akugwira ntchito ndi dipatimenti yolankhulana ya European Union, atachoka ku Beirut chifukwa cha matenda pambuyo pa kuphulika kwakukulu komwe kunagwedeza mzindawo mu 2020.

en: Women "have a different experience because we would go to places that our male colleagues were not used to. Not because we're smarter, but just because the majority of the region is still Arab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.
ny: Akazi "ali ndi zochitika zosiyana chifukwa timapita kumalo omwe amuna athu sanazolowere. Osati chifukwa ndife anzeru, koma chifukwa chakuti ambiri m'derali adakali achiarabu, Asilamu komanso osagwirizana ndi amuna kapena akazi", Sancha adauza VOA.

en: Having women reporters has an impact, she noted.
ny: Iye anati kukhala ndi akazi olemba nkhani kumakhudza kwambiri.

en: "If I put myself in the position of the reader, I would prefer to have a woman telling me the story because it is going to be about 100 percent of the population, which means you are going to have a more inclusive narrative on the conflict."
ny: "Ngati ndikanaika ndekha m'malo mwa woŵerenga, ndikanakonda mkazi kundiuza nkhaniyo chifukwa idzakhala pafupifupi 100 peresenti ya anthu, zomwe zikutanthauza kuti mudzakhala ndi nkhani yophatikizapo kwambiri pa nkhondoyo".

en: For her book, Sancha reached out to other women who cover the Middle East, to ensure diverse perspectives from foreign and local reporters.
ny: Kuti apange buku lake, Sancha anafikira akazi ena amene amafotokoza za Middle East, kuti atsimikizire malingaliro osiyanasiyana ochokera kwa atolankhani akunja ndi am'deralo.

en: The result of the nearly two-year collaboration is Bullets for All, released in Spanish in April.
ny: Zotsatira za kugwirizana kwa zaka pafupifupi ziŵiri ndi Bullets for All, yotulutsidwa m'Chisipanishi mu April.

en: In the book, "we tell one story with different voices that represent all the women" from the region, Sancha said.
ny: Sancha anati, m'bukuli, "timalongosola nkhani imodzi ndi mawu osiyanasiyana omwe amaimira akazi onse" ochokera m'derali.

en: Each offers a personal perspective on covering historic moments, including the collapse of autocratic governments, popular protest movements and war. It also examines the discrimination and harassment women face in the newsroom and on assignment.
ny: Nkhani iliyonse imapereka lingaliro laumwini pa nkhani za mbiri yakale, kuphatikizapo kugwa kwa maboma olamulira okhaokha, magulu otsutsa anthu ndi nkhondo.

en: Making connections
ny: Kupanga maulalo.

en: Understanding language and culture goes a long way toward making progress in the region, says Maya Gebeily. The Reuters bureau chief for Lebanon, Syria and Jordan is one of the contributors to the book.
ny: Maya Gebeily, yemwe ndi mkulu wa bungwe la Reuters loona za mayiko a Lebanon, Syria ndi Jordan, ndi mmodzi mwa anthu amene analemba bukuli.

en: "There's a lot to say and show from the perspective of women reporters who were also then influenced by the women that they met as they were doing their reporting," she said.
ny: "Pali zambiri zoti tizinena ndi kusonyeza kuchokera ku maganizo a olemba nkhani achikazi amene nawonso anakhudzidwa ndi akazi amene anakumana nawo pamene anali kuchita lipoti lawo", iye anati.

en: Born in the U.S. to Lebanese parents, Gebeily started her journalism career in 2013 with a local news site in Beirut, Lebanon. She went on to cover the region for Agence France-Presse before joining Reuters.
ny: Wobadwira ku US kwa makolo a ku Lebanon, Gebeily adayamba ntchito yake yolemba nkhani mu 2013 ndi tsamba lapawebusayiti ku Beirut, Lebanon. Anapitilizabe kufotokozera derali ku Agence France-Presse asanapite ku Reuters.

en: Gebeily said her American and Lebanese background helped her understand the region better, which in turn has shaped her reporting. Knowing the local language is an important part of that.
ny: Gebeily anati mbiri yake ya ku America ndi ku Lebanon inamuthandiza kumvetsa bwino derali, zomwe zinam'thandiza kuti azilemba nkhani.

en: "When interviewing a minister or a displaced person or an activist, the most important element is getting their trust," she said. "If you're able to speak the language and make them feel comfortable from the beginning, it changes everything. It grants you a very beautiful kind of access."
ny: "Pamene mukufunsa mafunso nduna kapena munthu wothaŵa kwawo kapena wochita nawo ntchito, chinthu chofunika kwambiri ndicho kupeza chidaliro chawo", iye anatero. "Ngati mungathe kulankhula chinenerocho ndi kuwapangitsa kumva bwino kuyambira pachiyambi, zimasintha zonse. Zimakupatsani mwayi wokwanira".

en: In addition to Iraq and Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, has also traveled to Syria to cover the war against the Islamic State (IS) militant group.
ny: Kuwonjezera pa kupita ku Iraq ndi Lebanon, Gebeily, wazaka 30, anapitanso ku Syria kukafotokoza za nkhondo yolimbana ndi gulu la zigawenga la Islamic State (IS).

en: "Ive been very privileged to access some communities directly without having to work with a translator or a fixer, which also shapes the way that the stories come out," she said.
ny: "Ndakhala ndi mwayi waukulu kwambiri wofikira anthu ena mwachindunji popanda kugwira ntchito ndi womasulira kapena wokonza, zomwe zimakhudzanso momwe nkhanizo zimawonekera", iye anatero.

en: Syrian-Kurdish journalist Khabat Abbas, who has covered the war in Syria, attests to the importance of that.
ny: Mtolankhani wa ku Syria-Kurd, Khabat Abbas, yemwe wafotokoza za nkhondo ku Syria, akutsimikizira kufunika kwa zimenezo.

en: "Its knowing the language and the culture that gives people a sense of comfort to open up to you," she told VOA from Qamishli, Syria.
ny: "Kudziwa chinenero ndi chikhalidwe kumapatsa anthu kumverera kotonthoza kuti atseguke kwa inu", iye anauza VOA kuchokera ku Qamishli, Syria.

en: That knowledge helped when Abbas, 34, was on assignment with Sancha in March 2021. They traveled to a Kurdish-run detention camp in northeast Syria and interviewed female jihadists affiliated with IS, for a story in El Pais.
ny: Kudziwa zimenezi kunathandiza pamene Abbas, wazaka 34, anali pa ntchito ndi Sancha mu March 2021. Iwo anapita ku msasa wosungirako anthu a ku Kurdish kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Syria ndipo anafunsa akazi a jihadist ogwirizana ndi IS, kuti alembe nkhani ku El Pais.

en: "While in Qamishli [in northeast Syria], I ran into two British journalists, very good colleagues of mine, who were disappointed after Shamima Begum and other women at the camp refused to talk to them," Sancha said, referring to a young woman who left her home in Britain aged 15 to join IS.
ny: "Pamene ndinali ku Qamishli [kum'maŵa kwa Syria], ndinakumana ndi atolankhani aŵiri a ku Britain, anzanga abwino kwambiri, amene anakhumudwa pamene Shamima Begum ndi akazi ena m'ndendeyo anakana kulankhula nawo", anatero Sancha, akumanena za mtsikana wina amene anachoka kwawo ku Britain ali ndi zaka 15 kuti akaloŵe m'gulu la IS.

en: "Their fixer was a man, so the jihadist women didnt talk to them because they are radical, and they dont talk to men. But then I was able to sit with Shamima and other women, who gave fantastic interviews from inside their tents," Sancha said.
ny: "Wokonza zinthu anali mwamuna, choncho akazi a jihad sanawalankhule chifukwa iwo ndi okhwima, ndipo salankhula ndi amuna. Koma kenako ndinatha kukhala pansi ndi Shamima ndi akazi ena, omwe anapereka zokambirana zabwino kuchokera mkati mwa mahema awo", Sancha anati.

en: Abbas had a role in getting to talk to those women, she added.
ny: Iye anawonjezera kuti Abbas anali ndi mbali yofunika kwambiri pokambirana ndi akaziwo.

en: Unlike Sancha and Gebeily, Abbas grew up in the marginalized Kurdish region of Syria, where until the war began in 2011, journalism effectively didnt exist.
ny: Mosiyana ndi Sancha ndi Gebeily, Abbas anakulira m'dera la anthu a ku Kurdistan ku Syria, kumene mpaka pamene nkhondo inayamba mu 2011, ntchito ya utolankhani inalibe.

en: "Ordinary people in our region were used to seeing women pick up arms and fight, but they werent used to seeing a woman hold a camera on the streets and on front lines," Abbas said. "It took a lot of sacrificing for me to convince my family and society that Im as good, if not better, as my male colleagues."
ny: "Anthu wamba m'dera lathu anali atazolowera kuona akazi akukweza zida ndi kumenyana, koma sanazolowere kuona mkazi akugwira kamera m'misewu ndi m'mphepete mwa nkhondo", anatero Abbas. "Zinanditengera kudzipereka kwambiri kuti ndikhulupirire banja langa ndi anthu kuti ndine wabwino, ngati sindiri wabwino, monga anzanga aamuna".

en: Journalism appealed to her because the story of the Middle East has often been told by male journalists, both local and foreign.
ny: Ntchito ya utolankhani inamukopa chifukwa chakuti nkhani ya ku Middle East nthaŵi zambiri imafotokozedwa ndi atolankhani achimuna, a m'dzikolo ndi akunja.

en: "The narrative hasnt changed because of that, but if local and international women journalists get a real chance to tell the story of the Middle East, that narrative could change, which would affect the way others see this region," Abbas said.
ny: "Nkhaniyi sinasinthe chifukwa cha zimenezo, koma ngati atolankhani achikazi a m'dziko ndi akunja apeza mwayi weniweni wofotokoza nkhani ya ku Middle East, nkhaniyo ingasinthe, zomwe zingakhudze momwe ena amaonera dera lino", anatero Abbas.

en: Sancha also believes women in journalism have an impact on the way issues are viewed in the region, including post-traumatic stress disorder and the effect it has on female health, and subjects such as violence and alcohol.
ny: Sancha akukhulupiriranso kuti akazi m'zofalitsa nkhani amakhudza mmene nkhani zimaonedwera m'derali, kuphatikizapo matenda a kupsinjika maganizo pambuyo pa tsoka ndi mmene amakhudzira thanzi la akazi, ndi nkhani monga chiwawa ndi mowa.

en: "We talk about all these issues that men normally wouldnt not speak about," she said.
ny: "Timakambirana nkhani zonse zimene amuna safuna kukambirana", iye anatero.

en: Iran's Guards Commander Says Israel Creating Conditions for Own Destruction
ny: Mtsogoleri wa asilikali a Iran akuti Israel ikupanga zinthu zoti iwonongeke yokha

en: Israel's actions are creating conditions for its own destruction, Irans Revolutionary Guards commander on Friday told a Jerusalem Day rally at which the countrys new domestically-made Kheibar Buster missile was displayed.
ny: Zochita za Israyeli zikupangitsa mikhalidwe ya chiwonongeko chake, mkulu wa gulu la asilikali a Iran Revolutionary Guards anena Lachisanu pamsonkhano wa tsiku la Yerusalemu pamene dziko latsopano lopangidwa m'dziko la Israel la Kheibar Buster linasonyezedwa.

en: State television said millions of Iranians joined rallies marking Quds Day, the Arabic name for Jerusalem, in state-organized marches across the country.
ny: Wailesi yakanema ya boma inati anthu mamiliyoni ambiri a ku Iran anasonkhana m'misonkhano yokondwerera Tsiku la Quds, dzina lachiarabu la Yerusalemu, m'misonkhano yokonzedwa ndi boma m'dziko lonselo.

en: It showed the Israeli flag being set on fire and groups of people around the country shouting choreographed "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.
ny: Inaonetsa mbendera ya Israyeli ikuotchedwa ndi magulu a anthu kuzungulira dziko akufuula mawu ofotokozera "Imfa ku America, Imfa ku Israel".

en: Supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said in a televised speech that anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians rejected compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.
ny: Mtsogoleri wamkulu wa dzikoli Ayatollah Ali Khamenei ananena m'mawu ake pa TV kuti zionetsero zotsutsa Israyeli ndi ziwawa zasonyeza kuti Apalestina anakana kugwirizana kwa maulamuliro a Aarabu ndi Israyeli.

en: Opposition to Israel is a touchstone of belief for Iran, which backs Palestinian and Lebanese Islamist militant groups opposed to peace with Israel, which Tehran does not recognize.
ny: Kutsutsa Israyeli ndi mwala woyesera wa chikhulupiriro cha Iran, yomwe imathandizira magulu omenyera ufulu wa Palestina ndi Lebanoni omwe amatsutsa mtendere ndi Israel, zomwe Tehran sizimamvetsetsa.

en: "What has happened in Palestine in recent years annuls all plans for compromise with the Zionist enemy (Israel) because no plan for Palestine can be implemented in the absence or contrary to the opinions of its owners, the Palestinians," Khamenei said, speaking in Arabic and addressing Palestinians and other Arabs.
ny: "Zimene zachitika ku Palestina m'zaka zaposachedwapa zimasokoneza mapulani onse a kugwirizana ndi mdani wa Chiyoni (Israel) chifukwa palibe mapulani a Palestina omwe angagwiritsidwe ntchito popanda kapena motsutsana ndi malingaliro a eni ake, a Palestina", Khamenei ananena, akulankhula m'Chiarabu ndipo akulankhula ndi Aarabu ndi Aarabu ena.

en: Thus, Khamenei said, all previous peace agreements -- such as the 1993 Oslo Accords, the two-state solution to resolve the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and former U.S. President Donald Trump's plan dubbed the Deal of the Century "are null and void".
