ny: Khoti la ku Hague linamuimba mlandu Mbarushimana ndi zigawenga zina za FDLR kuti amagwiritsa ntchito chiwawa kwa anthu wamba opanda zida monga chida chawo chachikulu pa ntchito yawo yopezera mphamvu ndale gulu la zigawenga.

en: According to the ICC, "as a result of this deadly blackmail (by the FDLR rebels), victims were killed, raped, and forcibly displaced, and entire villages were razed to the ground."
ny: Malinga ndi ICC, "chifukwa cha kupha anthu ndi kuwomba mfuti (kwa zigawenga za FDLR), anthu anaphedwa, kugwiriridwa, ndi kusamutsidwa m'nyumba zawo, ndipo midzi yonse inawonongedwa".

en: Karugarama said Mbarushimana and his FDLR rebel forces played a pivotal role in the countrys 1994 genocide in which hundreds of thousands of people were killed.
ny: Karugarama anati Mbarushimana ndi asilikali ake a FDLR anali ndi udindo waukulu pa kupha anthu ambirimbiri mu 1994.

en: "We believe that, in the next couple of weeks after due process has taken place in France, he should be able to be transferred to The Hague in the Netherlands to face charges and be prosecuted for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed within the territory of the DRC."
ny: "Timakhulupirira kuti, m'milungu ingapo yotsatira, pambuyo poti mlandu wachitika ku France, iye ayenera kusamutsidwira ku The Hague ku Netherlands kuti akaimbidwe mlandu ndi kuimbidwa mlandu wa upandu wankhondo ndi upandu wotsutsana ndi umunthu wochitidwa m'dziko la DRC".

en: The Justice Minister also said Kigali will be cooperating with the International Criminal Court in the imminent prosecution of Mbarushimana.
ny: Nduna ya Zachilungamo inanenanso kuti Kigali idzathandizana ndi International Criminal Court pa mlandu wa Mbarushimana.

en: British, French Foreign Ministers to Re-Invigorate DRC Peace Process - 2002-01-18
ny: Nduna Zakunja za Britain ndi France Zidzayambitsanso Ntchito Yothetsa Mtendere ku DRC - 2002-01-18

en: The British and French foreign ministers travel to the Democratic Republic of Congo Monday to kickoff a three-day, four-nation tour of the troubled region of Central Africa.
ny: Nduna za mayiko akunja za Britain ndi France zikufika ku Democratic Republic of Congo Lolemba kuti ziyambitse ulendo wa masiku atatu, wa mayiko anayi wa m'dera la Central Africa lomwe lili ndi mavuto.

en: The mission will be jointly led by British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.
ny: Ntchitoyi idzatsogoleredwa ndi nduna ya zamayiko akunja ya Britain Jack Straw ndi mnzake wa ku France Hubert Vedrine.

en: They will be visiting the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.
ny: Iwo adzachezera Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi ndi Uganda.

en: Their primary objective is to breathe new life into the peace process in the war-torn Congo.
ny: Cholinga chawo chachikulu ndicho kupatsa moyo watsopano ndondomeko ya mtendere m'dziko la Congo lomwe lili m'mavuto a nkhondo.

en: Specifically, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of foreign troops who back the Congolese government (n Kinshasa, demobilization of rebels who occupy more than half the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.
ny: Makamaka, a ku Britain ndi ku France akufuna kuona kuchotsedwa kwa magulu ankhondo akunja omwe akuthandiza boma la Congo (ku Kinshasa), kusamutsa zigawenga zomwe zikugwira theka la dzikoli, ndi kukambirana za mtendere kuti athetse nkhondo.

en: British Foreign Secretary Straw said the mission also has a broader goal of making sure the Congo does not become another Afghanistan.
ny: Mlembi wa za kunja wa Britain Straw anati ntchitoyi ili ndi cholinga chachikulu kwambiri choonetsetsa kuti dziko la Congo lisakhale Afghanistan ina.

en: "The 11th of September has made it much more urgent that we take earlier action against failed, and failing states," he said.
ny: "Zochitika za pa 11 September zachititsa kuti tifunika kuchitapo kanthu mwamsanga kuti titeteze mayiko amene akulephera", iye anatero.

en: In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet Congolese President Joseph Kabila. He took power one year ago, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was assassinated by one of his bodyguards.
ny: Ku Kinshasa, ndunazo zidzakumana ndi pulezidenti wa dziko la Congo Joseph Kabila, yemwe analanda ulamuliro chaka chapitacho, bambo ake, pulezidenti Laurent Kabila, ataphedwa ndi mmodzi wa alonda ake.

en: Their next stop will be Kigali for talks with Rwandan President Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
ny: Malo awo otsatira adzakhala Kigali kukakambirana ndi Pulezidenti wa Rwanda, Paul Kagame, ndi mtsogoleri wa gulu la zigawenga la Rally for Congolese Democracy, Adolphe Onusumba.

en: The ministers will make a brief visit to Burundi to discuss that country's civil war with President Pierre Buyoya.
ny: A ndunawo adzachezera Burundi kwa kanthaŵi kuti akambirane ndi Pulezidenti Pierre Buyoya za nkhondo yapachiweniweni ya m'dzikolo.

en: The tour will end in Uganda, where meetings are scheduled with President Yoweri Museveni and Jean-Pierre Bemba, who leads the Movement for the Liberation of Congo guerrillas.
ny: Ulendowu udzatha ku Uganda, kumene misonkhano ndi Purezidenti Yoweri Museveni ndi Jean-Pierre Bemba, amene amatsogolera gulu la gulu la zigawenga la Movement for the Liberation of Congo, ili m'ndende.

en: UNICEF Pushes for Demobilizing Child Soliders Near Africa's Great Lakes - 2002-10-07
ny: UNICEF Ikukakamiza Kutulutsa Ana Odziteteza Pafupi ndi Nyanja Zazikulu za ku Africa - 2002-10-07

en: The United Nations children's agency, UNICEF, is pushing for child soldiers to be demobilized in Africa's Great Lakes region, as several peace drives there build momentum. The agency says funding is in place to help the children leave the military and restart their lives.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations loona za ana, UNICEF, likulimbikitsa kuti ana asirikali achotsedwe m'dera la Nyanja Zazikulu ku Africa, pamene ntchito zingapo za mtendere zikuyendera bwino kumeneko. Bungweli likuti ndalama zilipo zothandiza ana kuti achoke m'gulu lankhondo ndi kuyambiranso moyo wawo.

en: UNICEF's top child protection official, Manuel Fontaine, says peace initiatives in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to get more children under the age of 18 out of fighting units. "We insist that child soldiers could be demobilized, even in conflict situations. We should never wait for peace to get children out of any form of armed group. But, obviously, that's a better timing at the moment. It's more conducive to demobilization," Mr. Fontaine said.
ny: Manuel Fontaine, mkulu wa bungwe la UNICEF loteteza ana, akuti njira za mtendere ku Uganda, Democratic Republic of Congo ndi Rwanda zikupangitsa kuti ana ambiri osakwana zaka 18 achoke m'magulu omenyera nkhondo. "Timalimbikira kuti ana ankhondo akhoza kuchotsedwa ntchito, ngakhale pa nkhondo. Sitiyenera kudikira mtendere kuti ana achoke m'magulu aliwonse okhala ndi zida. Koma, zikuwonekeratu kuti ndi nthawi yabwino pakadali pano. Ndizothandiza kwambiri kuchotsedwa ntchito", adatero a Fontaine.

en: He says there are currently 1,200 child soldiers in Uganda, fighting mainly with the rebel Lord's Resistance Army. He says that over the past 14 years, the group has abducted some 10,000 children, boys to fight and girls to serve as sex slaves.
ny: Iye akuti panopa pali ana ankhondo 1,200 ku Uganda, akumenya nkhondo makamaka ndi gulu la zigawenga la Lord's Resistance Army. Iye akuti m'zaka 14 zapitazi, gululi lalanda ana pafupifupi 10,000, anyamata kuti amenyane ndi atsikana kuti atumikire monga akapolo a kugonana.

en: According to UNICEF, The Democratic Republic of Congo still has some 10,000 children recruited to fight, while Rwanda has up to 2,000 children involved in combat.
ny: Malinga ndi kunena kwa UNICEF, Democratic Republic of Congo idakali ndi ana pafupifupi 10,000 amene akulembedwa ntchito kuti amenyane nawo, pamene Rwanda ili ndi ana pafupifupi 2,000 amene ali m'nkhondo.

en: UNICEF says, even though some of the children do not directly engage in fighting, they are exposed to many dangers. They may be used as porters, carrying very heavy loads, or as messengers or spies passing information and scouting out enemy territory.
ny: Ngakhale kuti ana ena samenya nkhondo mwachindunji, UNICEF inati anawo amakhala pangozi zambiri. Iwo angagwiritsidwe ntchito monga onyamula katundu, kunyamula katundu wolemera kwambiri, kapena monga amithenga kapena akazitape amene amafalitsa chidziŵitso ndi kufufuza malo a adani.

en: Sometimes, boys, but mainly girls, are used as sex slaves. They are exposed to violence and HIV-AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases. The girls may become pregnant, making it harder for them to reintegrate into their communities.
ny: Nthawi zina, anyamata, makamaka atsikana, amagwiritsidwa ntchito ngati akapolo ogonana. Iwo amachitiridwa nkhanza ndi HIV-AIDS ndi matenda ena opatsirana pogonana. Atsikanawo akhoza kutenga pakati, zomwe zimawavuta kuti abwerere m'madera awo.

en: UNICEF's Manuel Fontaine says demobilization takes time and money. He says the children must first be found, and then removed from their government or rebel units. Then, resources are needed to help them rebuild their lives. That involves providing schools, vocational training and health care.
ny: Manuel Fontaine wa UNICEF akuti kuchotsedwa kwa anthu m'gulu la nkhondo kumatenga nthawi ndi ndalama. Iye akuti ana ayenera kupezeka choyamba, ndiyeno kuchotsedwa m'gulu lawo la boma kapena gulu la zigawenga. Kenako, zinthu zimafunika kuti awathandize kumanganso miyoyo yawo. Izi zikuphatikizapo kupereka masukulu, maphunziro a ntchito ndi chisamaliro chaumoyo.

en: "You do not want to stigmatize them and individualize them. They are basically going back to communities where there are a lot of other children, many of whom have suffered from consequences of war, even if they were not recruited. So, you are trying to build services in those communities that are broad services, that would be made available to all those children," Mr. Fontaine said.
ny: "Inu simukufuna kuti kuwapatsa ulemu ndi kusinthitsa iwo. Iwo kwenikweni kubwerera kumadera kumene pali ana ena ambiri, ambiri amene anavutika ndi zotsatira za nkhondo, ngakhale iwo sanali ntchito. Choncho, inu kuyesera kumanga misonkhano m'madera amene ali ntchito lonse, kuti adzapatsidwa kwa ana onse", Bambo Fontaine anati.

en: Mr. Fontaine says, as part of various peace packages in the Great Lakes region, the World Bank and other donors are providing $500 million to help demobilize children. He says, unfortunately, the needed government institutions are not yet in place in some countries to move the process ahead quickly enough. He says that's why UNICEF is pressing to see such structures develop, so that children can get back home and start to lead normal lives once again.
ny: A Fontaine akuti, monga gawo la mapulani osiyanasiyana a mtendere m'dera la Great Lakes, World Bank ndi othandizira ena akupereka $500 miliyoni kuthandiza kuchotsera ana. Iye akuti, mwatsoka, mabungwe aboma ofunikira sanakhalepo m'maiko ena kuti apititse patsogolo njirayi mwachangu. Iye akuti ndichifukwa chake UNICEF ikulimbikitsanso kuti maofesi oterewa apange, kuti ana abwerere kwawo ndi kuyamba kukhala ndi moyo wabwinobwino.

en: Goma Residents Hopeful Rebel Withdrawal Spells Peace in Eastern Congo
ny: Anthu a ku Goma Akuyembekeza Kuti Anthu Oukira Boma Akutha, Ndipo Dziko la Congo Lidzakhala Lamtendere

en: DRC Accuses Rebel M23 of Shelling Rwanda
ny: DRC Ikuimba M23 Mlandu Woponya Mabomba ku Rwanda

en: No media source currently available
ny: Palibe nkhani zimene zilipo pa nthawiyi.

ny: Tanzania Ifunsa Uganda Kuti Ikonze Ubale Wake ndi Rwanda

ny: Rwanda Ikuimba Mlandu DRC pa Kuwombera Kupyola Malire

ny: US Ikufunsira Atsogoleri a Dziko pa Kuukira Kotheka kwa Syria

en: World Bank, Nike Team Up for 'The Girl Effect' Initiative
ny: Banki Yadziko, Nike Team Up for 'The Girl Effect' Initiative

en: The Adolescent Girls Initiative partners the World Bank, the Nike Foundation and governments of developing and developed nations to empower girls in poor countries.
ny: Bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative limagwira ntchito limodzi ndi World Bank, Nike Foundation ndi maboma a mayiko otukuka ndi osauka kuti apititse patsogolo mphamvu za atsikana m'mayiko osauka.

en: The two-year-old program is helping girls in Asia, Africa and the Middle East gain the education and skills they need to transition into the workforce.
ny: Pulogalamuyi, yomwe yakhalapo kwa zaka ziwiri, ikuthandiza atsikana a ku Asia, Africa ndi ku Middle East kuti aphunzire bwino ndiponso kuti akhale ndi luso loti azigwira ntchito.

en: "My name is Sanchita. I come from a small village called Ishwarpur in Bangladesh," American actress Anne Hathaway delivered her lines as powerfully from behind a podium at the World Bank as she does on the silver screen, telling the story of an impoverished girl.
ny: "Dzina langa ndine Sanchita. Ndimachokera ku mudzi waung'ono wotchedwa Ishwarpur ku Bangladesh", anatero wojambula wa ku America Anne Hathaway, amene anafotokoza mawu ake molimba mtima kuchokera kumbuyo kwa pulatifomu ya World Bank monga momwe amachitira pazenera, akufotokoza nkhani ya mtsikana wosauka.

en: "When a baby is born in Ishwarpur, families desperately hope it will be a boy," she continued. "It has been this way for as long as anyone can remember.
ny: "Pamene mwana wabadwa ku Ishwarpur, mabanja amayembekeza mwachidwi kuti adzakhala mnyamata", anapitiriza motero. "Zakhala chonchi kwa nthaŵi yaitali monga mmene aliyense amakumbukira.

en: It is believed that boys will contribute to the family income in a place where people are very poor.
ny: Amakhulupirira kuti anyamata amathandiza kuti banja lizipeza ndalama m'dera limene anthu ndi osauka kwambiri.

en: "These circumstances are familiar to those who benefit from the Adolescent Girls Initiative.
ny: "Anthu amene amapindula ndi ntchito ya Atsikana Achinyamata amadziŵa bwino kwambiri zinthu zimenezi.

en: Who benefits?A dozen such teenage girls and young women visited the World Bank from developing Asian, Middle Eastern and African countries.
ny: Kodi ndani amapindula? Atsikana ndi atsikana ochuluka ochokera m'mayiko osauka a ku Asia, Middle East ndi Africa anapita ku World Bank.

en: They were just a few of the girls who benefit from training and education programs that help them transition from school to employment.
ny: Atsikana amenewa ndi ena mwa atsikana amene amapindula ndi maphunziro amene amawathandiza kuti asamapite kusukulu n'kuyamba ntchito.

en: Hathaway told the audience that, with the help of a development organization, Sanchita gained an education and borrowed $60 to buy a cow and start a vegetable garden.
ny: Hathaway anauza omvetsera kuti, mothandizidwa ndi bungwe lachitukuko, Sanchita anaphunzira ndipo anabwereka madola 60 kuti agule ng'ombe ndi kuyamba kulima ndiwo zamasamba.

en: The teenage girl could then afford to pay her own school fees, as well as her brother's, and contribute to her family in such a way that Sanchita's parents hope she does not marry any time soon.Hathaway spoke of her own childhood in a comfortable suburban U.S. neighborhood, and of a time when she had no idea about the kind of circumstances Sanchita faced nor how much girls need safe spaces for education.
ny: Mtsikana wachinyamatayo anatha kulipira ndalama zake za kusukulu, komanso za mchimwene wake, ndi kupereka ndalama zothandizira banja lake m'njira yoti makolo a Sanchita akuyembekeza kuti sakwatirana posachedwa. Hathaway analankhula za ubwana wake m'dera labwino la kumidzi ya ku United States, ndi za nthawi imene sankadziwa za mikhalidwe imene Sanchita anakumana nayo komanso mmene atsikana amafunikira malo otetezeka kuti aphunzire.

en: "Places that could teach them how to take the light they have as girls and ignite the world," explained Hathaway.
ny: "Malo amene angawaphunzitse mmene angatenge kuunika kumene ali nako monga atsikana ndi kuyatsa dziko", anatero Hathaway.

en: "I wouldn't know how much the world needs 'The Girl Effect.'"  Girl power"The Girl Effect" is what the Adolescent Girls Initiative wants to see happen for 600 million girls in developing countries.
ny: "Sindikudziwa kuti dzikoli likufunikira kwambiri 'The Girl Effect.'"Mphamvu ya atsikana"The Girl Effect" ndi zimene bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative likufuna kuti zichitike kwa atsikana 600 miliyoni m'mayiko osauka.

en: Overall, an estimated one-third of young women in developing nations are not employed and not in school.World Bank President Robert Zoellick said underinvesting in girls impedes development.
ny: Pafupifupi, pafupifupi theka la atsikana m'mayiko osauka alibe ntchito kapena sukulu. Pulezidenti wa World Bank, Robert Zoellick, anati ndalama zochepa zimene atsikana amawononga zimalepheretsa chitukuko.

en: He added that educating girls also makes sense for poor families, noting that an extra year of secondary schooling can raise their wages by 10 to 20 percent.
ny: Iye anawonjezera kuti kuphunzitsa atsikana n'kofunikanso kwa mabanja osauka, ndipo ananena kuti chaka chowonjezera cha maphunziro a kusekondale chingawonjezere malipiro awo ndi 10 mpaka 20 peresenti.

en: "If they earn greater income they also have greater access to reproductive health information and services, so then more likely to delay marriage and childbirth, have healthier babies and attain higher literacy rates," Zoellick said.
ny: Zoellick anati: "Ngati amapeza ndalama zambiri, amapezanso mwayi wopeza zinthu zothandiza pa nkhani ya thanzi la ana, choncho amakhala ndi mwayi wochedwa kukwatira ndi kubereka ana, amakhala ndi ana athanzi komanso amakhala ndi maphunziro apamwamba".

en: "The evidence strongly suggests that investing in adolescent girls is a key way to break inter-generational patterns of poverty."
ny: "Zimene zikuchitika zikusonyeza kuti kuika ndalama m'misika ya atsikana achinyamata ndi njira yofunika kwambiri yothetsera umphaŵi umene umakhalapo kwa mibadwo yambiri".

en: Current operations The Adolescent Girls Initiative public-private partnership, with its $20 million in funds, is already at work in seven countries, with plans to expand to Haiti and Yemen.         Mayra Buvinic talks about the Adolescent Girls Initiative
ny: Ntchito Zamakono Mgwirizano wa boma ndi mabungwe a anthu wamba, womwe uli ndi ndalama zokwana madola 20 miliyoni, wayamba kale kugwira ntchito m'mayiko asanu ndi awiri, ndipo ukufuna kupititsa patsogolo ntchitoyi ku Haiti ndi ku Yemen.

en: "So where we are in Liberia and Nepal, young women are completing the first rounds of training," explained Mayra Buvinic, director of Gender and Development at the World Bank.
ny: Mayra Buvinic, mkulu wa bungwe loona za kugonana ndi chitukuko ku World Bank, anafotokoza kuti: "Choncho kumene tili ku Liberia ndi ku Nepal, atsikana akumaliza maphunziro awo oyamba".

en: "In South Sudan, 100 adolescent girls' clubs will have opened in four states by the end of this month. In Jordan, female community college graduates are gaining access to vouchers.
ny: "Ku South Sudan, magulu a atsikana achinyamata 100 adzatsegulidwa m'maboma anayi kumapeto kwa mwezi uno. ku Jordan, ophunzira a koleji ya azimayi akupeza ma voucher.

en: In Afghanistan, Lao PDR and Rwanda, assessments are being completed, and the projects will be launched at the end of this quarter.
ny: Ku Afghanistan, ku Lao PDR ndi ku Rwanda, kuwunika kwa zinthu kukuchitika ndipo ntchitozo zidzayamba kumapeto kwa kotala ino.

en: "Thanks and praise Kebbeh Kamara tells the audience how she's benefited from the World Bank/Nike initiative
ny: "Zikomo ndi kuyamikira Kebbeh Kamara akuuza omvetsera mmene wapindulira ndi ntchito ya World Bank/Nike

en: Kebbeh Kamara said she has benefited from training in Greater Monrovia, Liberia.
ny: Kebbeh Kamara ananena kuti wapindula ndi maphunziro ku Greater Monrovia, Liberia.

en: Wearing a pink dress and sporty black headband decorated with rhinestones, she addressed the World Bank audience from the stage.
ny: Atavala diresi la pinki ndi lamba wakuda wa pa mutu wokongoletsedwa ndi miyala ya rhinestones, analankhula ndi omvetsera a World Bank kuchokera pa siteji.

en: "I learned how to start a business, how to earn money on your own, how to be self-sustainable," she said, "how to save money and what to spend money for.
ny: Iye anati: "Ndinaphunzira kuyambitsa bizinesi, kupeza ndalama pandekha, kusamalira ndalama, kusunga ndalama komanso kugwiritsa ntchito bwino ndalama.

en: " Sarah Poni Saturnino, 19, of Juba, Southern Sudan, told VOA she is enjoying her first trip to the United States and all the empowerment training and activities.
ny: " Sarah Poni Saturnino, wazaka 19, wa ku Juba, South Sudan, anauza VOA kuti akusangalala ndi ulendo wake woyamba ku United States ndi maphunziro onse ndi zochitika za kupatsa mphamvu.

en: She said she hopes to take the lessons she has learned here in workshops back to the Adolescent Girls Initiative clubs in Southern Sudan.
ny: Iye anati akuyembekeza kutenga maphunziro omwe waphunzira kuno m'masemina kubwerera ku makalabu a Adolescent Girls Initiative ku South Sudan.

en: "I learned about how to express yourself. Eye contact. Speak loud," explained Saturnino. "This way can give me really a voice to speak in front of people.
ny: "Ndinaphunzira mmene ndinganenere. Kuonana ndi maso. Kulankhula mokweza", anafotokoza motero Saturnino. "Mwanjira imeneyi ndimatha kukhala ndi liwu lenileni loyankhulira anthu.

en: And even if I go back home, I'm not longer Sarah again -- I'm somebody now." Somebody who has earned the admiration of a fellow Southern Sudanese citizen, child-soldier-turned-rapper Emmanuel Jal.
ny: Ndipo ngakhale ndikabwerera kunyumba, sindidzakhalanso Sarah - tsopano ndine winawake". Winawake amene wapindula ndi kuyamikiridwa ndi nzika ina ya ku South Sudan, mwana-msilikali-womwe wakhala rapper Emmanuel Jal.

en: A supporter of the Adolescent Girls Initiative, Jal performed at the World Bank event.
ny: Mtsogoleri wa bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative, Jal anachita nawo mwambo wa World Bank.

en: The girls joined him on stage, beaming as they danced behind him -- as did at least one World Bank official -- while the audience of staffers in business suits took to their feet and raised their hands in the air as well.
ny: Atsikanawo anam'tsatira pa siteji, akumasangalala pamene ankavina kumbuyo kwake - monga momwe anachitira mkulu wina wa Banki Yadziko lonse - pamene omvetsera a ogwira ntchito m'zovala za bizinesi anaimirira ndi kukweza manja awo m'mwamba.

en: Activists Press for Better Help to End Congo Rapes
ny: Anthu Okana Ufulu wa Anthu Akufuna Kuthandizidwa Kuti Asiye Kugwiririra Anthu ku Congo

en: As U.N. Special Representative for Sexual Violence In Conflict Margot Wallstrom embarks on a new trip to the Democratic Republic of Congo, two activists recently concluded lobbying efforts in the United States for more effective action on trying to end conflict-related rapes in Congo.
ny: Pamene Mlembi Wapadera wa UN pa Nkhanza za Kugonana M'nkhondo Margot Wallstrom akuyamba ulendo watsopano wopita ku Democratic Republic of Congo, posachedwapa anthu aŵiri ogwira ntchito m'bungwe la United Nations anamaliza ntchito yawo yofunafuna kuti anthu a ku United States achitepo kanthu moyenera pofuna kuthetsa nkhanza za kugwiririra anthu m'dziko la Congo.

en: One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told a gathering of Washington, D.C., university students and concerned citizens that the area in which she works, Beni, in North Kivu province, is still overrun by Ugandan rebels who regularly rape women.She said in these situations women are considered victims, and are not implicated in the search for peace.
ny: Mmodzi wa iwo, Justine Masika Bihamba, anauza msonkhano wa Washington, D.C., ophunzira a yunivesite ndi nzika zodandaula kuti dera limene iye amagwira ntchito, Beni, m'chigawo cha North Kivu, lidakali ndi zigawenga za ku Uganda zomwe zimazunza akazi. Iye anati m'mikhalidwe imeneyi akazi amaonedwa ngati ozunzidwa, ndipo sakukhudzidwa ndi kufunafuna mtendere.

en: Striving for peace in the region
ny: Kuyesetsa kuti pakhale mtendere m'derali

en: Bihamba coordinates an organization called the Synergy of Women Against Sexual Violence.
ny: Bihamba ndi mtsogoleri wa bungwe lotchedwa Synergy of Women Against Sexual Violence.

en: Counselors with the group have been attacked and threatened because of their work. When Bihamba was at work one day, Congolese soldiers attacked her home, and sexually assaulted one of her daughters.
ny: Atsogoleri a gululi akhala akuukiridwa ndi kuopsezedwa chifukwa cha ntchito yawo. Tsiku lina pamene Bihamba anali kuntchito, asilikali a ku Congo anaukira nyumba yake, ndipo anagwiririra mmodzi wa ana ake aakazi.

en: Bihamba explained that what is needed - above all - is peace in eastern Congo.
ny: Bihamba anafotokoza kuti chimene chikufunika - koposa zonse - ndicho mtendere kum'mawa kwa Congo.

en: She said she believes sexual crimes would go down drastically if fighting stopped.
ny: Iye anati amakhulupirira kuti milandu yokhudza kugonana idzachepa kwambiri ngati nkhondo zithe.

en: Activist Donatella Rostagno, from the European network for Central Africa, accompanied Bihamba on her trip to the United States.
ny: Mkazi wina wotchedwa Donatella Rostagno, wa ku European Network for Central Africa, anapita ndi Bihamba ku United States.

en: She said she supports the work being done by the U.N. special representative for sexual violence in conflict.
ny: Iye anati amachirikiza ntchito imene ikuchitika ndi nthumwi yapadera ya UN yokhudza chiwawa cha kugonana m'nkhondo.

en: Rostagno also said feels, however, the international community is not doing enough to stop Congo's war, despite having a large U.N. peacekeeping mission there.
ny: Rostagno ananenanso kuti, komabe, anthu a padziko lonse sakuthandiza mokwanira kuti nkhondo ya ku Congo ithe, ngakhale kuti pali gulu lalikulu la UN lokhazikitsa mtendere kumeneko.

en: "The majority of the actions is made to look at the consequences, to work with the women who are victims, but not enough is done to look at the causes of the rapes and the conflict," said Rostagno.
ny: "Zochita zambiri zimachitika kuti zione zotsatirapo zake, kuti zithandizire akazi amene ali ozunzidwa, koma sizimayendetsedwa mokwanira kuti zione zimene zachititsa kuti kugwiriridwa ndi nkhondoyo kuchitike", anatero Rostagno.

en: Deteriorating situation amid global concern
ny: Zinthu zikuipiraipirabe m'dzikoli.

en: She fears the overall situation in eastern Congo is getting worse, not better - despite the international attention - with rebels, militias, and renegade soldiers still running rampant.
ny: Iye akuopa kuti mkhalidwe wonse wa kum'mawa kwa Congo ukuipiraipira, osati kukhala bwino - ngakhale kuti mayiko akuusamalira - pamene opanduka, magulu a asilikali, ndi asilikali ampatuko akupitirizabe kugwira ntchito.

en: "A lot of these rebel groups are getting reorganized, and are even getting in a coalition so the movements that we see in the region, it is worrying us," said Rostagno.
ny: "Magulu ambiri a zigawengawa akuyambanso kukonzanso zinthu, ndipo akupanga mabungwe, choncho kayendetsedwe ka zinthu m'derali, ndi kotidetsa nkhaŵa", anatero Rostagno.

en: "I think we were more optimistic on this region six months ago than today.
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti tinakhala ndi chiyembekezo chachikulu m'dera lino miyezi isanu ndi umodzi yapitayo kusiyana ndi lero.

en: "The United Nations has identified three armed groups that gang raped dozens of people about two months ago in a week-long attack in Luvungi, another part of North Kivu province.
ny: "Machitidwe a bungwe la United Nations a ku Luvungi, mbali ina ya chigawo cha North Kivu, asonyeza magulu atatu a asilikali amene anagwirira anthu ambirimbiri chiwawa cha gulu pafupifupi miyezi iŵiri yapitayo.

en: Those implicated are the Mai Mai Cheka, the Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, and followers of an army deserter, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.
ny: Anthu amene akuimbidwa mlandu ndi Mai Mai Cheka, Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, ndi otsatira a Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva, yemwe anapulumuka m'gulu lankhondo.

en: Proposals for improvementDuring their presentation, the two activists, Bihamba and Rostagno, also offered concrete proposals to make the situation better.
ny: Malingaliro a kusinthaZomwe olimbikitsawo, Bihamba ndi Rostagno, ananena, zinaperekanso malingaliro enieni othandiza kusintha zinthu.

en: Rostagno explained that foreign non-governmental organizations get funding to tackle the issue of sexual violence, but local organizations often get ignored.
ny: Rostagno anafotokoza kuti mabungwe osagwirizana ndi boma ochokera kunja amalandira ndalama zothandizira kuthana ndi vuto la chiwawa, koma mabungwe a m'deralo nthawi zambiri amanyalanyazidwa.

en: She said complex applications to get outside funding favor bigger organizations.
ny: Iye anati ntchito zovuta kuti apeze ndalama zakunja zimakomera mabungwe akuluakulu.

en: "They can just do it, they send it, they receive the money.
ny: "Iwo angachite zimenezo, amazitumiza, amalandira ndalamazo.

en: The problem is that the money in most cases is spent to pay for the fixed cost of the organization, for the salaries of expat people coming to the region and to the country, while the local non-governmental organizations, those working with the communities, with the women, with the children, in the villages, those who need need money to survive in order to do their work do not have access," said Rostagno.Bihamba said Congolese soldiers should be paid directly through bank withdrawals, rather than being paid through their superiors.
ny: Vuto ndiloti ndalamazo nthawi zambiri zimagwiritsidwa ntchito kulipira ndalama zokhazikika za bungwe, malipiro a anthu otuluka m'dziko lino omwe amabwera kudera ndi m'dziko muno, pomwe mabungwe omwe si aboma, omwe amagwira ntchito ndi anthu ammudzi, ndi azimayi, ndi ana, m'midzi, omwe amafunikira ndalama kuti apulumuke kuti achite ntchito yawo alibe mwayi, "adatero Rostagno.Bihamba adati asitikali aku Congo ayenera kulipidwa mwachindunji kudzera pakubweza kubanki, m'malo molipidwa kudzera mwa akuluakulu awo.

en: Bihamba said with the current system they receive only about a third of their salary, which causes some soldiers to loot and rape.
ny: Bihamba anati ndi dongosolo lomwe lilipo tsopano, amalandira pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a malipiro awo, zomwe zimapangitsa asilikali ena kulanda ndi kugwirira.

en: She also called for an international tribunal for the Congo to help end general impunity, as well as more local tribunals for raped victims to seek justice. In North Kivu, where more than 5 million people are estimated to live, she said there are only three tribunals.
ny: Iye anafunsanso kuti pakhale khoti la mayiko onse ku Congo kuti lithandize kuthetsa kupanda chilango, komanso kuti pakhale makhoti ambiri a m'deralo kuti anthu ogwiriridwa chigololo apeze chilungamo.

en: Desmond Tutu Retires From Public Life
ny: Desmond Tutu Akuthawa pa Udindo wa Boma

en: Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and was critical of the war in Iraq.
ny: Desmond Tutu anamenyana ndi tsankho ku South Africa, ndipo anali wotsutsa nkhondo ya ku Iraq.

en: "We waged a war that shouldn't have happened," he said.He also spoke out against genocide in Rwanda.
ny: "Tinapanga nkhondo imene siyenera kuchitika", iye anatero.Analankhulanso motsutsa kupha anthu mu Rwanda.

en: "God have mercy on us," he said.The retired Anglican archbishop announced in July that he would retire from public life on his birthday."The time has come to slow down, and sip maybe rooibos tea with my beloved wife in the afternoons" he said.
ny: "Mulungu atichitire chifundo", iye anatero.Mkulu wa mabishopu wa Anglican yemwe anapuma pantchito analengeza mu July kuti adzasiya ntchito yake yochita zinthu pagulu pa tsiku lake lobadwa. "Yafika nthawi yoti ndichepetse mphamvu, ndipo mwina ndizimwa tiyi wa rooibos ndi mkazi wanga wokondedwa masana", iye anatero.

en: Tutu rose through the ranks of the Anglican church in South Africa to become the first black Anglican archbishop of Capetown.
ny: Tutu anakwera m'magulu a tchalitchi cha Anglican ku South Africa kukhala mkulu wa mabishopu woyamba wakuda wa Anglican wa ku Cape Town.

en: He was a vocal critic of South Africa's white-ruled government and encouraged non-violence to end apartheid. Tutu was the recipient of many awards, and in 1984, he received a Nobel Peace Prize for advocating "a democratic and just society without racial divisions.
ny: Iye anali wotsutsa kwambiri boma la azungu la South Africa ndipo analimbikitsa kusagwirizana kuti athetse tsankho. Tutu anali wolandira mphoto zambiri, ndipo mu 1984, analandira Mphoto ya Nobel ya Mtendere chifukwa choteteza "chitaganya cha demokalase ndi cholungama popanda magawano a mafuko.

en: " He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa. After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it an incredible day when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race elections.
ny: " Anagwiritsa ntchito kuzindikira kuti kulimbikitsa kampeni anti-apartheid, kuitana kwa boycott zachuma motsutsana South Africa.

en: "I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world," he said.
ny: "Ndinganene kuti chinthu chofunika kwambiri kwa ine chinali pamene ndinaima pa khonde mu 1994 kuti ndidziŵitse pulezidenti wathu watsopano ku South Africa ndi dziko lonse", iye anatero.

en: To help mend the nation, President Mandela appointed Tutu as head of the country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.
ny: Pofuna kuthandiza kukonza mtundu, Pulezidenti Mandela anasankha Tutu kukhala mtsogoleri wa dziko la Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Gululi linatulutsa lipoti lomwe linaphatikizapo kuvomereza milandu yambiri pansi pa tsankho pofuna kubwezera chikhululukiro.

en: "It makes specific proposals on how we can cultivate a culture of human rights and of structures to insure that the atrocities of the past will not reoccur," Tutu said.Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.
ny: "Icho chimapereka malingaliro enieni pa momwe tingakulitsire chikhalidwe cha ufulu waumunthu ndi zomangamanga kuti zitsimikizire kuti nkhanza za m'mbuyomu sizidzachitika", anatero Tutu.Tutu anathandizanso kulimbana ndi umphawi ndi AIDS.

en: In recent years, he expressed his disappointment in post-apartheid South Africa, especially the level of violent crime.
ny: M'zaka zaposachedwapa, iye anasonyeza kukhumudwa kwake ndi dziko la South Africa pambuyo pa ulamuliro wa tsankho, makamaka chifukwa cha kuchuluka kwa upandu.

en: Despite his withdrawal from public life, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.
ny: Ngakhale kuti anasiya ntchito, Tutu akuti apitirizabe kuthandiza bungwe lake la mtendere ndipo adzakhalabe m'gulu la akuluakulu a boma amene amalimbikitsa mtendere ndi ufulu wa anthu.

en: But Tutu says he will no longer give interviews and, as he put it, will mostly "shut up."
ny: Koma Tutu akuti sadzaperekanso zoyankhulana ndipo, monga momwe ananenera, makamaka "adzakhala chete".

en: "I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed," he said. "I have been part of the post apartheid dispensation and long for us to do infinitely better."Many say his voice will be missed.
ny: "Ndakhala mbali ya nkhondo yathu ya ufulu ndi demokalase, ndipo ndili mbali ya chikondwerero chimene tinapambana", iye anatero. "Ndakhala mbali ya ulamuliro wa pambuyo pa tsankho ndipo ndikufunitsitsa kuti tichite bwino kwambiri".Ambiri amanena kuti mawu ake adzamusowa.

en: Malawi's Jacaranda School for Orphans Celebrates Christmas
ny: Sukulu ya Ana Amasiye ya Jacaranda ku Malawi Inakondwerera Khirisimasi

en: The management for the Jacaranda School for Orphans in Malawis commercial capital Blantyre recently hosted a party for its students as it closed for Christmas and New Years Day holidays.
ny: Bungwe loyang'anira sukulu ya ana amasiye ya Jacaranda ku likulu la zamalonda la Malawi ku Blantyre posachedwapa linapanga phwando la ophunzira ake pamene linatseka chifukwa cha maholide a Khrisimasi ndi Chaka Chatsopano.

en: Around 500 people including students, staff members and others from surrounding areas attended the event, which was held at the schools premises in Chigumula area.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 500 kuphatikizapo ophunzira, ogwira ntchito ndi ena ochokera m'madera ozungulira, anapezeka pa mwambowu, womwe unachitikira m'mabwalo a sukulu m'dera la Chigumula.

en: The party included gifts, Santa Claus, and a "dancing show case" by the students.
ny: Phwandoli linali ndi mphatso, Santa Claus, ndi "kuvina kwa ophunzira".

en: The school management told VOA that the yearly celebration has been a school tradition for the past 13years.
ny: Akuluakulu a sukuluyi anauza VOA kuti mwambo wa chaka ndi chaka wakhala mwambo wa sukulu kwa zaka 13 zapitazi.

en: The school's director, Luc Deschamps, said: "[We feel] it is very important for us to celebrate Christmas because the children do not have parents.
ny: Mkulu wa sukuluyo, Luc Deschamps, anati: "[Timaona] kuti n'kofunika kwambiri kuti tikondwerere Khirisimasi chifukwa chakuti anawo alibe makolo.

en: They stay with either a grandmother or a distant aunt or uncle, and they are not able to cerebrate at home or have a party or a little bit of sweets and cake for the children. So, we provide a happy day for the children to celebrate the spirit of Christmas. And it is also a way of our children to learn to give."
ny: Iwo amakhala ndi agogo awo kapena azakhali awo, ndipo sangathe kuchita zinthu zauzimu kunyumba kapena kuchita phwando kapena kupereka maswiti ndi keke kwa ana. Chotero, timapereka tsiku losangalala kwa ana kuti akondwerere mzimu wa Krisimasi. Ndipo ndi njira ya ana athu yophunzirira kupatsa".

en: No media source currently available
ny: Palibe nkhani zimene zilipo pa nthawiyi.

en: Deschamps, who is also an Honorary Consul of France in Malawi, said before the main event the patrons were treated to "a nice meal" from the students.
ny: Deschamps, yemwenso ndi kazembe wa ku France ku Malawi, anati mwambo waukulu usanachitike, ophunzirawo "anapatsa alendowo chakudya chokoma".

en: "We had a big, big lunch with good meat and rice,[the dish made from maize flour called] nsima, of course, and vegetables. And it was the students themselves who cooked the meal for everybody, for over 500 people," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Tinakadya chakudya chachikulu cha masana ndi nyama yabwino ndi mpunga [mkate wopangidwa ndi ufa wa chimanga wotchedwa] nsima, ndithudi, ndi ndiwo zamasamba.

en: One of the students, Eddah Zimba, said, "The celebrations are really cool, ... I have enjoyed myself. I have eaten, and now I am here dancing. What has interested me most is the gift that we have received the like the puffs, the biscuits, the squash and the dance."
ny: Mmodzi wa ophunzirawo, Eddah Zimba, anati, "Zikondwererozo ndizabwino kwambiri,... Ndasangalala nazo. Ndadya, ndipo tsopano ndili pano ndikuvina. Chimene chinandisangalatsa kwambiri ndi mphatso yomwe talandira monga ma puffs, ma biscuit, squash ndi kuvina".

en: She thanked the schools management for hosting the Christmas party for students who in most cases do not have such celebrations at home.
ny: Iye anayamikira akuluakulu a sukulu chifukwa chokonza phwando la Khirisimasi la ophunzira amene nthaŵi zambiri sachita mapwando oterowo kunyumba.

en: Another student Emmanuel Chisale said good meal aside, the event has taught him the spirit of sharing.
ny: Wophunzira wina Emmanuel Chisale anati chakudya chabwino chikapanda kukhalapo, mwambowu wamuphunzitsa mzimu wogawana.

en: "This party has brought a change in my life. I have learned that we have to have a heart for sharing one another as the Father Christmas was doing," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Phwando limeneli lasintha moyo wanga, ndipo ndaphunzira kuti tiyenera kukhala ndi mtima wofuna kugawana zinthu ndi ena monga mmene ankachitira Santa Claus".

en: Founded in 2002, the Jacaranda School for Orphans is the only one in Malawi which provides free primary, secondary and tertiary education to children without parents.
ny: Sukulu ya Ana Amasiye ya Jacaranda, yomwe inakhazikitsidwa mu 2002, ndi yokhayo ku Malawi imene imapereka maphunziro a pulaimale, sekondale ndi apamwamba kwaulere kwa ana opanda makolo.

en: A Malawian woman, Marie Da Silva, started the school after she returned from the United States where she spent nineteen years working as a nanny.
ny: Mayi wina wa ku Malawi, Marie Da Silva, anayamba sukuluyi atabwerera kuchokera ku United States kumene anakhala zaka khumi ndi zisanu ndi zinayi akugwira ntchito ya nanny.

en: Economists Predict Bumpy Road for Malawi's Economy in 2015
ny: Akatswiri a Zachuma Ananeneratu Kuti Dziko la Malawi Likhala ndi Chuma Chochepa mu 2015

en: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate. More than $30 million were looted from government coffers in the scandal, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.
ny: Akatswiri azachuma ku Malawi akuti dzikoli likhoza kupitilizabe kukumana ndi mavuto azachuma mu 2015 pokhapokha boma litakhulupiriranso omwe amapereka ndalama, omwe akadali ndi 40 peresenti ya ndalama zothandizira bajeti chifukwa cha ziphuphu zotchedwa Cashgate. Ndalama zoposa $30 miliyoni zidabedwa m'thumba la boma mu chiphuphuchi, ndipo anthu angapo, kuphatikiza akuluakulu aboma, adamangidwa.

en: The withholding of donor aid has forced Malawi's government to pass what is known as the Zero Aid national budget for the 2014-2015 fiscal year. Analysts, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics lecturer at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, say the drop in spending has hurt the economy.
ny: Kuletsa thandizo la omwe amapereka ndalama kwachititsa boma la Malawi kuti lipereke ndalama zomwe zimatchedwa kuti Zero Aid budget ya chaka cha 2014-2015. Akatswiri monga Abel Mwanyungwe, mphunzitsi wa zachuma ku Polytechnic College ya University of Malawi, akuti kuchepa kwa ndalamazo kwavulaza chuma.

en: "This has been a bumpy year as we are coming from the Cashgate effects that have quite a major dent on the economys performance. We have seen that in most cases the very delicate and crucial departments and service providers have been affected, in the sense that we dont have enough drugs in the hospitals. In schools, in terms of teachers payments is not in time," said Mwanyungwe.
ny: "Chaka chino chakhala chovuta kwambiri chifukwa tikubwera kuchokera ku zotsatira za Cashgate zomwe zakhala zikukhudza kwambiri ntchito zachuma. Tawona kuti nthawi zambiri ma dipatimenti ndi omwe amapereka chithandizo omwe ali ovuta komanso ofunikira kwambiri adakhudzidwa, chifukwa tilibe mankhwala okwanira m'zipatala. M'masukulu, malinga ndi malipiro a aphunzitsi si nthawi", adatero Mwanyungwe.

en: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
ny: Mwanyungwe akugwirizananso ndi Cashgate ndi kuchepa kwa ndalama za Malawi, kwacha, zomwe zapangitsa kuti ogwira ntchito m'boma osiyanasiyana azichita ziwawa pofuna kukweza malipiro.

en: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, anthu ogwira ntchito m'bungwe la oweruza akhala akugunda kwa milungu isanu ndi umodzi, kufunafuna kuwonjezeka kwa malipiro a 45 peresenti, zimene boma limanena kuti silingazikwanitse chifukwa lilibe ndalama.

en: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.
ny: Anthu ogwira ntchito ku bungwe lolimbana ndi ziphuphu ku Malawi anayamba kugwira ntchito ndipo ankafuna kuti azipatsidwa malipiro okwana 70 peresenti. Koma boma linawaopseza kuti liwalanda malipiro awo a mwezi wa December ngati atapanda kubwerera.

en: Mwanyungwe said the government can only avoid further strikes in 2015 if it makes efforts to restore donor confidence in the management of its public finances.
ny: Mwanyungwe anati boma lingathe kupewa ziwawa zina mu 2015 ngati lingayesetse kubwezeretsa chidaliro cha omwe amapereka ndalamazo poyang'anira ndalama za boma.

en: "My fear is that if we dont have this donor confidence and donor support coming back to the economy, we may force the government to go into serious local borrowing that would lead to serious repercussions in terms of inflation, in terms of interest rates and this may have a sort of catch-catch lose situation," said Mwanyungwe.
ny: "Moyo wanga ndi wakuti ngati sitikhala ndi chidaliro cha omwe amapereka ndalama komanso thandizo la omwe amapereka ndalama kubwerera ku chuma, tingakakamize boma kuti lipite kukakongoza ndalama zomwe zingayambitse mavuto aakulu pankhani ya inflation, pankhani ya chiwongola dzanja ndipo izi zitha kukhala ngati vuto lotaya ndalama", anatero Mwanyungwe.

en: The donors are, among other things, demanding that the government prosecute all those involved in the scandal and strengthen its financial management system.
ny: Opereka ndalamazo, pakati pa zinthu zina, akupempha boma kuti lipereke mlandu kwa onse amene akukhudzidwa ndi chipwirikiticho ndi kulimbitsa dongosolo lake la kayendetsedwe ka ndalama.

en: Newton Kambala, the president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the scandal rendered 2014 as "a very bad year for the business sector, because of huge debts that the government owes the private sector."
ny: Newton Kambala, pulezidenti wa Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, anati chipwirikiticho chinapangitsa 2014 kukhala "chaka choipa kwambiri kwa makampani, chifukwa cha ngongole yaikulu imene boma lili nayo kwa anthu wamba".

en: He warned that if the situation persists, "2015 will be worse."
ny: Iye anachenjeza kuti ngati zinthu zikapitilira, "chaka cha 2015 chidzakhala choipa kwambiri".

en: In his state of the nation address last Saturday, Malawi president Peter Mutharika said his government is doing everything possible to address the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.
ny: M'mawu ake a dziko Loweruka lapitali, Purezidenti wa Malawi Peter Mutharika anati boma lake likuchita zonse zotheka kuthetsa mavuto omwe abwera chifukwa cha mlandu wa Cashgate.

en: "My government has strengthened the financial system to make sure that Cashgate never occurs again in Malawi. We have resourced fairly well the law enforcement institutions, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, so that they do a thorough independent job, prosecute all suspects, and recover the stolen resources where possible," said Mutharika.
ny: "Boma langa lalimbikitsa dongosolo la zachuma kuti zitsimikizike kuti Cashgate sichidzachitikanso ku Malawi.Taperekanso ndalama zokwanira mabungwe okhazikitsa malamulo, kuphatikiza Anti-Corruption Bureau, kuti achite ntchito yodziyimira pawokha, kuzenga milandu onse omwe akuwakayikira, ndikubwezeretsanso chuma chomwe chabedwa ngati kuli kotheka", adatero Mutharika.

en: Mutharika also said his government is implementing newly-adopted fiscal reforms that seek to grow the countrys economy by 5.5 percent in 2014, up from an estimated 5.0 percent in 2013.
ny: Mutharika ananenanso kuti boma lake likugwiritsa ntchito njira zatsopano zoyendetsera ndalama zomwe zikufuna kukulitsa chuma cha dziko ndi 5.5 peresenti mu 2014, kuchokera pa 5.0 peresenti mu 2013.

en: Malawi to Conduct Door-to-Door HIV Testing
ny: Malawi Kuchita Kuyeza HIV Kunyumba ndi Nyumba

en: Malawians have mixed reactions to government plans to introduce door-to door HIV testing early next year. Supporters say the step is urgently needed because 100 Malawians get infected each day, and an average of 138 die from AIDS daily. Minister of Health Jean Kalirani announced the plans during the recent commemoration of World AIDS Day in the northern district of Karonga.
ny: Anthu a ku Malawi ali ndi malingaliro osiyana pa mapulani a boma oyambitsa kuyesa kwa HIV kunyumba ndi nyumba kumayambiriro kwa chaka chamawa. Othandizira akuti sitepeyi ikufunika mwachangu chifukwa anthu 100 a ku Malawi amatenga kachilombo tsiku lililonse, ndipo pafupifupi 138 amafa ndi AIDS tsiku lililonse. Nduna ya Zaumoyo Jean Kalirani adalengeza mapulaniwo pa chikumbutso chaposachedwa cha Tsiku la AIDS Padziko Lonse m'boma la kumpoto kwa Karonga.

en: "We will go in the villages asking for blood samples to check whether that person is HIV positive or not. And those that will be found HIV positive will definitely be given the care they need. And those who are found negative will also be counseled so that they remain negative," said Kalirani.
ny: "Tidzapita kumidzi kukafunsa za magazi kuti tione ngati munthuyo ali ndi HIV kapena ayi. Ndipo omwe apezeka kuti ali ndi HIV adzapatsidwa chisamaliro chomwe amafunikira. Ndipo omwe apezeka kuti alibe HIV adzapatsidwanso upangiri kuti akhalebe ndi HIV", adatero Kalirani.

en: Kalirani said the campaign will start in mid-March and will aim to reach everyone in the country, including people who are far from health facilities that provide HIV testing and counseling services. She said the campaign is in line with the goal of ending HIV infection by 2030. Malawi's HIV infection rate is currently at 10 percent, a slight drop from three years ago.
ny: Kalirani adati ntchitoyi iyamba pakati pa mwezi wa March ndipo cholinga chake ndi kufikira anthu onse mdziko muno, kuphatikizapo anthu omwe ali kutali ndi malo azaumoyo omwe amapereka chithandizo cha HIV komanso chithandizo cha uphungu. Iye adati ntchitoyi ikugwirizana ndi cholinga choletsa matenda a HIV pofika chaka cha 2030.

en: The announcement has raised fears in some Malawians, such as Steven Jailosi, a primary school teacher in rural Blantyre, who feel the campaign will likely infringe upon peoples privacy.
ny: Kulengeza kumeneku kwachititsa mantha anthu ena a ku Malawi, monga Steven Jailosi, mphunzitsi wa sukulu ya pulaimale m'mudzi wa Blantyre, amene akuona kuti kampeniyo mwina idzaphwanya ufulu wa anthu.

en: "I think it is not okay because they will be invading our privacy. HIV testing is supposed to be private. No one is supposed to know that I went for an HIV testing unless I make a choice to tell them," said Jailosi.
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti sibwino chifukwa iwo adzalowa mu chinsinsi chathu. Kuyesedwa kwa HIV kuyenera kukhala kwachinsinsi. Palibe amene ayenera kudziwa kuti ndinapita kukachita mayeso a HIV pokhapokha ngati ndasankha kuwauza", anatero Jailosi.

en: Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that although she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.
ny: Ester Makonokaya, mlembi ku Blantyre, ananena kuti ngakhale kuti anayesedwa kale, akuona kuti kuyesa HIV khomo ndi khomo kudzaphwanya ufulu wa anthu.

en: "Government should instead take the mobile clinics to the villages where people will be able to access them on their own rather than taking testing in their homes, because that might mean that some of the people who are not supposed to know other peoples status will know because, you know, when someone has been tested you show some reactions," said Makonokaya.
ny: "Boma liyenera kutengera zipatala zoyendera m'midzi kumene anthu azitha kuzipeza okha m'malo mochita mayeso m'nyumba zawo, chifukwa izi zitha kutanthauza kuti anthu ena omwe sayenera kudziwa momwe anthu ena alili adzadziwa chifukwa, mukudziwa, wina akayesedwa mumawonetsa mayankho ena", adatero Makonokaya.

en: Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and a producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."
ny: Macpherson Maulana, mtolankhani ku Blantyre ndi wofalitsa mapulogalamu a wailesi pa zaumoyo, anauza VOA kuti boma lingachite bwino kuphunzitsa anthu a ku Malawi za kufunika kwa kuyezetsa HIV kuti anthu apite kukachita mayeso okha "popanda kukakamizidwa".

en: "I fear it could end up into fights. You see it happened in Liberia recently where people who were coming to help people suspected to have contracted Ebola were even killed. So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily," said Maulana.
ny: "Ndikuopa kuti zitha kutha ndi mikangano. Mwaona zomwe zinachitika ku Liberia posachedwa pomwe anthu omwe amabwera kudzathandiza anthu omwe akuganiza kuti adalandira Ebola adaphedwa. Chifukwa chake, maphunziro aboma ndiye chinthu chofunikira kwambiri kuti anthu alimbikitsidwe kuti abwere kudzayesedwa mwaufulu", adatero Maulana.

en: However, HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, whose NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.
ny: Komabe, mlangizi wa HIV/AIDS David Odali, yemwe bungwe lake la NGO Umunthu Foundation limayendetsa ntchito zokhudzana ndi HIV, anaumirira kuti chinsinsi chidzatetezedwa.

en: "Confidentiality will be upheld. Lets consider the household setup. I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to members of that family. [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclosing the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately," said Odali.
ny: "Chinsinsi chidzasungidwa. Tiyeni tione momwe banja limapangidwira. Ndikuganiza kuti chinthu choyamba ndi kupereka uphungu pagulu kwa mamembala am'banjamo. [N'zoona] anthu amatha kuyesedwa pomwe ena akuyang'ana, koma zikafika poulula zotsatira, mlangizi akuyenera kufotokoza zotsatirazo kwa aliyense payekha", adatero Odali.

en: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.
ny: Odali anati munthu amene wapatsidwa mayesowo ndi amene ayenera kufotokoza mmene alili.

en: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people. The organization says it worked well.
ny: Mu 2006, bungwe lothandiza anthu lotchedwa Development Aid from People to People linachita mayeso a HIV khomo ndi khomo m'zigawo za Thyolo ndi Blantyre, ndipo anthu 400,000 anafikapo.

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi
ny: Mavuto a Madzi Akuchititsa Mantha a Matenda Ofalitsidwa ndi Madzi ku Malawi

en: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water. But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
ny: Anthu a ku Malawi, omwe amakhala ku Blantyre, likulu la malonda m'dzikoli, nthawi zambiri amadalira madzi a m'mapaipi. Koma kwa miyezi isanu yapitayi, madzi a m'mapaipiwo akhala akuuma, zomwe zimakakamiza anthu kuti azitenga madzi kuchokera ku malo osatetezedwa monga mitsinje ndi zitsime, pamene ntchito ikuchitika pa siteshoni yaikulu yopopera madzi mumzindawu.

en: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.
ny: Ku Blantyre ndi madera ozungulira, anthu akhala masiku asanu opanda madzi.

en: Women, who by Malawi tradition are responsible for household tasks, complain of the risks they face when fetching water from rivers far from residential areas.
ny: Akazi, omwe malinga ndi mwambo wa Malawi ali ndi udindo wochita ntchito zapakhomo, akudandaula za ngozi zimene amakumana nazo pamene akupita kukatunga madzi m'mitsinje yakutali ndi malo okhala anthu.

en: Rhoda Milanzi, a housewife and mother of three, tells VOA the journeys through bushy footpaths are risky. "We wake up every day 2 a.m., sometimes 1 a.m., to go and collect water. There are so many risks. You see, sometimes we would meet witches, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."
ny: Rhoda Milanzi, mayi wa ana atatu, anauza VOA kuti kuyenda m'misewu ya anthu ambiri ndi koopsa. "Timauka tsiku lililonse 2 koloko m'mawa, nthaŵi zina 1 koloko m'mawa, kuti tikatenge madzi. Pali ngozi zambiri.

en: Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river. But she says they have been disturbed by youths who hide in the nearby bush.
ny: Milanzi akuti kuti achepetse katundu wonyamula madzi kunyumba kuti asambe, akazi amakonda kusamba mumtsinje.

en: "These youths of today would come there and hide somewhere to see us naked. This has been a major embarrassment. In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
ny: "Achinyamata a masiku ano ankabwera kumeneko ndi kubisala kwinakwake kuti atione tili maliseche.

en: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath," she explains.
ny: Ena a iwo anawalanga, koma nthaŵi zina anali kukwera mitengo kuti akaone akazi achikulire ngati ife tikusamba", akufotokoza motero.

en: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
ny: Vuto la madzi linakhudzanso kupereka chithandizo cha zaumoyo.

en: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
ny: Masabata atatu apitawo, akuluakulu a chipatala cha Queen Elizabeth ku Blantyre anatsimikizira kuti anaimitsa opaleshoni chifukwa cha kusowa kwa madzi.

en: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
ny: Anthu amene amalimbikitsa ufulu wa anthu pa nkhani ya thanzi amachenjeza kuti matenda opatsirana ndi madzi akhoza kufalikira, makamaka m'madera amene muli anthu ambiri, ngati vutoli silinathetsedwe.

en: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.  Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
ny: Akuluakulu a Blantyre Water Board akunena kuti vutoli ndi la polojekiti yomwe ikuchitika yomwe ikugwiritsidwa ntchito ndi European Union yomwe ikufuna kukhazikitsa makina atsopano opopera madzi ku Walkers Ferry, malo opopera madzi. Priscilla Matthew, wolankhulira Blantyre Water Board, akuti polojekitiyi ikuyembekezeka kuwonjezera mphamvu yopanga madzi kufika pa 105,000 cubic metres patsiku kuchokera pa 78,000 cubic metres omwe amapanga tsiku lililonse.

en: "January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015]. That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be," Mateyu said.
ny: "Mwezi wa January ndi pamene ntchitoyi ikutha. Koma kuti makina atsopano ndi zina zonse ziyambe kugwira ntchito bwino, tiyenera kudikira mpaka mwezi wa March [2015].

en: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.  The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
ny: Bungwe loona za ufulu wa ogula, Consumers Association of Malawi, linali likupanga mapulani oti likhale ndi ma vigile ku board ya madzi mpaka madzi atabwereranso, koma board idapempha ochita zionetsero kuti asachedwe, ndikulonjeza kugawa madzi kwa anthu okhala kudzera m'matangi amadzi oyenda. Gulu la ufulu wa ogula lapatsa board ya madzi milungu iwiri kuti ikwaniritse zomwe idalonjeza isanapite patsogolo ndi ziwonetsero.

en: Malawi President Under Fire for Giving Money to Journalists
ny: Pulezidenti wa Malawi Akuzengedwa Mlandu Chifukwa Chopereka Ndalama kwa Atolankhani

en: Malawi President Peter Mutharika is under fire for giving envelopes containing $125 to more than 80 media people at a dinner he hosted last month in Blantyre. The editor of the privately owned Times Television said reporters were told the envelopes contained the presidents plans for the media - which has been critical of the governments economic performance.
ny: Purezidenti wa Malawi Peter Mutharika akuvutitsidwa chifukwa chopereka ma envelopu okhala ndi madola 125 kwa anthu opitilira 80 atolankhani pa chakudya chamadzulo chomwe adachita mwezi watha ku Blantyre. Mkonzi wa Times Television yaumwini adati atolankhani adauzidwa kuti ma envelopu anali ndi mapulani a Purezidenti kwa atolankhani - omwe adatsutsa ntchito zachuma za boma.

en: In his column published in Malawis Sunday Times newspaper, editor Grecian Tukula said he was not sure why the money was given to journalists at the state dinner.
ny: M'nkhani yake yofalitsidwa mu nyuzipepala ya Malawi Sunday Times, mkonzi Grecian Tukula anati sanali wotsimikiza chifukwa chake ndalamazo zinaperekedwa kwa atolankhani pa chakudya chamadzulo cha boma.

en: Tukula said he initially decided to return the money but reversed the decision to avoid "creating a scene."
ny: Tukula anati poyamba anaganiza zobwezera ndalamazo koma anasintha maganizo ake kuti apewe "kuyambitsa chisokonezo".

en: But the editor for the Weekend Nation newspaper, George Kasakula, told VOA that he returned the money right away.
ny: Koma mkonzi wa nyuzipepala ya Weekend Nation, George Kasakula, anauza VOA kuti anabweza ndalamazo nthaŵi yomweyo.

en: "I just felt it was not right for me to receive the money, so I returned it. My understanding is that if someone invites me to a workshop, its their duty to ensure that they feed me, they accommodate me and they transport me. But in this case, I didnt see why I should get that allowance because I didnt spend anything to go to Sanjika [Palace]," said Kasakula.
ny: "Ndinkangoona kuti sikunali koyenera kuti ndilandire ndalamazo, choncho ndinabweza. Kumvetsa kwanga ndikuti ngati wina anditumiza kumsonkhano, ndi udindo wawo kuonetsetsa kuti andipatsa chakudya, akundipatsa malo ogona komanso akunditumiza. Koma pankhaniyi, sindinaone chifukwa chake ndiyenera kulandira ndalamazo chifukwa sindinagwiritse ntchito chilichonse popita ku Sanjika [Palace]", anatero Kasakula.

en: The issue has attracted more public attention after privately owned Capital Radio aired a story questioning the meaning of the cash handouts from the president.
ny: Nkhaniyi yakopa chidwi cha anthu ambiri pambuyo poti wailesi ya Capital Radio ya anthu wamba yaulutsa nkhani yofunsa tanthauzo la ndalama zomwe pulezidenti anapereka.

en: "As Capital FM we serve the interest of the public. This issue has been all over the social media, and even we as a media are implicated [we believe] it is paramount that we follow up and get to the bottom of the matter," said Steven Dakalira, the head of news and current affairs at Capital Radio.
ny: "Monga Capital FM timatumikira chidwi cha anthu. Nkhaniyi yakhala ikufalikira pa ma media onse, ndipo ngakhale ife monga atolankhani timakhudzidwa [timakhulupirira] ndikofunikira kwambiri kuti titsatire ndikufika pansi pa nkhaniyi", atero a Steven Dakalira, wamkulu wa nkhani ndi zochitika zamakono ku Capital Radio.

en: In his column in the Nyasa Times, Malawi professor of law Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa said what President Mutharika did by giving money handouts to journalists at a news event was tantamount to bribery. He has called on Mutharika to resign or face impeachment proceedings.
ny: M'nkhani yake mu Nyasa Times, Pulofesa wa malamulo wa Malawi Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa anati zomwe Purezidenti Mutharika anachita popereka ndalama kwa atolankhani pamwambo wa atolankhani zinali ngati ziphuphu.

en: Local civil society groups said that "by attempting to bribe the journalists" Mutharika subjected his leadership style to disrepute.
ny: Magulu a anthu wamba anena kuti "mwa kuyesa kupereka ziphuphu kwa atolankhani" Mutharika anaipitsa mbiri ya utsogoleri wake.

en: Meanwhile, some journalists are donating the money to charity.
ny: Panthaŵiyi, atolankhani ena akupereka ndalamazo ku ntchito zachifundo.

en: Brian Ligomeka, the Managing Editor for the Times Group, told Times Television that all four employees there have donated the money to an orphanage.
ny: Brian Ligomeka, Mkonzi Wamkulu wa Times Group, anauza Times Television kuti antchito ake onse anayi apereka ndalamazo ku nyumba ya ana amasiye.

en: "At first we decided to return the money to the president but we later thought it wise to buy assorted items like sugar, salt, notebooks and donate it to needy children," said Ligomeka.
ny: "Poyamba tinaganiza zobwezera ndalamazo kwa pulezidenti koma kenako tinaganiza kuti ndi bwino kugula zinthu zosiyanasiyana monga shuga, mchere, mabuku ndi kuzipereka kwa ana osowa", anatero Ligomeka.

en: In his latest Sunday Times column, Raphael Tenthani, who also writes for BBC, apologized on behalf of other journalists "for letting down the public that trust journalists unreservedly."
ny: M'nkhani yake yomaliza ya mu Sunday Times, Raphael Tenthani, yemwe amalembanso nkhani za BBC, anapepesa m'malo mwa atolankhani ena "chifukwa chokhumudwitsa anthu amene amakhulupirira atolankhani mosasamala kanthu".

en: Tenthani has since donated the money for charity work and said that although the journalists could have done better if they returned the money right away, doing so would have been perceived as disrespect to the head of state.
ny: Tenthani wapereka ndalamazo kuti zithandizire anthu ena ndipo ananena kuti ngakhale kuti atolankhaniwo akanatha kuchita bwino ngati akanabwezera ndalamazo nthawi yomweyo, kuchita zimenezo kukanatengedwa ngati kupanda ulemu kwa mtsogoleri wa dziko.

en: Maclan Kanyangwa, who heads the Department of Journalism and Media Studies at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, said a media code of ethics bars journalists from accepting payment on a story.
ny: Maclan Kanyangwa, yemwe akutsogolera Dipatimenti ya Zolemba ndi Media Studies ku Polytechnic College ya University of Malawi, anati malamulo a chikhalidwe cha atolankhani amaletsa atolankhani kulandira malipiro pa nkhani.

en: "Obviously the meeting at the palace was the newsworthy event. There was a possibility that something was going to be published. And in the event that this payment would have influenced journalist decision [on news judgment], then that becomes a problem," said Kanyangwa.
ny: "Mwachidziwikire msonkhano wa ku nyumba yachifumu unali nkhani yofunika. panali kuthekera kuti china chake chikanasindikizidwa. Ndipo ngati kulipira uku kukadakhudza chisankho cha mtolankhani [pa chiweruzo cha nkhani], ndiye kuti izi zimakhala vuto", adatero Kanyangwa.

en: Kanyangwa said he feels many journalists failed to return the money immediately because they might have been out of their ethical senses when they got the money.
ny: Kanyangwa anati akuona kuti atolankhani ambiri analephera kubweza ndalamazo nthawi yomweyo chifukwa mwina anali opanda nzeru pamene analandira ndalamazo.

en: Efforts to talk to Presidential Press Officer Fredrick Ndala were not successful. But some government authorities say the payment was not a bribe but meant for a fuel refund to those who attended the night event.
ny: Kuyesayesa kulankhula ndi Pulezidenti Press Officer Fredrick Ndala sanali bwino. koma ena akuluakulu boma amanena kuti malipiro sanali chiphuphu koma anatanthauza kubwezera mafuta kwa anthu amene anapezeka usiku chochitika.

en: Report: Manufacturing Could Free Poorest Nations From Poverty
ny: Lipoti: Kupanga Zinthu Kungathandize Kuti Mayiko Osauka Asakhale Osauka

en: A new United Nations report urges the poorest countries in the world to shift from low- to high-productivity activities to improve their economies.
ny: Lipoti latsopano la bungwe la United Nations likulimbikitsa mayiko osauka kwambiri padziko lonse kuti asinthe ntchito zawo kuti zikhale zothandiza kwambiri kuti chuma chawo chiziyenda bwino.

en: In its annual Least Developed Countries Report, UNCTAD — the U.N. Conference on Trade and Development — says these countries must structurally transform their economies to free themselves from the "poverty trap," which is stunting economic growth and development.
ny: M'lipoti lake la pachaka la Mayiko Ochepa Chitukuko, UNCTAD  UN Conference on Trade and Development  imanena kuti mayiko ameneŵa ayenera kusintha chuma chawo kuti adzipulumutse ku "msampha wa umphaŵi", umene ukulepheretsa kukula kwa chuma ndi chitukuko.

en: Of the 48 nations the U.N. considers "Least Developed Countries" (LDCs), only one, Laos, is on track to achieve all seven of the Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) by 2015.
ny: Pa mayiko 48 amene UN imawaona kuti ndi "Mayiko Ochepa Kupita Patsogolo" (LDCs), dziko limodzi lokha, Laos, ndilo lili pa njira yabwino yokwaniritsira zolinga zonse zisanu ndi ziŵiri za chitukuko cha zaka chikwi (MDGs) pofika chaka cha 2015.

en: Only four African countries — Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda and Uganda — are likely to meet a majority of these targets.
ny: Mayiko anayi okha a ku Africa  Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda ndi Uganda  ndi amene angakwanitse kukwaniritsa zolinga zambiri zimenezi.

en: This assessment is particularly grim in light of the even greater challenges awaiting these countries in the coming years. The MDGs set a goal for nations to halve their poverty levels by 2015. The so-called Sustainable Development Goals, which carry on from where the MDGs leave off, call for eradication of poverty by 2030.
ny: Kuunika kumeneku n'kosautsa kwambiri chifukwa cha mavuto aakulu amene akuyembekezera mayiko ameneŵa m'zaka zikubwerazi. MDGs inapatsa mayiko cholinga chochepetsa umphaŵi wawo ndi theka pofika chaka cha 2015.

en: According to Taffere Tesfachew, an UNCTAD official who works with African nations, it would be nothing short of a miracle for the LDCs to pull this off.
ny: Malinga ndi kunena kwa Taffere Tesfachew, mkulu wa UNCTAD amene amagwira ntchito ndi mayiko a mu Afirika, kukanakhala kozizwitsa kuti ma LDC akwaniritse zimenezi.

en: In order for the least developed countries to achieve this miraculous performance, he says they will need to structurally change their economies.
ny: Iye akuti kuti mayiko osauka kwambiri akwanitse kuchita zozizwitsa zimenezi, afunika kusintha chuma chawo.

en: He tells VOA this means shifting labor from activities with low productivity, such as small-scale agriculture and services to more dynamic activities with higher productivity, such as manufacturing and high-value services.
ny: Iye akuuza VOA kuti zimenezi zikutanthauza kusuntha ntchito kuchokera ku ntchito zokhala ndi zokolola zochepa, monga ulimi waung'ono ndi ntchito za anthu ena kupita ku ntchito zamphamvu kwambiri zokhala ndi zokolola zambiri, monga kupanga zinthu ndi ntchito za anthu ena.

en: "Countries that have moved up are the ones that are creating opportunities for those that are leaving agriculture to engage in things where they add value, where they get training and as it happens, manufacturing tends to have that sort of feature, that is why this call for manufacturing," he said. "Countries that are using policies to shift and influence capital and labor to move into this activity sector tend to do better."
ny: "Mayiko amene asintha ndi amene akupanga mipata kwa iwo amene akuchoka ulimi kuti achite zinthu kumene iwo kuwonjezera phindu, kumene iwo alandira maphunziro ndipo monga izo zimachitika, kupanga amakonda kukhala ndi mtundu wa mbali, ndicho chifukwa chake izi kuitana kwa kupanga", iye anati. "Mayiko amene akugwiritsa ntchito ndondomeko kusuntha ndi kusonkhezera likulu ndi ntchito kusuntha mu gawo ili ntchito amakonda kuchita bwino".

en: Tesfachew says these high-productivity sectors tend to pay higher wages and create a demand for goods. This, he says, encourages investment.
ny: Tesfachew akuti ntchito za m'madera amenewa zomwe zimachititsa kuti anthu azichita zambiri zimapangitsa kuti anthu azilipira malipiro apamwamba komanso kuti anthu azifuna katundu wambiri.

en: On the surface, it appears that the LDCs are not doing badly. UNCTAD economic data show growth in these poor countries between 2002 and 2008 exceeded the seven percent target set by the international community. And, even after the 2008 financial crisis, UNCTAD notes the LDCs grew faster than other developing countries, at an average of 5.7 percent per year.
ny: Ngakhale pambuyo pa mavuto azachuma a 2008, UNCTAD inati mayiko osauka kwambiri anakula mofulumira kuposa mayiko ena osauka, pafupifupi 5.7 peresenti pachaka.

en: But U.N. economists say the outlook for the least developed countries in the short and medium term remains uncertain. They say increasing peoples productivity is the best way to break the patter of human and economic underdevelopment that continues to entrap them in poverty.
ny: Koma akatswiri a zachuma a bungwe la United Nations amanena kuti chiyembekezo cha mayiko osauka kwambiri m'kupita kwa nthaŵi ndi m'kati mwa nthaŵi sichidziŵikabe. Iwo amati kuonjezera zokolola za anthu ndiyo njira yabwino kwambiri yothetsera vuto la kusatukuka kwa anthu ndi chuma kumene kukupitirizabe kuwachititsa kukhala osauka.

en: UN: Most African Nations to Miss 2015 MDG Goals
ny: UN: Mayiko Ambiri a ku Africa Akusowa Zolinga za MDG za 2015

en: Most African countries will not reach the Millennium Development Goals set for 2015 because of the gap between economic and human development. That is one of the conclusions in this years annual U.N. report on the Least Developed Countries, presented Thursday.
ny: Mayiko ambiri a ku Africa sadzakwanitsa kukwaniritsa zolinga za chitukuko za zaka chikwi za 2015 chifukwa cha kusiyana pakati pa chitukuko cha zachuma ndi chitukuko cha anthu.

en: Junior Davis, U.N. economic affairs officer for Africa, said African countries have not been able to translate their economic growth into structural transformation.
ny: Junior Davis, mkulu wa bungwe la United Nations woyang'anira zachuma ku Africa, anati mayiko a ku Africa sanathe kusintha chuma chawo kuti chikhale kusintha kwa zinthu.

en: "We think that is the case because these countries have not focused efficiently on building what we call their productive capacities," Davis said. "These are the basic human and economic development capacities that are needed to promote sustainable economic development. And the MDG, as they were constructed, largely ignored the need to develop the productive capacities."
ny: "Tikuona kuti zimenezi zili choncho chifukwa chakuti mayiko amenewa sanaike mtima pa ntchito yomanga zimene timazitcha kuti mphamvu zawo zopanga zinthu", anatero Davis. "Izi ndi mphamvu zoyambira za anthu ndi za chuma zimene zimafunika kuti chitukuko cha zachuma chiziyenda bwino. Ndipo zolinga za chitukuko cha zaka chikwi, pamene zinamangidwa, zinanyalanyaza kwambiri kufunika kokonza mphamvu zopanga zinthu".

en: Slow progress
ny: Kupita patsogolo pang'onopang'ono

en: African countries also are not on course to halve poverty by 2015, and their overall progress on reducing hunger is relatively slow. Poverty limits human development and undermines productivity. And economic development is needed to make gains in human development.
ny: Mayiko a ku Africa nawonso sakutha kuchepetsa umphawi ndi theka pofika chaka cha 2015, ndipo kupita patsogolo kwawo pa kuchepetsa njala n'kochedwa. Umphawi umachepetsa chitukuko cha anthu ndipo umalepheretsa ntchito.

en: Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda and Malawi are the only African countries on track to reach the majority of the development goals. They are making progress because they heavily invested in areas that create sustainable development such as infrastructure, health and education.
ny: Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda ndi Malawi ndi mayiko okha a ku Africa omwe akuyendera bwino kuti akwaniritse zolinga zambiri zachitukuko.

en: The post-2015 development agenda for fragile countries where governance remains an issue — such as South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo — will still largely depend on support from the international community to achieve social and economic development, Davis said.
ny: Davis anati, ndondomeko ya chitukuko cha pambuyo pa 2015 m'mayiko ovuta kumene kayendetsedwe ka boma kakhalabe vuto  monga South Sudan ndi Democratic Republic of Congo  idzafunikanso kwambiri kuti mayiko athandizidwe kuti akwaniritse chitukuko cha anthu ndi chuma.

en: Improvements in rural development, industrial productivity, agriculture and the services sectors in these countries will require "ways in which we can have a pattern of growth which is not just sustainable but jobs-rich," Davis said. "Because we see the growth in jobs and employment is central to any development strategy that aims to reduce poverty in a sustainable way."
ny: "Pakuti tikuona kuti kukula kwa ntchito ndi ntchito n'kofunika kwambiri pa njira iliyonse ya chitukuko imene cholinga chake n'kuchepetsa umphaŵi m'njira yodalirika", anatero Davis.

en: A country is placed on the Least Developed Countries list based on its per capita income, economic vulnerability, and human development indicators such as health and nutrition.
ny: Dziko limaphatikizidwa m'gulu la Mayiko Ochepa Chitukuko potengera ndalama zimene munthu amapeza, mmene chuma chake chikuyendera, ndiponso zinthu zimene zimasonyeza kuti anthu akupita patsogolo monga thanzi ndi zakudya.

en: Of the 48 least developed countries in the world, 34 are in Africa. Three countries have graduated from their least developed status: Botswana, Cape Verde and Samoa.
ny: Pa mayiko 48 osauka kwambiri padziko lonse, 34 ali ku Africa.

en: Strike Paralyzes Malawi's Judicial Services
ny: Kuchita Ulesi Kumathetsa Ntchito za Boma ku Malawi

en: A week-long strike by the support staff of Malawi's judiciary system has paralyzed the courts, causing overcrowding in police cells and the indefinite suspension of major cases - including government corruption trials. Court marshals, clerks and messengers are demanding the 30 percent salary increases promised by the government two years ago.
ny: Ku Malawi, anthu a m'bungwe la oweruza akhala akugwada kwa mlungu umodzi ndipo zimenezi zachititsa kuti makhoti azingokhala odzaza ndi anthu komanso kuti milandu ikhale yoima mpaka kalekale, kuphatikizapo milandu yokhudza ziphuphu.

en: Chanting and singing around the court premises has become a pastime activity for the striking court workers since the onset of a sit-in last week.  Linley Hebert, a spokesperson for the striking workers, told VOA the strike is a result of the governments failure to honor a 2012 agreement.
ny: Linley Hebert, mneneri wa ogwira ntchito omwe akuimirira, anauza VOA kuti kuimirira ndi chifukwa chakuti boma silinachite bwino mogwirizana ndi mgwirizano wa mu 2012.
