en: "In October [this year], the government reviewed the salaries of the civil servants, but we were not included in that revision," Hebert said.
ny: "Mu October [chaka chino], boma linapenda malipiro a antchito aboma, koma sitinaphatikizidwe m'kuwongolera kumeneko", anatero Hebert.

en: "Yet in 2012, we had an agreement that each time they are revising the salaries of the civil servants, [they will be increasing our salaries as well].
ny: "Komabe mu 2012, tinagwirizana kuti nthawi iliyonse akamasintha malipiro a anthu ogwira ntchito m'boma, [adzatiwonjezeranso malipiro athu].

en: So, [after adhering to the agreement in 2013], we are surprised to see that this time we are left out."  Government authorities say the failure to increase judicial workers salaries this year is largely because of financial constraints, following a donor aid freeze against Malawi's government.
ny: Choncho, [pambuyo pa kutsatira mgwirizano mu 2013], tikudabwa kuona kuti nthawi ino tatsala". Akuluakulu a boma akuti kulephera kuonjezera malipiro a ogwira ntchito zachiweruzo chaka chino ndi chifukwa cha mavuto a zachuma, pambuyo pa kuletsa thandizo la othandizira boma la Malawi.

en: The freeze is a result of a government financial scandal in which more than $30 million was looted from government coffers.  Ministry of Finance spokesperson Nations Msowoya told a local radio station it is hard for the government to meet the workers' demand.
ny: Kuletsa ntchitoyi ndi chifukwa cha chipwirikiti cha boma chomwe chinachititsa kuti ndalama zoposa madola 30 miliyoni zigoba m'thumba la boma.

en: "It is difficult to promise what the treasury will do. But suffice to say that the prevailing economic circumstances and budgetary constraints will make a little bit difficult for the treasury to bow down to the demands," "Msowoya said.
ny: "N'zovuta kulonjeza zomwe Treasury idzachita. Koma ndikwanira kunena kuti zochitika zachuma zomwe zikuchitika komanso zovuta za bajeti zidzapangitsa kuti Treasury ikhale yovuta pang'ono kuti igonjere zofuna", "adatero Msowoya.

en: But according to Hebert, the strikers will not resume work until their demands are met.  "Since I was born [there has been] no time the government said it had some money.
ny: Koma malinga ndi kunena kwa Hebert, omenyera nkhondowo sadzayambiranso ntchito kufikira pamene zofuna zawo zidzachitidwa. "Kuyambira pamene ndinabadwa [palibe] nthaŵi imene boma linati linali ndi ndalama.

en: It has its own means [of finding the money] and it will find the same means to give us the money," Hebert insisted.  The ongoing strike is hampering progress of trials, as court operations remain suspended.
ny: "Kupitilizabe kugunda kumapangitsa kuti milandu isapitirire, chifukwa ntchito za makhoti zikadali zoimitsidwa".

en: Several trials, including that of former justice minister Ralph Kasambara, who is answering charges in connection with the financial scandal, were indefinitely suspended last week.
ny: Milandu ingapo, kuphatikizapo ya nduna yakale ya chilungamo Ralph Kasambara, amene akuyankha milandu yokhudzana ndi chipwirikiti cha ndalama, anaimitsidwa kosatha sabata yatha.

en: Police are complaining of congestion in jail cells, as no suspects are being taken to court.
ny: Apolisi akudandaula kuti ndende zili ndi anthu ambiri, chifukwa palibe amene akuimbidwa mlandu.

en: Malawi police spokesperson Rhoda Manjolo told VOA the only option they have is "giving police bail to those with minor offenses."   Human rights campaigners and legal experts say the strike is contributing to human rights violations.
ny: Mneneri wa apolisi a ku Malawi, Rhoda Manjolo, anauza VOA kuti njira yokhayo imene iwo ali nayo ndi "kupereka chipulumutso cha apolisi kwa anthu amene achita zolakwa zazing'ono".

en: "There are those people who have to be taken to court within 48 hours," noted Lawyer George Kadzipatike who works in a private practice in the northern city of Mzuzu. "We cannot make application for them to be granted bail.
ny: "Pali anthu amene ayenera kupita kukhoti pasanathe maola 48", anatero loya George Kadzipatike yemwe amagwira ntchito m'boma la Mzuzu kumpoto kwa dzikoli. "Sitingathe kupempha kuti apatsidwe bail.

en: There are those people who do not want to live with their partners, they would like the court to decree that they be divorced, we cannot file any petition through the courts."
ny: Pali anthu amene safuna kukhala ndi anzawo, amafuna kuti khoti lipereke chigamulo chakuti asudzulane, sitingathe kupereka pempho lililonse kudzera m'makhoti".

en: Government authorities say closed door negotiations to resolve the matter continue in the capital, Lilongwe.  But the striking workers told VOA whatever the case, they will accept nothing short of a 30 percent increase in their salaries.
ny: Akuluakulu aboma ati zokambirana zotsekedwa kuti athetse nkhaniyi zikupitirirabe likulu la dziko, Lilongwe. Koma ogwira ntchito omwe akugundawo adauza VOA kuti mulimonse mmene zingakhalire, iwo sadzalola kanthu kochepa kuposa kuwonjezeka kwa malipiro awo ndi 30 peresenti.

en: A similar strike lasted three months in 2012 after the magistrates and judges joined the labor action.
ny: Kuwombera kofanana ndi kumeneku kunatenga miyezi itatu mu 2012 pambuyo poti oweruza ndi oweruza agwirizana ndi ntchitoyi.

en: Famine in Southern Africa Worse Than Predicted - 2002-07-24
ny: Njala ku Southern Africa Yoipitsitsa Kuposa Zimene Analosera - 2002-07-24

en: The United Nations World Food Program says the famine in southern Africa is even worse than predicted. WFP officials are warning that 13 million people in six countries: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland and Mozambique are in danger of starvation if they do not get food aid.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations World Food Program linanena kuti njala ya kumwera kwa Africa ndi yoipitsitsa kuposa mmene anthu ankaganizira. Akuluakulu a WFP akuchenjeza kuti anthu 13 miliyoni m'mayiko asanu ndi limodzi: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland ndi Mozambique ali pangozi ya njala ngati sakulandira chakudya.

en: World Food Program officials say they need one million tons of food to alleviate hunger in southern Africa, but they are not confident they will get it. In an appeal to the international community at the beginning of July, WFP officials asked for more than $0.5 billion to buy food. So far they have received only 20 percent of that. WFP's director for the southern Africa region, Judith Lewis, says the situation is getting desperate. "The window of opportunity to avert what could be a major humanitarian crisis is closing," she said. "We need more assistance now. We need food on the high seas now, or we need cash to buy commodities that are still available in southern Africa, so we can avert this major, major crisis."
ny: Akuluakulu a WFP akuti akufunikira matani miliyoni a chakudya kuti athetse njala kum'mwera kwa Africa, koma sakutsimikiza kuti adzalandira. Poitanira anthu padziko lonse kumayambiriro kwa mwezi wa July, akuluakulu a WFP anapempha ndalama zoposa $0.5 biliyoni kuti agule chakudya. Mpaka pano alandira 20 peresenti yokha ya ndalamazo. Mkulu wa WFP kum'mwera kwa Africa, Judith Lewis, akuti zinthu zikufika poipa kwambiri. "Mphasa ya mwayi woletsa chimene chingakhale vuto lalikulu la anthu ikutseka", iye anati. "Tikufunika thandizo lina tsopano. Tikufuna chakudya panyanja tsopano, kapena tikufuna ndalama zogulira zinthu zomwe zilipobe kum'mwera kwa Africa, kuti tithe kuletsa vuto lalikululi".

en: Currently, the WFP is assisting six million of the most vulnerable people in the six most severely affected countries. About half of these people are in Zimbabwe. The agency says it is sure the number of people needing its help will rise.
ny: Pakali pano WFP ikuthandiza anthu mamiliyoni asanu ndi limodzi amene ali paupandu m'maiko asanu ndi limodzi amene akhudzidwa kwambiri. Pafupifupi theka la anthu amenewa ali ku Zimbabwe. Bungweli likuti ndi otsimikiza kuti chiwerengero cha anthu amene akufunikira thandizo lake chidzawonjezeka.

en: The World Health Organization notes southern Africa, in addition to having the highest prevalence of HIV/AIDS in the world, also has the world's highest chronic malnutrition rates. It predicts about 300,000 people could die over the next six months from diseases related to malnutrition.
ny: Bungwe Loona za Umoyo Padziko Lonse linanena kuti kum'mwera kwa Africa, kuli anthu ambiri amene ali ndi kachilombo ka HIV/AIDS, komanso anthu ambiri amene ali ndi matenda a njala.

en: Ms. Lewis says the dying has already begun. "We are seeing people moving from their villages," she said. "If they know there is going to be a food distribution, they immediately go there. The problem is we do not even have enough food to feed the people who are on the rolls, let alone add food for other people in the areas. Is there a potential to become chaotic? Yes. "
ny: "Tikuona anthu akuchoka m'midzi yawo", anatero. "Ngati akudziwa kuti padzakhala kugawa chakudya, amapita kumeneko nthawi yomweyo. Vuto nlakuti tilibe chakudya chokwanira kudyetsa anthu omwe ali pamndandanda, osanenapo za kuwonjezera chakudya kwa anthu ena m'maderawo. Kodi pali kuthekera kokhala chisokonezo? Inde. "

en: WFP'S Judith Lewis says at this time of year the agency is usually planning how to get food supplies into the region before the rainy season hits in October. But she says since the WFP is already having difficulty meeting its present targets, it can't even begin to plan for future food deliveries.
ny: Mkulu wa bungwe la WFP, Judith Lewis, ananena kuti nthawi ino ya chaka bungwe limeneli limakonzekera mmene lingafikitsire chakudya m'derali nyengo yamvula isanayambe mu October.

en: Canadian PM Impressed With African Development Plan - 2002-04-05
ny: PM wa Canada Anasangalala ndi Ndondomeko ya Chitukuko cha Africa - 2002-04-05

en: Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chretien says he is impressed with the progress being made towards implementing an African development plan.
ny: Nduna yaikulu ya dziko la Canada Jean Chretien akuti akudabwa ndi kupita patsogolo kumene kukuchitika pokonza dongosolo la chitukuko cha Africa.

en: Mr. Chretien made the remarks Sunday after meeting with South African President Thabo Mbeki and other regional leaders in Pretoria.
ny: A Chretien ananena zimenezi Lamlungu atakumana ndi Pulezidenti wa South Africa, a Thabo Mbeki, ndi atsogoleri ena a m'deralo ku Pretoria.

en: Mr. Chretien, the current chairman of the group of the seven most industrialized nations plus Russia, is visiting Africa to discuss the New Partnership for Africa's Development, known as NEPAD.
ny: Bambo Chretien, amene panopa ndi tcheyamani wa gulu la mayiko asanu ndi aŵiri opanga mafakitale kwambiri kuphatikiza Russia, akuchezera Africa kukakambirana za Mgwirizano Watsopano wa Kukula kwa Africa, wotchedwa NEPAD.

en: He said NEPAD will be one of the top agendas at the June G-8 summit in Kananaskis, Canada.
ny: Iye anati NEPAD idzakhala imodzi mwa nkhani zazikulu pamsonkhano wa G-8 wa June ku Kananaskis, Canada.

en: The G-8 nations are Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United States and Russia.
ny: Mayiko a G-8 ndi Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, United States ndi Russia.

en: Mr. Chretien says topics such as human rights, democracy the rule of law, transparency and good governance will be discussed at the G8 summit.
ny: A Chretien akuti nkhani monga ufulu wa munthu, demokalase, ulamuliro wa malamulo, chidziŵitso ndi ulamuliro wabwino zidzakambidwa pamsonkhano wa G8.

en: NEPAD outlines objectives of promoting democracy and good governance in Africa in return for Western economic assistance. It seeks to achieve an annual growth rate of seven-percent on the African continent by 2015.
ny: Bungwe la NEPAD limafuna kuti anthu a ku Africa azichita zinthu mogwirizana ndi mfundo za demokalase komanso kuti zinthu ziziwayendera bwino m'dzikoli, ndipo likamachita zimenezi, mayiko a kumadzulo azithandiza kwambiri pa nkhani ya zachuma.

en: South African President Mbeki said he is convinced that Africa is ready for NEPAD saying there has been definite progress toward democracy in the continent.
ny: Pulezidenti wa South Africa Mbeki ananena kuti akukhulupirira kuti Africa ndi yokonzeka ku NEPAD ponena kuti pali kupita patsogolo kotsimikizika kwa demokalase m'dzikoli.

en: Later, Mr. Chretien and Mr. Mbeki were joined by presidents Festus Mogae of Botswana, Bakili Muluzu of Malawi, Joaquim Chissano of Mozambique, Sam Nujoma of Namibia, Benjamin Makapa of Tanzania and Vice President Enoch Kavindele of Zambia.
ny: Pambuyo pake, a Chretien ndi a Mbeki anasonkhanitsidwa ndi ma pulezidenti a dziko la Botswana, Festus Mogae, Bakili Muluzu wa ku Malawi, Joaquim Chissano wa ku Mozambique, Sam Nujoma wa ku Namibia, Benjamin Makapa wa ku Tanzania ndi wachiwiri kwa pulezidenti wa dziko la Zambia, Enoch Kavindele.

en: Zimbabwe's President Robert Mugabe, who won re-election in disputed voting last month, was not invited.
ny: Pulezidenti wa Zimbabwe Robert Mugabe, yemwe anapambana chisankho chotsutsa chisankho mwezi watha, sanaitanidwe.

en: Reuters news agency reports the Canadian prime minister who has already visited Morocco, Algeria and Nigeria on his six-nation tour will visit Ethiopia and Senegal after South Africa.
ny: Bungwe la Reuters la malipoti linati nduna yaikulu ya Canada yomwe yachezera kale Morocco, Algeria ndi Nigeria paulendo wake wa mayiko asanu ndi limodzi idzapita ku Ethiopia ndi Senegal pambuyo pa South Africa.

en: Some information for this report provided by Reuters and AFP.
ny: Zina mwa mfundo za lipotili zinaperekedwa ndi Reuters ndi AFP.

en: Child Labor in Malawi - 2002-02-28
ny: Ntchito ya ana ku Malawi - 2002-02-28

en: The organization, Eye of the Child, is expressing concern about what is says is a large number of children who are being forced to work due to poverty.
ny: Bungwe la Eye of the Child, likusonyeza nkhaŵa ponena za zimene akuti ndi ana ambiri amene akukakamiza kugwira ntchito chifukwa cha umphaŵi.

en: It says these children risk being abused.
ny: Akuti ana ameneŵa angagwiriridwe ntchito molakwa.

en: Some under aged children work as mini – bus call boys in the busy business district of Limbe in the commercial capital, Blantyre. They are some of the many children who have been forced into employment because of poverty.
ny: Ana ena aang'ono amagwira ntchito monga anyamata a mabasi aang'ono m'dera la malonda lotukuka la Limbe, likulu la malonda, Blantyre.

en: Maxwell Matewere is the executive director of Eye of the Child. He says many of the children come from rural areas. He says, "Currently we havent done a data analysis but the Ministry of Labor intends to do that as soon as possible with financial resources from the International Labor Organization.
ny: Maxwell Matewere ndi director executive wa Eye of the Child. Iye akuti ana ambiri amachokera kumidzi. Iye akuti, "Pakadali pano sitinachite kusanthula deta koma Unduna wa Ntchito ukufuna kuchita zimenezo posachedwapa ndi ndalama zochokera ku International Labor Organization.

en: But basing on our own assessment and through our works, we feel child labor is a serious problem particularly in the rural areas and you can tell that from trafficking of children from rural areas to urban areas where most of the young people are working in peoples houses.
ny: Koma potengera kuwunika kwathu ndi ntchito zathu, timaona kuti ntchito ya ana ndi vuto lalikulu makamaka kumidzi ndipo mungaone kuti kuchokera ku malonda a ana kumidzi kupita kumidzi kumene achinyamata ambiri amagwira ntchito m'nyumba za anthu.

en: " Mr. Matewere says poor children often find work on large farm estates.
ny: " Bambo Matewere akuti ana osauka nthaŵi zambiri amapeza ntchito m'mafamu akuluakulu.

en: He said, "We have noticed that there are some indications that there are children who are working in tea estates and tobacco estates.
ny: Iye anati, "Tazindikira kuti pali zizindikiro zina zosonyeza kuti pali ana amene akugwira ntchito m'minda ya tiyi ndi ya fodya.

en: There also are children who are working in brick making mostly their parents will facilitate for them to work in those kinds of employment. "
ny: Palinso ana amene amagwira ntchito yopanga njerwa makamaka makolo awo amawathandiza kugwira ntchito zoterezi. "

en: Mr. Matewere says the Eye of the Child has established that there are gross violations of children rights in the country. These include, rape, defilement and being overworked.
ny: Bambo Matewere akuti bungwe la Eye of the Child linapeza kuti m'dziko muno ana akuzunzidwa kwambiri, kuphatikizapo kugwiriridwa, kuzunzidwa ndi kugwiriridwa ntchito.

en: He says this violates the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child.
ny: Iye akuti zimenezi zikuphwanya Pangano la United Nations pa za Ufulu wa Mwana.

en: "If you look at the Convention of the Rights of a Child," he said, "you will see that it provides for the protection for children from any kind of exploitation from any kind of harmful activities or act which threatens their health, their development which is a threat to education.
ny: Iye anati: "Ngati muona pangano la ufulu wa mwana, mudzaona kuti limapereka chitetezo kwa ana ku mtundu uliwonse wa kugwiritsidwa ntchito molakwa, ku mtundu uliwonse wa zochita kapena zochita zovulaza zimene zingaike pangozi thanzi lawo, chitukuko chawo, zimene zingaike pangozi maphunziro awo.

en: So children who are found working in tea estates, who are found in brick making, obvious, their rights as it is provided for in the Convention for the Rights of the Children as well as in the constitution are violated. "
ny: Choncho ana amene amapezeka akugwira ntchito m'minda ya tiyi, amene amapezeka akupanga njerwa, mwachionekere, ufulu wawo monga momwe waperekedwera m'Pangano la Ufulu wa Ana komanso m'malamulo oyendetsera dzikoli umaphwanyidwa".

en: The Eye of the Child executive director says his organization is looking at ways of protecting the rights of a child.
ny: Mkulu wa bungwe la The Eye of the Child akuti gulu lake likufunafuna njira zotetezera ufulu wa mwana.

en: He says to achieve this, the group has started a number of programs. "We have recently started a new program and what we are trying to do is to inform the general public on the best interests of the child and to inform them on the rights of a child.
ny: Iye akuti kuti zimenezi zitheke, gululi layamba mapulogalamu angapo. "Posachedwapa tayamba pulogalamu yatsopano ndipo tikuyesetsa kudziwitsa anthu onse za ubwino wa mwana ndi za ufulu wa mwana.

en: At the same we want also to build up the capacity of the children themselves so that may be they can be use their authentic voice out their concerns. "
ny: Panthaŵi imodzimodziyo tikufunanso kumanga maluso a anawo kuti mwina athe kugwiritsa ntchito mawu awo enieni kufotokoza nkhaŵa zawo. "

en: According to the Ministry of Labor authorities, many children are forced to leave school and find work because parents cannot afford school fees.
ny: Malinga ndi zimene akuluakulu a Unduna wa Ntchito ananena, ana ambiri amakakamizika kusiya sukulu n'kuyamba ntchito chifukwa chakuti makolo awo sangakwanitse kulipira ndalama za sukulu.

en: Although primary school is free in Malawi, most children do not attend due to lack of necessities like clothes.
ny: Ngakhale kuti sukulu ya pulaimale ndi yaulere ku Malawi, ana ambiri samapita chifukwa cha kusowa kwa zinthu zofunika monga zovala.

en: Over 60 per cent of Malawis nearly 11 million people live below the poverty line.
ny: Anthu oposa 60 peresenti a ku Malawi, pafupifupi 11 miliyoni, amakhala pansi pa msinkhu wa umphaŵi.

en: Malawi Court Convicts 12 People in Albino Attack
ny: Khoti la Malawi Latsutsa Anthu 12 pa Kuukira kwa Albino

en: A high court in Malawi has convicted five people of murder for the 2018 killing of a 22-year-old albino man, including the victims brother.
ny: Khoti lalikulu ku Malawi laweruza anthu asanu kuti ndi olakwa pa mlandu wakupha munthu wa zaka 22 wa mtundu wa alubino, kuphatikizapo mchimwene wa munthuyo.

en: The court convicted seven other people of selling the victim's body parts.
ny: Khoti linagamula kuti anthu ena asanu ndi aŵiri anali ndi mlandu wogulitsa ziwalo za thupi la womwalirayo.

en: Malawi officials say more than 170 albinos have been attacked in the country since 2014 by people who believe their body parts bring luck and wealth.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma la Malawi akuti anthu oposa 170 a mtundu wa alubino akhala akuukiridwa m'dzikoli kuyambira mu 2014 ndi anthu amene amakhulupirira kuti ziwalo za thupi lawo zimabweretsa mwayi ndi chuma.

en: Family members of the deceased, MacDonald Masambuka, left the courtroom Thursday with hopes of justice being served after the court convicted all 12 people accused in his death.  F
ny: Achibale a wakufayo, MacDonald Masambuka, anachoka m'bwalo lamilandu Lachinayi ndi chiyembekezo chakuti chilungamo chidzachitika pambuyo poti khoti laweruza anthu onse 12 omwe akuimbidwa mlandu wa imfa yake.

en: amily members, including Masambukas mother, appeared calm and composed as Judge Dorothy NyaKaunda Kamanga read the judgments.
ny: Mamembala a banja, kuphatikizapo mayi a Masambukas, anaoneka odekha ndi odekha pamene Woweruza Dorothy NyaKaunda Kamanga anaŵerenga zigamulozo.

en: Those convicted included a Catholic priest, Father Thomas Muhosa, police officer Chikondi Chileka, clinician Lumbani Kamanga, and the deceaseds brother, Cassim Masambuka. Charges included murder, extracting human tissues, causing harm to a person with disability, and trafficking in persons.
ny: Anthu amene anaweruzidwa anali wansembe wa Katolika, Abambo Thomas Muhosa, wapolisi Chikondi Chileka, dokotala Lumbani Kamanga, ndi mchimwene wa womwalirayo, Cassim Masambuka. Milanduyi inali kupha, kuchotsa minofu ya munthu, kuvulaza munthu wolumala, ndi kugulitsa anthu.

en: Kamanga convicted the victims brother and four others of murder.
ny: Kamanga anaimba mlandu mchimwene wa womenyedwayo ndi anthu ena anayi pa mlandu wa kupha munthu.

en: The court convicted seven other people, including the priest and police officer, of selling the victim's body parts.
ny: Khotilo linagamula kuti anthu ena asanu ndi aŵiri, kuphatikizapo wansembe ndi wapolisi, anali ndi mlandu wogulitsa ziwalo za thupi la womwalirayo.

en: Business with tissue  According to the court, Muhosha, Chileka and others offered to conduct business using human tissue extracted from a human corpse.
ny: Malinga ndi zimene khoti linagamula, Muhosha, Chileka ndi ena anapempha kuti achite malonda pogwiritsa ntchito minofu ya munthu imene anatenga ku mtembo wa munthu.

en: The judge said the state proved beyond reasonable doubt the 12 people conspired to kill Masambuka to extract his bones based on a perception they would benefit financially.
ny: Woweruza anati boma linatsimikizira mosakayikira kuti anthu 12wo anakonza chiwembu chopha Masambuka kuti am'chotsere mafupa ake poganiza kuti adzapindula ndi ndalama.

en: She said Masambuka is the latest victim of violent attacks on persons with albinism who have not been protected by the community.
ny: Iye anati Masambuka ndiye munthu waposachedwapa amene akuzunzidwa ndi anthu olumala amene sanatetezedwe ndi anthu ammudzi.

en: Director of Public Prosecutions Steve Kayuni represented the state in the case. He said he was pleased the court agreed on all the seven charges he presented.
ny: Mkulu wa boma woimira boma pankhaniyi, Steve Kayuni, ananena kuti anasangalala kuti khoti linavomereza milandu yonse isanu ndi iŵiri imene iye anafotokoza.

en: "Its really something overwhelming on the part of the state considering that this matter, if you notice, there is a police officer involved, a priest involved and there is a brother involved.
ny: "Zimenezo n'zochititsa mantha kwambiri kwa boma chifukwa chakuti nkhani imeneyi, ngati muona, ili ndi wapolisi, wansembe, ndi m'bale.

en: If you notice, it all revolves around the position of trust — that somebody like the late Macdonald Masambuka trusted so much, they are the ones who ended up betraying him," Kayuni said.
ny: Ngati mwaona, zonse zimayendera pa udindo wa kukhulupilira  kuti winawake ngati wakufa Macdonald Masambuka anakhulupirira kwambiri, iwo ndi omwe adamuchitira chipongwe", adatero Kayuni.

en: Masambuka went missing from his village on March 9, 2018, and his limbless body was found buried in a garden on April 2, 2018, in his home district of Machinga south of Malawi.
ny: Masambuka anasowa m'mudzi mwake pa March 9, 2018, ndipo thupi lake lopanda miyendo linapezeka litakwiriridwa m'munda pa April 2, 2018, m'chigawo cha Machinga chakumwera kwa Malawi.

en: Enticement  Court documents show that Masambuka was enticed by his brother to meet his friends, who he claimed had found a girl for him to marry.
ny: Zolemba za khoti la Enticement Court zimasonyeza kuti Masambuka anakopeka ndi mchimwene wake kuti akakumane ndi anzake, amene iye ananena kuti anapeza mtsikana woti am'kwatire.

en: But when they reached the scene, the alleged friends grabbed Masambuka by the neck and dragged him to a garden where they killed him. Here, his assailants cut off his limbs, burned his body using petrol and buried it there.
ny: Koma atafika pamalowo, anthu amene ankati ndi anzakewo anagwira Masambuka pakhosi n'kumukokera kumunda wina kumene anamupha.

en: This was the first such case involving high-profile community members involved in attacks on persons with albinism.
ny: Imeneyi inali nkhani yoyamba ya mtundu umenewu yokhudza anthu otchuka a m'deralo amene anaukira anthu olumala.

en: Masauko Chamkakala, the lawyer for the 12 defendants in the case, said he would comment once he had gone through the judgment.
ny: Masauko Chamkakala, loya wa anthu 12 omwe akuimbidwa mlanduwo, ananena kuti adzalankhulapo pambuyo poona chigamulocho.

en: "We are still waiting to see the perfected judgment so that we can read it and study it and talk to our clients," Chamkakala said.
ny: "Tikudikirabe kuti tione chiweruzo chokwanira kuti tiwerenge ndi kuchiphunzira ndi kukambirana ndi makasitomala athu", anatero Chamkakala.

en: Rights activists said they expected the court to give stiffer punishment to those convicted.
ny: Anthu oteteza ufulu wa anthu ananena kuti akuyembekeza kuti khoti lidzapereka chilango cholimba kwa anthu amene avomerezedwa.

en: 'Serious sentencing'
ny: 'Kulangidwa koopsa'

en: Ian Simbota represented the Association of Persons with Albinism at the court.
ny: Ian Simbota anaimira bungwe la anthu olumala.

en: "When the judge was reading, what concerned me was that part of a [Priest] Father Muhosha [and others] who have been convicted of transacting body parts.
ny: "Pamene woweruza anali kuŵerenga, chimene chinandikhudza mtima chinali mbali ya Abambo Muhosha [ndi ena] amene anaweruzidwa kuti anali kugulitsa ziŵalo za thupi.

en: If you go to the Anatomy Act, it is not so hard on such offenses.
ny: Ngati mupita ku Anatomy Act, sikovuta kwambiri pa zolakwa zoterozo.

en: So, we are really looking forward to the judge, if at all its possible, to put a human face to the case so that at least we really need to see serious sentencing on this case," Simbota said.
ny: Choncho, tikuyembekezera kwambiri kuti woweruza, ngati n'kotheka, apereke nkhope yaumunthu pa mlanduwu kuti tione chilango choopsa pa mlanduwu", anatero Simbota.

en: The high court is expected to sentence the perpetrators on May 30.
ny: Khoti lalikulu likuyembekezeka kupereka chigamulo kwa olakwira pa May 30.

en: In another case, a high court on Thursday sentenced a 37-year-old man to life in prison for the 2020 murder of a 14-year-old-boy with albinism in Phalombe district.
ny: M'nkhani ina, khoti lalikulu Lachinayi linagamula kuti mwamuna wazaka 37 akhale m'ndende moyo wake wonse chifukwa cha kuphedwa kwa mnyamata wazaka 14 ndi matenda a albinism m'boma la Phalombe.

en: Zimbabwe Official Defends Crackdown on Protests, Urges Patience with Economy
ny: Mkulu wa Boma la Zimbabwe Akuteteza Kuletsa Zotsutsa, Akulimbikitsa Kuleza Mtima pa Zachuma

en: Zimbabwe's minister of foreign affairs and international trade on Monday defended crackdowns on anti-government demonstrations and urged patience in turning around the country's foundering economy.
ny: Nduna ya za kunja ndi malonda apadziko lonse la Zimbabwe Lolemba idateteza kupanikizika kwa ziwonetsero zotsutsana ndi boma ndipo idalimbikitsa kuleza mtima pakusintha chuma cha dzikolo.

en: Though "everybody's got the right to demonstrate," there have "been a lot of insinuations and campaigns of violence," Sibusiso B. Moyo told VOA in an interview. Citing public safety, he endorsed a Zimbabwe court's ruling hours earlier to uphold a police ban on a protest organized by the opposition Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) alliance.
ny: Ngakhale kuti "aliyense ali ndi ufulu wochita zionetsero", pakhala "kuchitidwa zinthu zambiri zosonyeza kuti anthu akuchitirana nkhanza", anatero Sibusiso B. Moyo ku VOA. Potchula za chitetezo cha anthu, iye anavomereza chigamulo cha khoti la Zimbabwe maola angapo m'mbuyomo kuti apitirize chiletso cha apolisi pa zionetsero zomwe zinakonzedwa ndi gulu lotsutsa la Movement for Democratic Change (MDC).

en: Alliance leaders are pressing President Emmerson Mnangagwa and the ruling ZANU-PF party for a role in a transitional government. They had organized a demonstration Monday in Bulawayo, the country's second-largest city, but police authorities banned it hours before its intended start. Two other opposition demonstrations still are planned this week: for the central city of Gweru on Tuesday and the southeastern city of Masvingo on Wednesday.
ny: Atsogoleri a mgwirizano akupanikizana ndi Purezidenti Emmerson Mnangagwa ndi chipani cholamulira cha ZANU-PF kuti akhale ndi udindo mu boma laposachedwa. Iwo adakonza chiwonetsero Lolemba ku Bulawayo, mzinda wachiwiri waukulu kwambiri mdzikolo, koma apolisi adaletsa maola asanayambe.

en: Police also had pre-emptively banned a demonstration in Harare last Friday, a decision upheld by a Zimbabwe court. Hundreds of MDC supporters ignored the ban, leading to clashes between civilians and police. Video and photographs showed police hitting and kicking some demonstrators among actions that drew complaints of excessive force from civil and human rights groups, including the United Nations human rights office.
ny: Apolisi anali ataletsa chiwonetsero ku Harare Lachisanu lapitali, chisankho chomwe chinatsimikiziridwa ndi khothi la Zimbabwe. Mazana a omvera a MDC ananyalanyaza chiletsocho, zomwe zidapangitsa kuti anthu wamba ndi apolisi agundane. Mavidiyo ndi zithunzi zikuwonetsa apolisi akumenya ndi kukankha ena mwa omwe akuwonetsa pakati pazochitika zomwe zidadzutsa madandaulo owonjezera mphamvu kuchokera kumagulu azamalamulo ndi ufulu waumunthu, kuphatikiza ofesi ya United Nations yoona za ufulu waumunthu.

en: Police, not demonstrators, showed up in force on Bulawayo streets Monday, with foot patrols wielding shields, batons and, in some cases, pistols. The Associated Press reported police trucks and water cannons positioned in the downtown area.
ny: Apolisi, osati anthu osonyeza zionetsero, anaonekera m'misewu ya Bulawayo Lolemba, ndi magulu oyenda pansi okhala ndi zikopa, ndodo ndipo, m'zochitika zina, mfuti. Associated Press inanena kuti magalimoto apolisi ndi zombo zamadzi anaikidwa m'dera la pakati pa mzinda.

en: A young man in Bulawayo, identifying himself only as James, told VOA that negotiations between the government and opposition leaders were even more important than demonstrations.
ny: Mnyamata wina ku Bulawayo, yemwe anadzizindikiritsa yekha kuti James, anauza VOA kuti zokambirana pakati pa boma ndi atsogoleri a chipani chotsutsa zinali zofunika kwambiri kuposa ziwonetsero.

en: "Honestly, to demonstrate, we can end up being hurt by being beaten, being chased around. There's really nothing that we see coming out of it," James said. "But these men should sit down and see what they can do for us, especially us, the youth. … We have been affected a lot, and we are getting old just running."
ny: "Mwachilungamo, kusonyeza, tingathe kumaliza kuvulazidwa ndi kumenyedwa, kuthamangitsidwa kuzungulira. Kwenikweni palibe chimene tikuwona kuti chikuchokera", anatero James. "Koma amuna awa ayenera kukhala pansi ndi kuwona zomwe angatichitire, makamaka ife, achinyamata.... Takhudzidwa kwambiri, ndipo tikukalamba mofulumira".

en: Moyo, the foreign minister, told VOA the administration is "undertaking economic reforms [that] are fundamental and they are key to ensuring that even the youth would finally have jobs created for them, so that we can create an environment where investors and the capital will find it easy to come into this country, where jobs will be created, and the youth will be part and parcel of economic activity."
ny: Moyo, nduna ya zamalonda akunja, anauza VOA kuti boma "likuchita kusintha kwa zachuma [zomwe] n'zofunika kwambiri ndipo n'zofunika kwambiri kuti ngakhale achinyamata apeze ntchito, kuti tikhale ndi malo amene ndalama ndi ndalama zingathe kubwera m'dziko lino, kumene ntchito zidzapangidwe, ndipo achinyamata adzakhala mbali ya ntchito zachuma".

en: Moyo said Zimbabwe is midway into a two-year "transition stabilization program" to revive the country's devastated economy: "We have got one year to go and we are saying we should by then be out of the doldrums."
ny: Moyo anati Zimbabwe ili pakati pa "pulogalamu ya zaka ziwiri yokhazikitsira chuma" kuti ichititse kuti chuma cha dzikolo chiyambenso kuyenda bwino: "Tili ndi chaka chimodzi chokha ndipo tikunena kuti tidzatha kuchoka m'mavuto".

en: The southern African country of nearly 16 million is experiencing its worst financial crisis since 2008, beset by hyperinflation and the fallout of decades of corruption. Many struggle to buy basics such as food and medicine. With the poor economy and crops devastated by drought and a spring cyclone, the UN World Food Program anticipates that 5.5 million people will need emergency food aid by next April.
ny: Dziko la kumwera kwa Africali lomwe lili ndi anthu pafupifupi 16 miliyoni likukumana ndi mavuto aakulu kwambiri a zachuma kuyambira mu 2008, chifukwa cha kukwera kwa ndalama kwambiri ndi ziphuphu zomwe zakhala zikuchitika kwa zaka zambiri. Ambiri akuvutika kugula zinthu zofunika monga chakudya ndi mankhwala.

en: Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube, who had predicted 3.1% growth for 2019, offered a sobering update to Zimbabwe's parliament in early August. "The revised 2019 GDP growth is expected to be negative," Reuters news service reported him as saying.
ny: Nduna ya zachuma Mthuli Ncube, yemwe ananeneratu za kukula kwa 3.1% mu 2019, anapereka ndemanga yolimbikitsa ku nyumba yamalamulo ya Zimbabwe kumayambiriro kwa mwezi wa August. "Kukula kwa GDP kwa 2019 kukuyembekezeka kukhala kosagwirizana", anatero a Reuters.

en: Ncube did not provide any updated figure.
ny: Ncube sananenepo za chiwerengero cha anthu amene anafa.

en: Civil Society Workers Run Afoul of Tanzania Security Officials in Sign of Increasing Clampdown
ny: Ogwira Ntchito za Civil Society Akuzunza Akuluakulu a Chitetezo ku Tanzania Monga Chizindikiro cha Kuwonjezeka kwa Kuponderezedwa

en: African civil society campaigners attending a conference in Tanzania were questioned and warned over the weekend, in what human rights activists say is part of a continuing clampdown on free speech in the East African nation.
ny: Anthu a ku Africa omwe akuchita nawo ntchito zachitukuko omwe analipo pamsonkhano ku Tanzania anafunsidwa ndi kuchenjezedwa kumapeto kwa sabata, zomwe omenyera ufulu wa anthu akuti ndi mbali ya kuletsa ufulu wa kulankhula m'dziko la East Africa.

en: Details are still emerging over what exactly happened to at least 40 civil society workers who ran afoul of security officials at this year's summit of the Southern African Development Community in Dar es Salaam.
ny: Mafotokozedwe akadalipo pa zomwe zinachitika kwa ogwira ntchito osachepera 40 omwe adathamangira kwa akuluakulu a chitetezo pamsonkhano wapachaka wa Southern African Development Community ku Dar es Salaam.

en: But rights experts said Monday that the episode is another worrying sign of heightened paranoia and harassment from the government.
ny: Koma akatswiri a za ufulu ananena Lolemba kuti nkhaniyo ndi chizindikiro china chodetsa nkhaŵa cha kukwera kwa maganizo ndi kuzunzidwa kwa boma.

en: Catherine Eden, a lawyer for the Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition, says the incident stemmed from a misunderstanding. South African delegates to the 15-nation conference, she said, wanted to hold a short commemoration of the seventh anniversary of South Africa's deadly Marikana mine massacre on Aug. 16. Thirty-four striking miners were killed by police in the deadliest security incident since the end of apartheid in 1994.
ny: Catherine Eden, loya wa Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition, akuti nkhaniyi idachokera pakusamvana. Oimira ku South Africa pamsonkhano wa mayiko 15, adati akufuna kukumbukira mwachidule chikumbutso cha zaka zisanu ndi ziwiri zakupha anthu ku South Africa ku Marikana pa Ogasiti 16. Anthu 34 omwe adachita ziwonetsero adaphedwa ndi apolisi mu ngozi yoopsa kwambiri yachitetezo kuyambira kutha kwa tsankho mu 1994.

en: So delegates at a side event sang the South African anthem, held a moment of silence and availed on their government to better protect its people. But something they wrote on a piece of paper convinced security police the delegates had bigger plans.
ny: Choncho nthumwi pa chochitika cha mbali zinaimba nyimbo ya dziko la South Africa, zinasunga mphindi ya chete ndi kugwiritsira ntchito boma lawo kuteteza anthu ake bwino.

en: "They wrote some messages on the flip charts, of which the little content that was captured in the flip charts read, 'Stop killing our people,'" she said. "... So I think there was a national security person in that meeting and he saw those messages and so he interpreted that as a plan to demonstrate. But if you look closely, you can't see any relationship as to why they would want to demonstrate for the Marikana shootings in Tanzania."
ny: "Iwo analemba mauthenga ena pa flip charts, zomwe zochepa zomwe zinagwidwa mu flip charts zinawerenga, 'Lekani kupha anthu athu,'" iye anati. "... Choncho ndikuganiza kuti panali munthu wa chitetezo cha dziko pamsonkhanowo ndipo adawona mauthengawo ndipo kotero iye anafotokoza kuti ndi ndondomeko yosonyeza. Koma ngati muyang'anitsitsa, simungawone mgwirizano uliwonse chifukwa chake iwo akufuna kusonyeza chifukwa cha kuwombera kwa Marikana ku Tanzania".

en: It's not clear if anyone was actually arrested. Other rights groups say that some foreign campaigners were arrested, but not interrogated.
ny: Sichidziwikire ngati wina aliyense anamangidwa. Magulu ena a ufulu wa anthu akunena kuti ena mwa anthu ochita ndawala akunja anamangidwa, koma sanafunsidwe.

en: 'Afraid, insecure'
ny: 'Wowopa, wosadalirika'

en: Eden says she was summoned by authorities as she went to the police station Friday night to meet with a local coordinator and then was let go with a warning. Police later went to delegates' hotel rooms looking for materials that they thought were a security threat. They found nothing, she said.
ny: Eden akuti adaitanidwa ndi akuluakulu apolisi pamene adapita ku polisi Lachisanu usiku kukakumana ndi wogwirizanitsa malo ndipo kenako adachotsedwa ndi chenjezo.

en: Janet Zhou, director of the Zimbabwe Coalition on Debt and Development, was one of the campaigners questioned by security forces at her hotel.
ny: Janet Zhou, mkulu wa bungwe la Zimbabwe Coalition on Debt and Development, anali mmodzi wa anthu amene anafunsidwa mafunso ndi asilikali a chitetezo ku hotelo yake.

en: "I was afraid, I was insecure, I was traumatized to say the least," she told VOA, after returning home to Harare. "Because seven security details coming over after midnight and questioning me about a demonstration and placards that I wasn't going to be able to give them, was something else. I didn't understand it. It left me really terrified."
ny: "Ndinali ndi mantha, ndinali wosatetezeka, ndinali ndi chisoni kunena pang'ono", iye anauza VOA, atabwerera kunyumba ku Harare. "Chifukwa chakuti apolisi asanu ndi awiri a chitetezo anabwera pambuyo pa usiku ndi kundifunsa za chionetsero ndi zikwangwani zomwe sindikanatha kuwapatsa, zinali chinachake. Sindinamvetsetse. Zinandisiya ndikuwopa kwambiri".

en: She said police then told her — and her 40-person delegation — to remain in their hotel all day Saturday. She asked them if they were under arrest, to which they did not reply.
ny: Iye anati apolisi anamuuza iye ndi nthumwi yake ya anthu 40 kuti akhalebe mu hotelo yawo tsiku lonse Loweruka.

en: 'Perfectly valid'
ny: "Zili bwino kwambiri"

en: Oryem Nyeko, a Kampala-based researcher for Human Rights Watch, noted that Tanzanian police didn't do anything technically illegal. But, he said, that doesn't make it right, either.
ny: Oryem Nyeko, wofufuza wa bungwe la Human Rights Watch ku Kampala, ananena kuti apolisi a ku Tanzania sanachite chilichonse chosaloledwa ndi malamulo koma, iye anati, zimenezo sizikutanthauza kuti n'chabwino.

en: "I think it's a perfectly valid thing for police to do," he said. "However, the challenge with that is that it speaks to a wider problem in Tanzania as far as a closing civic space and the opportunities that people in civic society have to freely express themselves. This is part of a wider pattern of civic repression in the country."
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti ndi chinthu choyenera kwambiri kuti apolisi achite", adatero. "Komabe, vuto ndi kuti limalankhula ndi vuto lalikulu ku Tanzania monga malo otsekedwa a anthu ndi mwayi womwe anthu ammudzi ali nawo kuti adziwonetse okha momasuka. Izi ndi gawo la njira yayikulu yozunza anthu mdzikolo".

en: International groups like the Committee to Protect Journalists have also warned of increased repression. Ahead of the SADC summit, the watchdog group noted its concerns about a "deeply troubling erosion of press freedom," and of "attacks on individual journalists, media suspensions, internet shutdowns, and restrictive legislation."
ny: Magulu apadziko lonse monga Committee to Protect Journalists nawonso achenjeza za kuwonjezeka kwa kuponderezana. Pamaso pa msonkhano wa SADC, gulu loyang'anira linasonyeza nkhawa zake za "kuwonongeka kwakukulu kwa ufulu wa atolankhani", ndi "kuukira kwa atolankhani, kuimitsidwa kwa atolankhani, kutsekedwa kwa intaneti, ndi malamulo oletsa".

en: The CPJ made special mention of Tanzanian journalists Azory Gwanda, who has been missing since 2017, and Erick Kabendera, who was arrested last month and charged with economic crimes, which the organization says is in retaliation for his critical journalism.
ny: CPJ inatchula mwapadera atolankhani a ku Tanzania Azory Gwanda, amene wasowa kuyambira 2017, ndi Erick Kabendera, amene anamangidwa mwezi watha ndi kuimbidwa mlandu wa upandu wachuma, umene bungwe limanena kuti ndi kubwezera chifukwa cha ntchito yake yolemba nkhani.

en: Kabendera remains behind bars. On Monday, Eden, his lawyer, said the court decided to adjourn to give prosecutors more time to investigate. That will keep him in jail for more than a week longer, until Aug. 30.
ny: Kabendera akadali m'ndende. Lolemba, Eden, loya wake, anati khoti linaganiza zochotsa mlanduwo kuti lipatse oweruza nthawi yochulukirapo yofufuza. Izi zidzamupangitsa kukhala m'ndende kwa nthawi yoposa sabata limodzi, mpaka Ogasiti 30.

en: 'Worrying trend'
ny: "Kukonda Kukhumudwitsa"

en: Anna Henga, director of the Legal and Human Rights Center, said police actions only further a worrying trend in Tanzania under President John Magafuli, whom critics say is becoming increasingly authoritarian.
ny: Anna Henga, mkulu wa bungwe loona za ufulu wa anthu ndi malamulo, anati zimene apolisi akuchita zikungowonjezera vuto la boma la Tanzania pansi pa ulamuliro wa pulezidenti John Magafuli, yemwe anthu ena amanena kuti akupitirizabe kukhala ndi ulamuliro.

en: "This means the continuation of a limited civic space. Because this has happened since 2016. There are a lot of issues, there is a negative development toward limited civic space. And it is targeted to people like civil society organizations, the media, hindering the freedom of speech, the freedom of association."
ny: "Izi zikutanthauza kupitiriza kwa malo ocheperako a anthu. Chifukwa izi zachitika kuyambira 2016. Pali nkhani zambiri, pali kusintha koipa kwa malo ocheperako a anthu. Ndipo zimayang'ana anthu monga mabungwe a anthu, atolankhani, kulepheretsa ufulu wa kulankhula, ufulu wa kusonkhana".

en: Few Demonstrators Turn Up for Zimbabwe Protest in Bulawayo
ny: Anthu Ochepa Anafika ku Zimbabwe Kuchita Chionetsero ku Bulawayo

en: Few people have turned up for an opposition protest in Bulawayo, Zimbabwe's second city, on Monday as armed police maintained heavy presence on the streets and at a courthouse where the opposition is pressing to be allowed to hold the demonstration.
ny: Anthu ochepa okha ndi amene anafika ku chionetsero cha a chipani chotsutsa ku Bulawayo, mzinda wachiwiri wa Zimbabwe, Lolemba, pamene apolisi okhala ndi zida analipo m'misewu ndi ku khoti kumene atsutsawo akuumiriza kuti alole kuchitidwa kwa chionetserocho.

en: Business in Bulawayo's usually bustling downtown was subdued with the most traffic from police trucks, water cannons and dozens of police officers patrolling on foot.
ny: Bizinesi m'dera la Bulawayo lomwe nthaŵi zambiri limakhala lotanganidwa kwambiri inali yochepa chifukwa cha magalimoto a apolisi, mabomba amadzi ndi apolisi ambirimbiri oyenda pansi.

en: The opposition party, the Movement for Democratic Change, had called the protest as part of a planned series of demonstrations to push President Emmerson Mnangagwa to agree to a transitional government amid a rapidly deteriorating economy and rising political tensions.
ny: Chipani chotsutsa, Movement for Democratic Change, chinatcha zionetserozo kukhala mbali ya ziwonetsero zomwe zinakonzedwa kuti zikakamize Purezidenti Emmerson Mnangagwa kuti avomereze boma la kusintha pakati pa chuma chomwe chikuwonongeka mofulumira ndi kuwonjezeka kwa mikangano yandale.

en: But the police banned the protest in the southern city, citing security concerns. A Bulawayo magistrate is hearing the opposition party's challenge to the ban.
ny: Koma apolisi analetsa zionetserozo mumzinda wakumwera, potchula za chitetezo.

en: The protest was planned as a follow up to demonstrations held in the capital, Harare, on Friday when several hundred demonstrators marched in defiance of a police ban that was upheld by the High Court. Police used tear gas and beatings with batons to quell the Harare protest.
ny: Chiwonetserochi chinakonzedwa ngati chotsatira cha ziwonetsero zomwe zinachitika ku likulu la dziko, Harare, Lachisanu pamene anthu mazana angapo anaonekera pochita chiwonetsero mosatsatira lamulo la apolisi lomwe linatsimikiziridwa ndi Khoti Lalikulu. Apolisi anagwiritsa ntchito mpweya wa misozi ndi kumenyedwa ndi nkhonya kuti athetse zionetsero za Harare.

en: Zimbabweans Claim Police Brutality During Economic Protests
ny: Anthu a ku Zimbabwe Akuti Apolisi Anawachitira Nkhanza pa Zokambirana za Ndale

en: Zimbabweans defied a police ban Friday and held demonstrations to protest the country's deteriorating economy.
ny: Anthu a ku Zimbabwe anaphwanya lamulo la apolisi Lachisanu ndipo anachita ziwonetsero zotsutsa kuwonongeka kwa chuma cha dzikolo.

en: Despite the High Court ban on planned protests, members of the Movement for Democratic Change took to the streets and clashed with police. Some of the injured accused police of derailing protests, which they said were meant to persuade President Emmerson Mnangagwa's government to breathe life into Zimbabwe's moribund economy.
ny: Ngakhale kuti khoti lalikulu linaletsa kuti anthu asamachite zionetsero, anthu a gulu la Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) analowa m'misewu n'kumenyana ndi apolisi. Ena mwa anthu ovulalawo anadzudzula apolisi kuti ndi amene anachititsa kuti anthu asamachite zionetserozo, zomwe iwo anati zinali zokopa boma la pulezidenti Emmerson Mnangagwa kuti liyambitse chuma cha dziko la Zimbabwe.

en: With tears on her cheeks, 32-year-old Tafadzwa Bvuta said her degree had not helped her get anything for her three children.
ny: Ndi misozi m'mapewa, Tafadzwa Bvuta wazaka 32 anati digiri yake sinamuthandize kupeza chilichonse cha ana ake atatu.

en: "They beat us up," she said of the police. "What have we done? All these security forces are supposed to protect us all — not just one person. Where will we go and survive? Shall we kill our kids since we are struggling to take care of them?"
ny: "Anatimenya", iye anatero ponena za apolisi. "Kodi tachita chiyani? Magulu onse a chitetezo ameneŵa ayenera kutiteteza tonse  osati munthu mmodzi yekha. Kodi tipita kuti kuti tipulumuke? Kodi tipha ana athu popeza tikuvutika kuwasamalira?"

en: Make Nyashanu, 27, said he would continue protesting because he is miserable about being unemployed.
ny: Make Nyashanu, wazaka 27, ananena kuti apitirizabe kuchita zionetsero chifukwa chakuti akumva chisoni chifukwa cha kusowa kwake ntchito.

en: He said police were indiscriminately beating demonstrators — even elderly ones and people not protesting. "Is this democracy?" he asked, adding that it was a peaceful demonstration but police were causing chaos.
ny: Iye anati apolisi anali kumenya mosasankha anthu omwe anali kuchita zionetsero  ngakhale okalamba ndi anthu amene sanali kuchita zionetsero. "Kodi ndi demokalase?" anafunsa motero, ndipo anawonjezera kuti kunali chionetsero chamtendere koma apolisi anali kuyambitsa chisokonezo.

en: The opposition said it will hold another protest Monday in Zimbabwe's second largest city, Bulawayo, and will go to other cities and places until the government addresses the economy.
ny: Atsogoleri a chipani chotsutsa ananena kuti adzachita zionetsero zina Lolemba mumzinda wachiwiri waukulu kwambiri ku Zimbabwe, Bulawayo, ndipo adzapita kumizinda ina ndi malo ena mpaka boma litathetsa mavuto azachuma.

en: Government response
ny: Zimene boma linayankha

en: Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa called the protests counterproductive, saying January's demonstrations against fuel price increases resulted in $20 million to $30 million in losses for businesses from looting and non-productive days.
ny: Nduna ya za chidziwitso Monica Mutsvangwa anatcha zionetserozo kuti ndi zotsutsana, ponena kuti zionetsero za mu January zotsutsana ndi kukwera kwa mtengo wa mafuta zinapangitsa kuti mabizinesi awonongeke ndalama zokwana $20 miliyoni mpaka $30 miliyoni chifukwa cha kuba ndi masiku opanda phindu.

en: "Government calls on all progressive Zimbabweans to desist from being used by negative forces to destabilize their own country, as this will only prolong the hardships which the government is tirelessly trying to address in a more sustainable manner," she said. "I wish to reiterate the call by His Excellency Comrade ED Mnangagwa for all patriotic Zimbabweans to resort to dialogue as a means to solve the challenges we face as a nation."
ny: "Boma likuitana anthu onse opita patsogolo a ku Zimbabwe kuti asiye kugwiritsidwa ntchito ndi mphamvu zoipa kuti zisokoneze dziko lawo, chifukwa izi zidzangowonjezera mavuto omwe boma likuyesetsa kuthana nawo mosasunthika", iye anati. "Ndikufuna kubwereza pempho la Mkulu Wampingo ED Mnangagwa kwa anthu onse okonda dziko lawo kuti ayambe kukambirana ngati njira yothetsera mavuto omwe tikukumana nawo monga mtundu".

en: Daniel Molokhele, the spokesman for the opposition, said his party was against Mnangagwa leading talks and accused him of stealing Zimbabwe's last election in 2018. He said the protests would continue until Zimbabwe's economy gets back on track.
ny: Daniel Molokhele, mneneri wa chipani chotsutsa, adati chipani chake sichikufuna kuti Mnangagwa azitsogolera zokambirana ndipo adamuneneza kuti adabera zisankho zomaliza ku Zimbabwe mu 2018.

en: UN Condemns Government Crackdown on Peaceful Protests in Zimbabwe
ny: UN Idzudzula Boma Chifukwa Chopondereza Anthu Ochita Zopanda Mtendere ku Zimbabwe

en: The U.N. human rights office is condemning a crackdown Friday in Zimbabwe by riot police on peaceful protesters in the capital, Harare. The agency is calling for an investigation into excessive use of force by security forces.
ny: Ofesi ya United Nations yoona za ufulu wa anthu ikudzudzula kuphwanya kwa apolisi a m'dziko la Zimbabwe pa anthu amene akuchita zionetsero mwamtendere ku likulu la dzikoli, Harare.

en: U.N. Human Rights spokesman Rupert Colville says there are better ways to deal with the populations legitimate grievances on the economic situation in the country than by cracking down on peaceful protestors.
ny: Mneneri wa bungwe la United Nations woimira ufulu wa anthu Rupert Colville akuti pali njira zabwino zothetsera madandaulo a anthu pa nkhani ya chuma m'dzikoli kusiyana ndi kupondereza anthu amene akuchita zionetsero mwamtendere.

en: "We are deeply concerned by the socio-economic crisis that continues to unfold in Zimbabwe. While acknowledging efforts made by the government, the international community and the U.N. in Zimbabwe to mitigate the effects of the crisis and reform process, the dire economic situation is now impacting negatively on the realization of economic and social rights of millions of Zimbabweans," Colville said.
ny: "Tikuda nkhawa kwambiri ndi mavuto azachuma omwe akupitilizabe ku Zimbabwe. Ngakhale tikuvomereza kuyesetsa kwa boma, gulu la mayiko ndi UN ku Zimbabwe kuti achepetse zovuta za mavuto ndi kusintha, mavuto azachuma tsopano akukhudza kwambiri kukwaniritsidwa kwa ufulu wachuma ndi chikhalidwe cha anthu mamiliyoni ambiri ku Zimbabwe, "atero a Colville.

en: Zimbabwes citizens are struggling with hyperinflation, which has sent prices soaring for essential commodities such as fuel, food, transportation and health care. Compounding the problems is the ongoing impact of cyclone Idai that hit Zimbabwe in March and a severe drought.
ny: Anthu a ku Zimbabwe akuvutika ndi kuchepa kwa ndalama, komwe kwachititsa kuti mitengo ya zinthu zofunika monga mafuta, chakudya, mayendedwe ndi chithandizo chaumoyo ikwere kwambiri. Mavuto ena akuwonjezeka chifukwa cha mphepo yamkuntho Idai yomwe inagunda dziko la Zimbabwe mu March komanso chilala chachikulu.

en: The United Nations says one third of Zimbabwes population of 16 million people is in need of humanitarian aid.
ny: United Nations ikunena kuti gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a anthu 16 miliyoni a ku Zimbabwe akufunikira thandizo laumunthu.

en: The fallout in terms of casualties and possible arrests from Fridays protests is not yet clear. But Colville tells VOA his office has received disturbing reports of human rights violations over the past few months.
ny: Zotsatira za kuphedwa ndi kumangidwa kwa anthu pa zionetsero za Lachisanu sizidziwikabe, koma Colville akuuza VOA kuti ofesi yake yalandira malipoti okhumudwitsa a kuphwanya ufulu wa anthu m'miyezi ingapo yapitayi.

en: "There are, as I said, reports coming through right now of very recent abductions, beatings and so on of activists or human rights defenders. We have not had a chance to verify those and look in detail apart from the two that occurred a few days ago," Colville said. "So, it is clearly a very tense situation."
ny: "Pali, monga ndanenera, malipoti akubwera kudzera pompano a posachedwapa abductions, kumenya ndi zina zotero za omenyera ufulu wa anthu kapena oteteza ufulu wa anthu. sitinakhale ndi mwayi wotsimikizira izi ndikuyang'ana mwatsatanetsatane kupatula awiri omwe adachitika masiku angapo apitawa", Colville anati. "Chifukwa chake, zikuwonekeratu kuti ndizovuta kwambiri".

en: Colville says state authorities have a duty to ensure peoples rights to freedom of expression and to protect the right to peaceful assembly.
ny: Colville akuti maulamuliro a boma ali ndi udindo woteteza ufulu wa anthu woyankhula mwaufulu ndi kuteteza ufulu wosonkhana mwamtendere.

en: The U.N. human rights office is urging the government to engage in a national dialogue to ensure that civil society in all its guises can carry out its activities without fear of intimidation or reprisals for its work.
ny: Ofesi ya United Nations yoona za ufulu wa anthu ikulimbikitsa boma kuti liyambitse kukambirana kwa dziko lonse kuti likhale ndi ufulu wochita zinthu ndi anthu onse osaopa kuti anthuwo adzawaopseza kapena kuwabwezera.

en: Despite Oil and Gas Reserves, Africa Feels Pressure of Rising Energy Costs
ny: Ngakhale Kuti Africa Ili ndi Mafuta ndi Gasi, Akuvutika Chifukwa cha Kukwera kwa Ndalama Zogwiritsa Ntchito Mphamvu

en: Africans are feeling the pinch caused by soaring global energy prices, say analysts, even in countries like Nigeria and Angola that are major exporters of crude oil.
ny: Akatswiri ena amati, anthu a ku Africa akuvutika chifukwa cha kukwera kwamphamvu kwa mitengo ya mafuta padziko lonse, ngakhale m'mayiko monga Nigeria ndi Angola, omwe ndi mayiko akuluakulu amene amatumiza mafuta.

en: While that handful of oil producers is seeing an increase in revenue – especially since the Russian invasion of Ukraine on February 24 – much of the continent lacks refining capability, forcing countries to pay high prices to import gasoline and other petroleum products from Asia and Europe.
ny: Ngakhale kuti anthu ochepa amene amapanga mafutawa akupeza ndalama zambiri  makamaka chifukwa cha kuukira kwa Russia ku Ukraine pa February 24  madera ambiri a ku Africa kulibe mphamvu zopangira mafuta, ndipo zimenezi zikukakamiza mayiko kulipira ndalama zambiri kuti atenge mafuta ndi zinthu zina za mafuta kuchokera ku Asia ndi ku Ulaya.

en: The continent is further affected by increasing costs for natural gas, a key component of nitrogen-based fertilizers used in food production.
ny: Makontinenti akuvutikanso ndi kukwera kwa mtengo wa gasi wachilengedwe, womwe ndi gawo lofunikira la feteleza opangidwa ndi nayitrogeni omwe amagwiritsidwa ntchito popanga chakudya.

en: With salaries largely stagnant, more than two-thirds of Africans feel pressured by the rising prices, said Franklin Cudjoe, founding president of the Ghana-based Imani Center for Policy and Education.
ny: Franklin Cudjoe, pulezidenti woyambitsa wa Imani Center for Policy and Education, wokhala ku Ghana, anati, popeza malipiro ali osagwirizana, anthu oposa awiri mwa atatu mwa anthu a ku Africa amamva kuti akupanikizika chifukwa cha kukwera kwa mitengo ya zinthu.

en: "The continent is affected simply because we depend largely on global oil suppliers, since not many African countries have [their own] oil products," Cudjoe told VOA.
ny: Cudjoe anauza VOA kuti: "Dzikoli likukhudzidwa chifukwa chakuti timadalira kwambiri anthu amene amapereka mafuta padziko lonse, chifukwa mayiko ambiri a ku Africa alibe mafuta awoawo".

en: Prices spiked on the global oil market after the invasion of Ukraine triggered a wave of international sanctions against Russia, one of the worlds leading exporters of crude. The price briefly climbed to over $120 per barrel this month before settling down to $103 per barrel on Friday.
ny: Mitengo ya mafuta inakula kwambiri pamsika wa mafuta padziko lonse pambuyo pa kuukira kwa Ukraine komwe kunayambitsa chiwopsezo cha mayiko onse pa Russia, imodzi mwa mayiko oyendetsa katundu wambiri padziko lonse lapansi. Mtengowo unakwera kwa kanthawi ku $ 120 pa mbiya mwezi uno usanafike pa $ 103 pa mbiya Lachisanu.

en: The surge in energy prices is helping to fuel inflation across Africa. In Ghana, for example, overall consumer price inflation was pegged at 15.7% year-on-year in February compared with 13.9% in January, the countrys Statistical Service said last week.
ny: Kuwonjezeka kwa mitengo ya magetsi kukuthandiza kulimbikitsa kukwera kwa ndalama ku Africa. Mwachitsanzo, ku Ghana, kukwera kwa mitengo ya ogula kunayerekezeredwa ndi 15.7% pachaka mu February poyerekeza ndi 13.9% mu January, adatero Statistical Service ya dzikolo sabata yatha.

en: In Zimbabwe, prices are climbing sharply – even overnight. At a TM supermarket in the capital of Harare, a crate of 30 eggs cost the $6.70 on Tuesday and about $7.81 on Wednesday. The price of a loaf of bread went from $1.49 to $1.84; for a kilo of beef, the price jumped from $3.35 to $5.22.
ny: Ku Zimbabwe, mitengo ikukwera kwambiri  ngakhale usiku umodzi wokha. Ku sitolo ina yaikulu ya TM ku likulu la dziko la Harare, bokosi la mazira 30 linagula madola 6.70 Lachiwiri ndipo pafupifupi madola 7.81 Lachitatu. Mtengo wa mkate unakwera kuchoka pa madola 1.49 kufika pa madola 1.84; mtengo wa kilogalamu ya ng'ombe unakwera kuchoka pa madola 3.35 kufika pa madola 5.22.

en: Gasoline costs climbed, too. In Harare, the per-liter price climbed from $1.41 to $1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.
ny: Mtengo wa mafuta unakwera, ku Harare, mtengo wa lita imodzi unakwera kuchoka pa $1.41 kufika pa $1.69 kuyambira Lachiwiri mpaka Lachitatu.

en: The surge in food prices was the biggest driver behind consumer inflation in Egypt, it rose by 8.8% in February – the sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.
ny: Kuwonjezeka kwa mitengo ya zakudya kunali chinthu chachikulu kwambiri chochititsa kuti anthu azigula ndalama zambiri ku Egypt, ndipo chinawonjezeka ndi 8.8% mu February  kuwonjezeka kwakukulu m'zaka pafupifupi zitatu, malinga ndi bungwe la boma la ziwerengero, CAPMAS.

en: Cudjoe said it was crucial for governments and regional bodies such as the African Union to build defenses to cushion consumers in times of economic uncertainty.
ny: Cudjoe anati n'kofunika kwambiri kuti maboma ndi mabungwe a m'madera monga African Union apange njira zotetezera ogula m'nthaŵi ya kusatsimikizika kwa zachuma.

en: "Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food," said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."
ny: "Ngakhale ngati zimenezi zitanthauza kumanga chitetezo cha chakudya", anatero Cudjoe, ndipo anawonjezera kuti, "Ndikuganiza kuti Nigeria, ngati ikanakhala ndi njira yake, ikanatha kugulitsa zakudya ku mayiko ambiri pamtengo wotsika tsopano".

en: "There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least to prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world."
ny: "Pafunika kukhala kufunika kofuna kudzipangira chitetezo, ndalama zimene zingatithandize kuti tikhale ndi moyo - osachepera kuti tipeŵe kuwonongedwa kotheratu ndi kusatsimikizika kwa zinthu m'dzikoli".

en: Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be "the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.
ny: Chibamba Kanyama, katswiri wa zachuma ku likulu la Zambia la Lusaka, anati kuimitsa misonkho ya mafuta ndi "chinthu chabwino kwambiri kuchita panopa" kuti athandize ogula ndi makampani.

en: "African governments must find a way of responding," he said. 'It is a choice of whether to reduce taxes to lower the prices or to maintain the price levels and use the revenues to subsidize the most vulnerable in society."
ny: Iye anati: "Maboma a ku Africa ayenera kupeza njira yochitira zinthu. Iwo ayenera kusankha pakati pa kuchepetsa misonkho kuti mitengo ikhale yotsika kapena kusunga mitengoyo ndipo ndalama zimene apezazo azigwiritsa ntchito popereka ndalama kwa anthu osauka kwambiri".

en: But Kanyama also suggested that the geopolitical crisis involving Russia and Ukraine – both big grain exporters to Africa – may create opportunities for African producers.
ny: Koma Kanyama ananenanso kuti mavuto a zandale amene akuchitika pakati pa Russia ndi Ukraine  onsewo ndi omwe amatumiza kwambiri mbewu ku Africa  angapangitse kuti alimi a ku Africa akhale ndi mwayi.

en: "Supply countries like South Africa, with robust and highly mechanized systems, may find a window of exporting [commodities] like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine," Kanyama said.
ny: "Mayiko operekera monga South Africa, okhala ndi machitidwe olimba ndi opangidwa ndi makina kwambiri, angapeze mpata wotumiza kunja [zinthu] monga tirigu ndi zinthu zina kuti akwaniritse zosowa zomwe Russia ndi Ukraine zasiya", anatero Kanyama.

en: Kanyama also said support by the international community – for instance, in the form of debt relief for some African nations – is welcome.
ny: Kanyama ananenanso kuti thandizo la mayiko  mwachitsanzo, m'njira yothandizira mayiko ena a ku Africa kuti asamalire ngongole  ndi labwino.

en: He noted that the Group of 20 – which encompasses seven industrialized nations, some countries with strong or fast-growing economies, and the European Union – "is trying to offer some debt relief."
ny: Iye anafotokoza kuti gulu la 20 lomwe limaphatikizapo mayiko asanu ndi aŵiri otukuka, mayiko ena omwe ali ndi chuma champhamvu kapena chomwe chikukula mofulumira, ndi European Union "akuyesetsa kupereka njira zothetsera ngongole".

en: "Some other countries, such as Zambia, [are] undergoing debt restructuring processes and an IMF program, and to me, this is the only way out of the crisis," Kanyama added.
ny: "Mayiko ena, monga Zambia, [ali] m'kati mwa njira zobwezeretsa ngongole ndi pulogalamu ya IMF, ndipo kwa ine, iyi ndiyo njira yokhayo yotulukira m'vuto", anawonjezera Kanyama.

en: This story originated in VOA's English-to-Africa service, with contributions from the Zimbabwe service.
ny: Nkhaniyi inayamba mu pulogalamu ya VOA ya Chingelezi-to-Africa, ndi zopereka zochokera ku pulogalamu ya Zimbabwe.

en: WHO Says Africa's COVID Vaccinations Rose by 15% in February
ny: WHO Inati Katemera wa COVID ku Africa Anakula ndi 15% mu February

en: The World Health Organization says Africas COVID-19 vaccinations rose by 15% between January and February, as several countries embarked on mass inoculation drives to expand coverage and protect populations from the pandemic.
ny: Bungwe la World Health Organization linanena kuti katemera wa COVID-19 ku Africa anakwera ndi 15% pakati pa January ndi February, pamene mayiko angapo anayamba katemera wambiri kuti athandize anthu ambiri komanso kuteteza anthu ku mliriwu.

en: Zimbabwes government says it is launching a "national vaccination blitz" targeting those who have not yet been vaccinated in a country where resistance to the shots has been an issue since the program started last year. The drive come amid government concern over rising COVID-19 cases.  Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, WHO regional director for Africa, said in a statement that the increase in COVID-19 vaccinations on the continent was driven mainly by campaigns in populous countries, including the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Nigeria.

en: Dr. Thierno Balde, the WHO Africa regional COVID-19 incident manager, he says the continent must remain vigilant.
ny: Dr. Thierno Balde, woyang'anira zochitika za COVID-19 ku Africa wa WHO, akuti kontinenti iyenera kukhalabe tcheru.

en: "We have seen what is happening around, in China, and the risk of also having new imitations, new variants still possible. We really need to continue to safeguard our population by taking the vaccine by not relaxing totally. The situation might change. So we really need to continue adapting some of these social measures and also to get vaccination," Balde said.
ny: "Taona zomwe zikuchitika kuzungulira, ku China, komanso chiopsezo chokhala ndi mitundu yatsopano, mitundu yatsopano yomwe ikadalipo. Tiyenera kupitiliza kuteteza anthu athu potenga katemera osamasuka kwathunthu. Zinthu zitha kusintha. Chifukwa chake tikufunika kupitiliza kusintha njira zina zachitukuko komanso kuti tilandire katemera, "atero a Balde.

en: The WHO said to boost African COVID-19 vaccine acceptance, it and other organizations were supporting mass vaccination drives in at least 10 priority countries to reach 100 million people by the end of next month.
ny: Bungwe la WHO linanena kuti pofuna kulimbikitsa katemera wa COVID-19 ku Africa, bungwe limeneli ndi mabungwe ena anali kuthandiza ntchito yochotsa katemera wambiri m'mayiko osachepera 10 omwe ali ndi mwayi woti anthu 100 miliyoni adzapatsidwe katemera pofika kumapeto kwa mwezi wamawa.

en: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, Zimbabwes acting information minister, said his country would not be left behind.
ny: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, nduna yoyang'anira ntchito ya zidziwitso ku Zimbabwe, anati dziko lake silidzasiyidwa.

en: "Regarding the vaccination program, as of 15 March, 2022, a total of 159,628 third doses have been administered to date. The national vaccination blitz campaign will kick off on Monday, 21 March, 2022, and [the] government is urging those that have not yet been vaccinated to take advantage of this exercise to do so," Ndlovu said.
ny: "Pankhani ya katemera, kuyambira pa 15 March, 2022, katemera wachitatu okwana 159,628 aperekedwa mpaka pano. Ntchito ya katemera wa dziko lonse iyamba Lolemba, 21 March, 2022, ndipo boma likulimbikitsa anthu omwe sanalandire katemera kuti apindule ndi ntchitoyi", adatero Ndlovu.

en: A number of Zimbabweans have refused vaccination, saying they do not trust the mainly donated Chinese-made Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines. The country has lately recorded a rise in new infections – now cumulatively at 244,012 with 5,418 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins University, which is tracking the global outbreak.
ny: Anthu ambiri a ku Zimbabwe anakana katemera, ponena kuti sakhulupirira katemera wa Sinopharm ndi Sinovac wopangidwa ndi China. Dzikoli posachedwapa lalemba kuchuluka kwa matenda atsopano  tsopano ndi 244,012 ndi 5,418 akufa, malinga ndi Johns Hopkins University, yomwe ikutsata kufalikira kwa padziko lonse.

en: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete, president of Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, attributes that to the recent lifting of restrictive measures, such as lockdowns. He says, however, it is not time to panic, just to enforce WHO protocols, such masking and social distancing.
ny: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete, pulezidenti wa Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, akunena kuti izi ndi chifukwa cha kuchotsedwa kwa njira zoletsa, monga kutsekedwa. Komabe, akuti, si nthawi yoti anthu azichita mantha, koma kungokhazikitsa malamulo a WHO, monga kuvala chigoba ndi kukhala patali.

en: "After relaxing measures, it is expected that cases will slightly go up. But I also think that it is too early to make any meaningful conclusions, I think it is just an opportunity for us to strengthen our preventative measures and continue highlighting to the rest of the population that COVID is still with us. The good news, though, is that severe cases have not gone up. What we need to do is to continue to get vaccinated and what is important is that the government should – as it is doing – is monitor these numbers. There is no cause for alarm or cause for us to introduce new measures," Chimbetete said.
ny: "Pambuyo pa kuchepetsa njira, zikuyembekezeka kuti milandu idzawonjezeka pang'ono. Koma ndikuganiza kuti ndizachangu kwambiri kuti tipeze malingaliro aliwonse, ndikuganiza kuti ndi mwayi woti tilimbikitse njira zathu zopewera ndikupitilizabe kuwunikira anthu ena kuti COVID akadali nafe. Nkhani yabwino, komabe, ndikuti milandu yoopsa sinapite patsogolo. Zomwe tiyenera kuchita ndikupitiliza kulandira katemera ndipo chofunikira ndikuti boma  monga likuchitira  likuyang'anira manambala awa. Palibe chifukwa chodandaula kapena chifukwa choti tiyambitse njira zatsopano, "atero Chimbetete.

en: Zimbabwe had a target of vaccinating at least 10 million people by the end of last year, a figure that some say was difficult to reach given the scarcity of resources and hesitance. It has yet to announce when it plans to achieve herd immunity.
ny: Zimbabwe inali ndi cholinga chofuna katemera anthu osachepera 10 miliyoni kumapeto kwa chaka chatha, chiwerengero chimene ena amati chinali chovuta kukwaniritsa chifukwa cha kusowa kwa chuma ndi kukayikira.

en: Finland Crowned World's Happiest Nation for Fifth Year
ny: Dziko la Finland Lakhala Dziko Losangalala Kwambiri Padziko Lonse Lapansi kwa Chaka Chachisanu

en: Finland has been named the world's happiest country for the fifth year running, in an annual U.N.-sponsored index that again ranked Afghanistan as the unhappiest, followed closely by Lebanon.
ny: Dziko la Finland lasankhidwa kukhala dziko losangalala kwambiri padziko lonse kwa chaka chachisanu chotsatira, m'chiŵerengero chapachaka choperekedwa ndi bungwe la United Nations chimene chinasonyezanso kuti dziko la Afghanistan ndilo linali losauka kwambiri, ndipo dziko la Lebanon linali pambuyo pake.

en: Serbia, Bulgaria and Romania recorded the biggest boosts in wellbeing. The largest falls in the World Happiness table, released on Friday, came in Lebanon, Venezuela and Afghanistan.
ny: Dziko la Serbia, Bulgaria ndi Romania ndi limene linapeza anthu ambiri osangalala, ndipo dziko la Lebanon, Venezuela ndi Afghanistan ndi limene linapeza anthu ambiri osangalala.

en: Lebanon, which is facing economic meltdown, fell to second from last on the index of 146 nations, just below Zimbabwe.
ny: Dziko la Lebanon, limene likuvutika ndi mavuto a zachuma, linatsika kuchoka pa malo otsiriza kufika pa malo achiŵiri pa maiko 146 omwe ali m'gululi, ndipo linangotsala pang'ono kufika pa dziko la Zimbabwe.

en: War-traumatized Afghanistan, already bottom of the table, has seen its humanitarian crisis deepen since the Taliban took power again last August.  U.N. agency UNICEF estimates one million children under five could die of hunger this winter if not aided.
ny: Dziko la Afghanistan, lomwe ndi lozunzidwa ndi nkhondo, lakhala likuvutika kwambiri ndi mavuto a zachuma kuyambira pamene a Taliban analanda ulamuliro mu August chaka chatha. Bungwe la United Nations loona za umoyo wa anthu UNICEF likuyerekezera kuti ana 1 miliyoni osakwana zaka zisanu akhoza kufa ndi njala m'nyengo yozizira ino ngati sakuthandizidwa.

en: "This (index) presents a stark reminder of the material and immaterial damage that war does to its many victims," co-author Jan-Emmanuel De Neve said. The World Happiness Report, now in its 10th year, is based on people's own assessment of their happiness, as well as economic and social data.
ny: "Izi (zosonyeza kuti anthu ali ndi chimwemwe) ndi umboni wosatsutsika wa mavuto amene nkhondo imabweretsa kwa anthu ambiri", anatero Jan-Emmanuel De Neve, yemwe analemba nawo lipotili.

en: It assigns a happiness score on a scale of zero to 10, based on an average of data over a three-year period. This latest edition was completed before the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
ny: Bukuli limafotokoza mmene munthu amasangalalira, ndipo limafotokoza zimenezi pogwiritsa ntchito kafukufuku amene anachitika zaka zitatu zapitazo.

en: Northern Europeans once again dominated the top spots -- with the Danes second behind the Finns, followed by the Icelandic, the Swiss and the Dutch. The United States rose three places to 16th, one ahead of Britain, while France climbed to 20th, its highest ranking yet.
ny: Anthu a kumpoto kwa Ulaya ndi amene anali pamalo oyamba, ndipo anthu a ku Denmark ndi amene anali pamalo achiwiri pambuyo pa anthu a ku Finland, ndipo anthu a ku Iceland, Switzerland ndi ku Netherlands ndi amene anali pamalo achiwiri.

en: As well as a personal sense of wellbeing, based on Gallup polls in each country, the happiness score takes account of GDP, social support, personal freedom and levels of corruption.
ny: Kuwonjezera pa kumverera bwino kwa munthu, malinga ndi kafukufuku wa Gallup m'dziko lililonse, mfundo ya chimwemwe imakhudza GDP, thandizo la anthu, ufulu wa munthu ndi ziphuphu.

en: This year the authors also used data from social media to compare people's emotions before and after the Covid-19 pandemic. They found "strong increases in anxiety and sadness" in 18 countries but a fall in feelings of anger.
ny: Chaka chino, olembawo anagwiritsanso ntchito deta yochokera pa malo ochezera a pa Intaneti poyerekezera mmene anthu analili matenda a Covid-19 asanafike ndi pambuyo pake. Anapeza kuti "khalidwe la nkhawa ndi chisoni lawonjezeka kwambiri" m'mayiko 18, koma mkwiyo unatsika.

en: "The lesson of the World Happiness Report over the years is that social support, generosity to one another and honesty in government are crucial for wellbeing," report co-author Jeffrey Sachs wrote.
ny: "Phunziro la World Happiness Report kwa zaka zambiri ndilo lakuti chichirikizo cha anthu, kuwoloŵerana mtima ndi ena ndi kuona mtima m'boma nzothandiza kwambiri kuti munthu akhale ndi moyo wabwino", analemba motero Jeffrey Sachs, amene analemba nawo lipotilo.

en: "World leaders should take heed."
ny: "Atsogoleri a dziko ayenera kusamala".

en: The report raised some eyebrows when it first placed Finland at the top of its listings in 2018.
ny: Lipotili linadabwitsa kwambiri pamene linayamba kuika dziko la Finland pamwamba pa mndandanda wa mayiko amene ali ndi mayiko amenewa mu 2018.

en: Many of the Nordic country's 5.5 million people describe themselves as taciturn and prone to melancholy, and admit to eyeing public displays of joyfulness with suspicion.
ny: Ambiri mwa anthu mamiliyoni 5.5 a m'dziko la Nordic amadzifotokoza kukhala osalankhula ndi okonda kukhala achisoni, ndipo amavomereza kuti amaonerera mwachidwi anthu amene akusonyeza chimwemwe.

en: But the country of vast forests and lakes is also known for its well-functioning public services, ubiquitous saunas, widespread trust in authority and low levels of crime and inequality.
ny: Koma dziko la nkhalango ndi nyanja zazikulu limadziŵikanso ndi ntchito zake zabwino za boma, sauna zopezeka paliponse, kukhulupirira kwambiri ulamuliro ndi kuchepa kwa upandu ndi kusalingana.
